description: The Christian Democratic Union politician noted in a social media post that "Ukraine cannot lose its subjectivity or become a victim". "Any negotiations and agreements that will be concluded in the current situation would be detrimental to Ukraine's interests and would de facto mean its submission" - assessed Kiesewetter

title: A rare tank in service in Ukraine
description: The T-80UD (Object 478B) main battle tank was adopted by the USSR Armed Forces in 1987, it is a modification of the T-80U (Object 219AS) tank developed by the Leningrad Kirov Plant. The T-80UD was created at the Kharkov Morozov Machine-Building and Design Bureau, which operates at the Malyshev Plant. The T-80UD was modified in relation to the T-80U, by replacing the engine, instead of the GTD-1250 gas turbine generating 1250 hp, a two-stroke diesel engine with opposed pistons 6TD-1 was installed, generating 1000 hp. Additionally, the commander received a new observation cupola with a remotely controlled 1EC29M position for the NSWT large-caliber machine gun.

title: Latest AMRAAMs for Japan
description: The two versions of these radar-guided missiles are in question: the AIM-120D-3 and the AIM-120C-8. The potential allowable value of the contract is a maximum of $3.64 billion. The subject of the agreement is up to 1,200 AMRAAM missiles of both versions, up to 20 guidance sections of the D-3 version and four of the C-8 version. In addition, there are propulsion sections, warheads, training missiles and other elements of the logistics and training packages.

title: Marder at War: The "Workhorse" of Panzer Grenadiers Defends Ukraine
description: (Editor's note: The Marder 1 IFV was the basic armament of the German mechanized infantry, i.e. the panzer grenadiers, since the 1970s. It has now been partially replaced by the Puma IFV. Although the Germans scrapped or sold most of the over 2,000 vehicles originally produced for the Bundeswehr, some of the preserved vehicles are being transferred to Ukraine).

title: The Leaky Resistance Front and Trump: What Awaits Iran in 2025?
description: Just 12 months ago, the authorities of the Islamic Republic of Iran had reason to be pleased, as successes were noted in various areas, to a greater or lesser extent. The strategic partnership with Russia flourished, and Iranian drones were discussed in the media around the world. Relative peace reigned in Syria, and President Bashar al-Assad still held power there, seemingly unchallenged.

title: Taiwanese company helps Russia produce aircraft bombs
description: These modules allow for the conversion of a regular gravity-dropping aerial bomb into a precision gliding bomb. As reported by the intelligence group InformNapalm, citing Vadim Labas, a volunteer, the Taiwanese company TRC has made a large contribution to the production of control modules. TRC specializes in the production of suspension elements and parts used in the automotive industry. However, for some time now the Taiwanese company has been involved - consciously or not - in the production of Russian UMPK modules.

title: USA: 155mm Anti-Drone Guns Coming Soon
description: The U.S. Army's Rapid Capabilities and Critical Technologies Office (RCCTO) announced its intention to order prototypes of the 155 mm Multi-Domain Artillery Cannon (MDAC) and the Hypervelocity Projectile (HVP) projectile designed for it from BAE Systems Land & Armaments L.P. of Minneapolis.

title: Restless night in Russia and Ukraine. Drones and ATACAMS shot down
description: Russian authorities reported the downing of 72 Ukrainian drones and eight ATAMCS missiles on the night of Friday to Saturday (January 3-4). In turn, Ukrainian defense reported the downing of 34 of the 81 drones launched by Russia on the night of Friday to Saturday. Four civilians (residents of the Kherson region) were injured in the attacks. What happened to the remaining drones? According to the Ukrainian army, the remaining 47 drones "disappeared from radars thanks to electronic warfare systems".

title: Will the war in Ukraine last until 2027?
description: “I am analyzing not only Putin’s statements, but also the work of the Russian military-industrial complex, the country’s economic potential, and the emphasis on defense and continued military operations throughout 2025,” Kowalenko explained.

title: War of the paradoxes
description: The third year of the war is coming to an end, the rationalization of which poses a challenge even to Russian propaganda, and the number of paradoxes associated with it is by no means decreasing.

title: "New-Old" Speaker of the House of Representatives
description: Mike Johnson has been the Speaker of the House of Representatives since October 2023. In the vote that took place on Friday, January 3, he received 218 votes, which is exactly what the required absolute majority was. Johnson's main rival, Hakeem Jeffries (Democratic Party), received 215 votes. The new majority leader in the Senate is Senator John Thune from South Dakota.

title: The Last Dance at Ramstein
description: On Thursday, January 9, a meeting of countries involved in military support for Ukraine will take place at the American air base in Ramstein. This will be the last time that members of the administration of US President Joe Biden will participate in this format. The meeting in Ramstein will be chaired by the outgoing US Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin.

title: Prosecutor's Office: Investigation launched into Antoni Macierewicz's "diplomatic betrayal"
description: The accusation of "diplomatic treason" against the PiS politician and former head of the Ministry of National Defense was formulated by the head of the Military Counterintelligence Service, General Jarosław Stróżyk, in October, when he presented the report of the commission for the study of Russian and Belarusian influences, of which he is the head. At that time, he announced that the relevant documents had been forwarded to the prosecutor's office.

title: Gen. Mirosław Bodnar heads the Unmanned Systems Inspectorate
description: In an interview with Defence24.pl, MON spokesman Janusz Sejmej confirmed that Brig. Gen. Mirosław Bodnar has been appointed to the position of Unmanned Systems Inspector at the General Command of the Armed Forces. Formally, the Unmanned Systems Inspectorate has been operating since January 1 of this year, although of course its formation and creation of appropriate structures are still ongoing.

title: Another American armored brigade in Poland
description: In the port of Gdynia, the US Navy transport ship USNS "Red Cloud" has begun unloading heavy equipment belonging to the 1st Armored Brigade of the 3rd Infantry Division of the US Army. This division is one of the first to receive the latest equipment. In the photos, we can see, among others, M1A2SEPv3 Abrams main battle tanks and JLTV armored cars in various variants. The 1st Armored Brigade is also equipped with M2A4 Bradley infantry fighting vehicles and technically related vehicles from the AMPV family.

title: The patrolling Silesian transforms into a combat Rook
description: The document published on December 30, 2024 by the Armament Agency informs about the intention to carry out a thorough modernization of the ORP "Ślązak" patrol corvette, or more precisely: "to equip the ORP "Ślązak" patrol corvette with weapon systems and additional equipment". This entire operation is to be preceded by preliminary market consultations, which will later allow for the preparation of a description of the subject of the order, and therefore also for determining the required budget. The Armament Agency has set a high pace in this respect, because entities interested in participating in the program have time to submit the necessary documentation only until January 17, 2025.

title: Kamikaze drones in the 1st Warsaw Armored Brigade
description: The training organized in the 1st Warsaw Armored Brigade covered a number of issues related to FPV platforms. As the unit reports via social media, soldiers trained in, among other things, piloting, construction, and attacking. The exercises discussed "independent construction and repair, correct flight technique, performing kamikaze combat flights and remote launching of charges, organization of work of the drone section, use of drones in conditions of counteracting the enemy's EW."

title: Ammunition directed to Langusta and Homar
description: The Polish Army uses 75 WR-40 Langusta multiple rocket launchers and a number of Soviet BM-21 Grad and Czechoslovak RM-70/85. The latter two will be completely replaced in the next few years by the much more modern Homary-K and Homary-A. According to the plans of the Ministry of National Defense, both of the above systems are to be integrated with the Polish 122 mm Feniks-Z ammunition. **This family of combat assets will therefore be used in the Polish Army for many decades,** which is a contribution to its modernization. Such a proposal was presented by the Warsaw University of Technology during the International Artillery Conference.

title: Sabotage disrupted ammunition supplies
description: The guerrillas carried out sabotage on January 2, 2025, on the line near the town of Stara Toropa. This line is used to transport ammunition from two depots of the Main Missile and Artillery Directorate of the Russian Defense Ministry (GRAU) - the 23rd and 107th.

title: Ślązak OPV Transforms into Gawron Surface Combatant
description: Documentation published on 30th December, 2024, by the Armament Agency outlines plans for a thorough modernization of the ORP Ślązak patrol corvette, specifically stating: “retrofitting the ORP Ślązak patrol corvette with weapon systems and additional equipment.” This operation is set to be preceded by preliminary market consultations, which will enable the preparation of procurement specifications and determine the required budget. The Armament Agency has set a tight schedule, giving interested parties until January 17, 2025, to submit the necessary documentation.

title: NATO's Nuclear Deterrence Against Russia [Interview]
description: The nuclear policies of major powers have been widely discussed in recent months, highlighting the growing importance of NATO’s strategy in the face of modern competition. While the Alliance remains committed to pursuing a world without nuclear weapons, the current security environment compels it to maintain and reinforce deterrence to counter the ambitions of Russia, China, and other states expanding their nuclear arsenals. NATO also opposes the weaponization of outer space, warning against the destabilizing effects such actions could have on global security. Despite Russia’s modernization of its nuclear arsenal and attempts to use coercion and nuclear blackmail, NATO continues to strengthen its defensive capabilities.

title: East Front News #26: Polish Presidency, Year 2024 in Africa and Middle East and Big Artillery Purchases for Poland
description: East Front News is a weekly newsletter summarizing the past week’s most important events concerning security and the situation in the Central and Eastern Europe region. It includes original opinions and comments, along with key news items significant from a Polish perspective. If you would like to receive this newsletter, please sign up by clicking**  <button class="btn btn-primary btn-sm" type="button"> HERE </button>**.

title: Defence Budget as an Element of Civilian Oversight of the Military
description: One of the principles of democratic civilian control over the military is the standard that government and parliament set and oversee military spending. This principle is elaborated in greater detail in Guidebook on the Essential Principles of Democratic Control of the Armed Forces by A. Fałkowski and V. R. Ratchev (OSCE, 2024).

title: Africa and the Middle East - 2024 Summary
description: At the end of 2024, Defence24 traditionally reviews the most important events in Africa and the Middle East. These volatile regions once again found themselves at the center of global attention. Although it was not a peaceful year, a full-scale conflict involving NATO countries was avoided. Below, we present the 10 most significant events of the past 12 months.

title: Polish Navy Acquires Rescue Ship, Based on PLN 1 bn. Contract
description: An agreement between the Armaments Agency and a consortium consisting of Polska Grupa Zbrojeniowa, PGZ Stocznia Wojenna, and OBR CTM was signed on Friday at the Naval Academy in Gdynia. The contract covers the acquisition of a rescue ship, codenamed Ratownik, along with a logistics support package. The value of the contract exceeds 1 billion zlotys gross. The vessel, which will join the 3rd Ships Flotilla, is expected to be delivered by 2029.

title: Aerial Cover for the Homar-K System
description: The contract covers the acquisition of 12 sets of unmanned aerial systems for the fire support modules of the Homar-K battalions. The systems will be used for reconnaissance and air cover of the elements’ area of operations.  The total value of the order exceeds 499 million PLN gross, with deliveries scheduled between 2025 and 2028.

title: Tytan System Radio Approved
description: Brigadier General Artur Kuptel, Head of the Armament Agency, approved the decision that formally ends the qualification tests. This solution was developed by the companies of the WB Group as part of the “Tytan Advanced Individual Combat Equipment Set” research and development work.

title: Krab Howitzers and Beyond. Record-breaking Contracts for Stalowa Wola
description: The first contract concerns the delivery of 96 Krab howitzers to the Polish Army for four battery fire modules, Regina. Each module consists of 24 howitzers. The first two modules, i.e., 48 howitzers, will be delivered in the existing configuration.

title: Legwan Vehicles Arrive in Morąg
description: The unit announced the arrival of the new equipment through its social media channels.

title: Oracle Cloud Isolated Region– A Solution Dedicated to Defence
description: _Sponsored article_*

title: Attacks on governments and companies. Protection used by NATO troops
description: _Sponsored material_

title: East Front News #25: Poland Orders Armored Vehicles and Rifles, Strategic Continuity, New Drone Capabilities
description: East Front News is a weekly newsletter summarizing the past week’s most important events concerning security and the situation in the Central and Eastern Europe region. It includes original opinions and comments, along with key news items significant from a Polish perspective. If you would like to receive this newsletter, please sign up by clicking**  <button class="btn btn-primary btn-sm" type="button"> HERE </button>**.

title: How Many ZSSW-30 Turrets Are Produced Annually?
description: The ZSSW-30 unmanned turrets are already being procured by the Ministry of National Defence (MON). According to representatives of WB Group, a member of the consortium manufacturing these turrets, if more vehicles intended to mount them were ordered, the scale of these procurements could significantly increase.

title: Polish Wisła Air Defence System Reaches Initial Operational Readiness
description: On Wednesday, the Minister of National Defence, Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz, announced that he had received a report confirming the initial readiness of the Wisła system and its integration with the IBCS (Integrated Battle Command System).

title: Gladius Program Updates
description: The battery module of the BSP-U system includes: A BSP (UAV) platoon consisting of six Waran vehicles (three command vehicles and three launcher vehicles), and Two BSP-U (UAV-strike) platoons, each equipped with one Waran-based command vehicle and four launcher vehicles. In total, the system comprises of five Waran vehicles in the command variant, and eleven Waran vehicles equipped with unmanned munitions launchers.

title: Munitions for Homar-K With Prospective Export Opportunities
description: Polish ammunition plants, which will produce rockets for the Chunmoo (Homar-K) system, are set to be established by 2029 as part of a joint venture between Poland’s WB Group and South Korea’s Hanwha Aerospace, according to WB Group CEO Piotr Wojciechowski. He made the announcement during a press briefing at the company’s headquarters in Warsaw. The formal agreement for this collaboration was signed at the KADEX (Korea Army International Defense Industry Exhibition) on 2nd October, 2024. The entire project will be financed by WB Group’s own resources, though it will include „significant Korean contributions.” Bilateral negotiations are currently underway to finalize the details of the partnership, with an expected conclusion in June or July 2025.

title: 80 New Rosomaks: Agreement Signed with an Option for More
description: On Monday afternoon, the Ministry of National Defence announced plans to acquire dozens of brand-new Rosomak-L armored personnel carriers, equipped with the ZSSW-30 remotely controlled turret system.

title: What Does Russia Want? What Must Happen for the War in Ukraine to End?
description: In recent weeks, discussions about a potential resolution to the war have intensified, especially following Donald Trump’s election as the 47th President of the United States, which has undoubtedly accelerated the process. Media reports on various proposals for a ceasefire might suggest that a Russian-Ukrainian agreement is within reach. However, the lack of concrete solutions rooted in realistic possibilities and the significant discrepancies between both sides make any major diplomatic breakthrough unlikely in the near future, especially given that official negotiations between Russia and Ukraine are nonexistent.

title: The Workhorse of the Air Force to Be Modernized. Contract Signed
description: The contract covers modernization work on 16 aircraft, valued at EUR 102.7 million.  The upgrades shall be carried out between 2025 and 2033. This agreement will enable, among other improvements, equipping the C-295M transport fleet with modern avionics systems and enhancing their operational capabilities.

title: One Year of Tusk’s Government. Gen. Koziej: Strategic Continuity Maintained at the Ministry of Defence
description: This continuity is highly praised by retired Brigadier General Stanisław Koziej, former head of the National Security Bureau (BBN) and deputy defence minister, now an academic lecturer.  He notes, however, that procurement should be reviewed regarding the volume of orders, and plans should be adjusted if necessary. He highlights the cessation of using the military for partisan politics and improved relations between the MoD and the president’s BBN as significant positives. The lack of updated strategic documents, however, is a notable shortfall.

title: Poland – Morocco: Untapped Potential for Cooperation
description: The outbreak of the largest European war since the conflict of 1939-1945 marked a wake-up call for many nations and their policymakers. Since 2022, Polish foreign policy and diplomacy have been primarily focused on Eastern Europe and issues directly or indirectly linked to the Russian-Ukrainian war. This focus was evident in the 2024 policy address by Polish Foreign Minister Radosław Sikorski, where other global regions (apart from the Indo-Pacific) were mentioned only briefly. However, in competing with Moscow, it is crucial to engage partners located thousands of kilometers away from Warsaw. Morocco, the most pro-Western country in North Africa, is one such partner.

title: New Round for the Rak Mortar as the Key to Effective Training
description: Can training on the M120K Rak self-propelled mortars be made cheaper and simpler? The Military Institute of Armament Technology (WITU) proposed a new training solution during the International Artillery Conference in Toruń.

title: The Fall of Syria: A Painful Blow to Iran
description: “Syria is Iran’s 35th province, a strategic province for us. If we were attacked and forced to choose between Syria and Khuzestan, our priority would be to hold Syria. If we keep Syria, we can retake Khuzestan, but if we lose Syria, we won’t be able to keep Tehran.” This statement was made in 2013 by Hojjat al-Islam Mehdi Taeb, an Iranian analyst and head of the pro-government Ammar think tank.  At the time, Iran was building its influence in the region, with saving Assad from collapse as its primary goal.

title: East Front News #24: Macron in Poland, The War for the Sahel, American-made Unmanned Systems for the Polish Military
description: East Front News is a weekly newsletter summarizing the past week’s most important events concerning security and the situation in the Central and Eastern Europe region. It includes original opinions and comments, along with key news items significant from a Polish perspective. If you would like to receive this newsletter, please sign up by clicking**  <button class="btn btn-primary btn-sm" type="button"> HERE </button>**.

title: The End of Syria as We Know It
description: At the time of writing, rumors of Assad’s death remain unconfirmed, but it appears he did not reach Latakia (by the time of publication, the Russian news agency TASS reported that Assad had been granted asylum in Moscow - editor’s note). Indications suggest that the Alawites chose not to resist in the coastal strip encompassing Latakia and Tartus, where Russian bases are located. Does this mark the end of Russia’s presence in Syria? Possibly, though much depends on agreements between Russia and Turkey. Even if such agreements exist, Russia may still lose these bases if other factions, particularly Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), reject them. While most Syrians harbor negative views of Russia, many are equally opposed to the prospect of their country being dominated by Turkey and its pro-Turkish jihadists from the Syrian National Army (SNA), which, unlike HTS, is notorious for looting, lack of discipline, and atrocities.  This bolsters HTS’s chances of dominance despite its jihadist origins linked to al-Qaeda. Regardless of how the issue of Russia’s military presence in Syria is resolved, the current situation can be exploited both by and against Russia, propaganda-wise. On one hand, if the worst-case scenario (massacres, chaos, factional warfare) unfolds, Russia will blame the West as the supposed architect of these events. On the other, pro-Russian authoritarian regimes, particularly Iran and Shia forces in Iraq (persuaded by Russian ambassador Kutrashev’s propaganda), should receive a clear message: Russia is an unreliable ally, and relying on it is a mistake.

title: American-made Unmanned Systems for the Polish Military
description: The agreement is valued at approximately $310 million net, equivalent to over 1.2 billion PLN. The exact number of MQ-9Bs purchased, as well as their specific configuration, equipment, and armament, have not been disclosed.

title: WZL Nr 1 S.A. is Looking for Professionals
description: _Sponsored content_

title: PONAR Defence – A New Brand by PONAR Wadowice SA
description: At the MSPO 2024 trade fair in Kielce on September 4, 2024, during a press conference, PONAR WADOWICE SA showcased its latest initiatives in defence by unveiling a new brand.  The brand, PONAR DEFENCE, was established in response to the growing demand for cutting-edge specialized solutions in the defense industry.

title: Macron in Poland: Is Poland at the Heart of Macron?
description: The President of France arrives for a visit to meet with Prime Minister Donald Tusk. There are numerous topics of mutual interest, but the priority is to discuss the outcomes of recent meetings with U.S. President-elect Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky. Additionally, the visit aims to establish common priorities for Paris and Warsaw in the context of Poland’s presidency of the European Union. Discussions on the soon-to-occur deployment of Polish troops to Ukrainian territory are not planned. Macron is currently focused on assuming the role of Europe’s security leader before Trump does.

title: Police brag about investments. "It was a record year"
description: According to data published by the Police Headquarters, last year's most important investments included the purchase of **over 2,000 vehicles**, including 1,291 passenger cars, 395 vans and 213 off-road vehicles. The total value of the vehicle purchases amounted to approximately **PLN 576.6 million**. "This is almost twice as much as in 2023 (in 2023, 1,048 pieces of transport equipment worth PLN 237.9 million were purchased)" - we read on the KGP website.

title: "Odem" is a school for future spies. Israel is focusing on young people
description: As Robert Morton writes on Medium.com in his article “Training Future Spies: How Israel and the CIA are Shaping Young Agents,” “Odem” is an **elite program** designed for students as young as ninth grade. It is a joint venture between the **Ministry of Defense**, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF), the Ministry of Education**, and two leading intelligence agencies: **Mossad** (foreign intelligence) and **Shin Bet** (domestic security service). The aim of the project is to train young people in technology, strategic thinking, and analytical skills so that in a few years they will be able to join the Israeli intelligence apparatus without any problems.

title: "We are not able to solve all the problems at once". Minister of Interior and Administration on the services' protest, "housing" and the staffing situation [INTERVIEW]
description: **Dominik Mikołajczyk: Poland has taken over the presidency of the Council of the European Union. What actions do you expect in the matter of internal security?**

title: Cars for PLN 60 million. SG complements the fleet
description: As reported by the Border Guard, **60 vehicles were purchased as part of the project "Creation of mobile Border Guard infrastructure enabling response in crisis situations**" co-financed from the National Recovery and Resilience Plan. These are 30 Toyota Hilux vehicles (value approx. PLN 8.8 million) and 30 Skoda Karoq with 4x4 drive (value approx. PLN 6.7 million).

title: Investigators look into criminal activities in Ukrainian brigade trained in France
description: "The State Bureau of Investigation is investigating the facts presented in the media as part of the criminal proceedings initiated under articles on abuse of power and desertion," AFP quotes Tetiana Sapian, spokeswoman for the State Bureau of Investigation, as saying.

title: Counterintelligence tasks in the era of modern threats
description: Contemporary realities show that **old patterns, derived from the Cold War, have eroded**. The importance of non-state actors has increased, and conflicts are evolving towards hybrid operations conducted in the so-called gray zone. Therefore, as Shane McNeil emphasizes in the text Gray Zone Warfare: How Counterintelligence Must Adapt to Modern Threats, the role of counterintelligence must be redefined and adapted to the new realities.

title: Terrorism in Europe is still a problem
description: In 2023, a total of 120 terrorist attacks were recorded in the EU, of which 98 were successful, 9 were unsuccessful and 13 were foiled. This is a significant increase compared to previous years. Separatist groups remained the most active (70 attacks), followed by far-left and anarchist groups (32 attacks) and jihadists (14 attacks). **Jihadist terrorism was the deadliest, causing 6 deaths and 12 injuries**.

title: Civil protection and civil defense are becoming a fact
description: The Act on the Protection of the Population and Civil Defense is one of those projects that the Polish security system has been waiting for for years. After a year of work in the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the government and the parliament, the document was signed by the president in mid-December. In accordance with the assumptions, **the act entered into force on January 1, 2025**.

title: Police recruitment in numbers
description: The Police Headquarters has summed up this year's recruitment. "**This year, 6,411 people have joined the ranks** (in 2022 - 5,140, ​​and in 2023 - 5,158)" - the Police Headquarters reported. It added that on Monday, December 30, 1,282 new officers took the oath.

title: New Orleans Shooter Likely Didn't Act Alone: ​​FBI Says He's an ISIS Sympathizer
description: In a statement, the FBI confirmed the identity of the perpetrator, previously reported by the American media. "The perpetrator was identified as 42-year-old Shamsud Din Jabbar, **a US citizen from Texas** (…) An Islamic State flag was found in (his - editor's note) vehicle, and the FBI is working to determine the perpetrator's potential links and affiliation with terrorist organizations," it said. **A weapon and two explosive devices were found in the perpetrator's car, which were neutralized.** Other potential explosive devices were also found in the French Quarter of New Orleans, a popular tourist destination.

title: What were you “reading” in 2024?
description: [**1. Budget approved. Pay rises with compensation, but without a "compensation mechanism"**](https://infosecurity24.pl/sluzby-mundurowe/budzet-uchwalony-podwyzki-z-wyrownaniem-ale-bez-mechanizmu-kompensujacego)

title: The Ministry of Interior and Administration changes police names. Number instead of surname
description: The discussion on replacing the name with a surname with a service number in the largest uniformed service in Poland, which has been going on for a good few years, is coming to an end. On Monday afternoon - prepared by the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Administration - the regulation on police uniforms was **published in the Journal of Laws**. According to the assumptions, the document enters into force on the day following the day of announcement.

title: What were the services living through in 2024?
description: In the uniformed services, special services and broadly understood internal security - it is safe to say that 2024 was a time of change. It is also no wonder, because after 8 years of the United Right's rule, at the end of 2023 the so-called October 15 Coalition took over the reins of the country, which included the Civic Coalition, Poland 2050, the Polish People's Party and the New Left. Along with the new government headed by Donald Tusk, new changes also took place, including in the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Administration, the Ministry of Justice, as well as in the uniformed services and special services. **So what did this year, which is already leaving, 2024 look like?**

title: Firefighters have completed the rescue operation in the collapsed tenement house
description: During a night press briefing, the head of the State Fire Service, Senior Brigadier Mariusz Feltynowski, informed that the rescue phase at the site of the disaster that occurred on Sunday morning in Cieszyn has been completed. "After 9 p.m., one person was located on the second floor on the outside, who was extracted and transferred to a tent for further police and prosecutor's activities. At 11:10 p.m., the second person was found," informed the Chief Commandant of the State Fire Service. He noted that there were no signs of life in these people. "**The bodies were transferred for further legal proceedings**," he added.

title: A three-story tenement house collapsed in Cieszyn. The head of the State Fire Service is on site
description: The Chief Commander of the State Fire Service explained that rescue dogs cannot be brought in there because the surface of the rubble is very hot as a result of the fire. He added that the top floor is currently being removed. **Firefighters are also using thermal imaging cameras**.

title: Attempts to damage infrastructure in the Baltic Sea. "They may be an element of hybrid warfare"
description: According to Anja Dalgaard-Nielsen, head of the Danish military intelligence department at FE, "we must be prepared for Russia to move its borders". "Perhaps not in a geographical sense, but by using all means of **hybrid and sabotage** that can be used without activating NATO Article 5 and regular war," Dalgaard-Nielsen noted in mid-December in connection with the publication of a report on threats.

title: Busy holidays for firefighters. They intervened more than 2.4 thousand times
description: The State Fire Service has summarized its activities during this year's Christmas. According to data published by the State Fire Service on December 24-26, 2024, **firefighters intervened 2,423 times, including 689 fires, 1,436 local threats and 298 false alarms**. "The largest number of incidents took place in the Masovian Voivodeship (313), Silesian Voivodeship (310), Lower Silesian Voivodeship (244), Lesser Poland Voivodeship (206) and Greater Poland Voivodeship (188)" - said the spokesman for the Chief Commandant of the State Fire Service, Senior Brigadier Karol Kierzkowski.

title: Pyrotechnic "gifts" for the Border Guard
description: Border Guard officers reported on their websites about the new pyrotechnic equipment. "At the Mazury air border crossing in Szymany, the governor of the Warmian-Masurian Voivodeship, Radosław Król, handed over a **pyrotechnic ambulance** to Border Guard officers," we read in a statement published by the Warmian-Masurian Border Guard Division.

title: Current "trends" in the European drug market
description: The European Drug Trends Monitor analyses data on the illegal drug market in Antwerp, Barcelona, ​​Bucharest, Eindhoven, Hamburg, Istanbul, Kiev, London, Marseille, Milan and Stockholm. The information that became the source of the document comes from field research, data obtained from police services, as well as from media and seizure reports. It also takes into account monitoring of drug trade on social media and the so-called darknet. The report focuses on **two groups of substances that pose the greatest risk - opioids and cocaine and crack**.

title: New bill in SW? "A team has been appointed to prepare it"
description: It has been known for some time that the **Ministry of Internal Affairs and Administration is working on legal solutions regarding housing benefits modeled on those applicable in the military**. "Officers of services subordinate to the Minister of Internal Affairs and Administration will have the right to choose the form of accommodation for the duration of their service. One of the planned forms is the payment of a housing benefit in the amount of the product of a specific rate and a housing benefit coefficient depending on the place of service," the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Administration informed last week.

title: France fights radicalization of prisoners
description: French prisons, together with the justice system, offer a support system for prisoners accused of or convicted of terrorism, as well as those identified as radicalized. This means that the project is carried out not only in prisons, but also in the prisoners' family homes or in places chosen by the court. The main objective is to create conditions in which **the prisoner rejects violence and the desire to integrate with terrorists by participating in individualized behavioral monitoring**, with the involvement of a social support group (social workers, psychologists, psychiatrists, educators, as well as researchers and religious scholars), and in exceptional cases also family and loved ones.

title: The Ministry of Interior and Administration wants to introduce a temporary ban on carrying weapons in Gdańsk
description: On Monday, a draft regulation of the Ministry of Interior and Administration on the introduction of a temporary ban on carrying weapons and moving them unloaded was published on the website of the Government Legislation Centre. "The introduction of a temporary ban on carrying weapons or moving them unloaded is justified by the need to ensure an appropriate level of security during the visit of the College of EU Commissioners to the city of Gdańsk on 9-10 January 2025" - we read in the justification of the draft regulation.

title: How should the Police deal with drone "pirates"?
description: The regulations governing the use of drones in Polish airspace are in fact dead. In this area, we are in a situation that would occur after the introduction of the Highway Code, without giving the Police the tools to enforce its respect. Life shows that some drivers, even those who have passed exams and have the appropriate documents, do not respect traffic rules, and the only thing that stops them from notorious "road piracy" is the existence of radars and police patrols.

title: The head of the FSB military counterintelligence resigned
description: The main official reason, indicated in the media and by anonymous sources close to the FSB, is that Yuryev has reached retirement age. He turned 65 on November 25, 2024, which – according to the customs prevailing in the FSB – may be a critical moment for many officers holding the highest positions in the Ministry of Security.

title: RARS donated police helicopters to Ukraine
description: The Government Agency for Strategic Reserves announced the transfer of police helicopters to Ukraine on its website. "As part of cooperation with the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Administration and the Military Property Agency, implementing the decision of the Minister of Internal Affairs and Administration, the Government Agency for Strategic Reserves transferred to Ukraine, as part of its assistance, **three helicopters from the Police property**" - we read in the RARS statement.

title: A car drove into a crowd of people at a Christmas market in Germany.
description: The incident occurred on Friday evening in Magdeburg, in eastern Germany. "A car drove into a group of people," a spokesman for the Saxony-Anhalt government told MDR. Emergency services and the fire brigade are at the scene.

title: The police are returning home. Operation “Zapora” is over
description: The Police Headquarters reported on its website the end of the police operation "Zapora" on the border with Belarus. "On December 19, 2024, after more than 3 years, the police operation "Zapora" ended on the border with Belarus. Police officers delegated from the country to support the activities of the Border Guard and the Polish Army are returning to their units to ensure the internal security of our country and local communities. **over 300 officers of the Podlasie Police** will continue to serve on site," the Police Headquarters reported.

title: Police helicopter goes to museum
description: The transfer of the Mi-2 police helicopter by the Police Headquarters in Warsaw took place on Monday, December 16. "The machine with the serial number 534419095 was used by the Police Aviation Section of the Police Headquarters of the Provincial Police Headquarters in Wrocław **from September 2009 to August 2020**. Previously, it served in the Border Guard as a multi-task machine. While carrying out air missions in Poland, the helicopter spent a total of 4,763 hours in the air - that is, over 198 days and nights," we read in a press release from the Polish Aviation Museum in Krakow.

title: Unionists met with the management of the Ministry of Interior and Administration. Talks are ongoing, but there is no breakthrough
description: If anyone expected Thursday's meeting at the Ministry of Interior and Administration to be groundbreaking, they may feel disappointed. The unionists themselves emphasize that "the meeting agenda included only two items - housing benefits and the uniform card." **However, there was no discussion about the new modernization program, nor about the pay scale or progression of benefits. **

title: More apartments for Warsaw police officers
description: It has been known for a long time that the housing problem is one of the most serious problems of the police officers of the Warsaw Police Headquarters. This was mentioned by, among others, **the head of the Warsaw Police, inspector Dariusz Walichnowski**. [In a conversation with InfoSecurity24.pl](https://infosecurity24.pl/sluzby-mundurowe/policja/brak-25-tysiaca-ludzi-raczej-mnie-ogranicza-niz-pozwala-na-rozwoj-szef-ksp-o-wakatach-i-bolaczkach-stolecznej-policji), the inspector emphasized that he is aware that "**the external market will give more money to a lawyer than the Police is able to offer him**".

title: Budget returns to the Sejm, but indexation remains unchanged
description: The result of today's vote means that **next year's indexation of salaries will amount to 5 percent.** Although trade unionists - including those operating in services subordinate to the Ministry of Interior and Administration - convinced MPs and senators to increase this indicator, **the government was consistently opposed to the idea, and both the lower and upper houses of parliament followed suit.**

title: More vehicles for military firefighters
description: In total, within the framework of the commenced deliveries, seven medium, three heavy and eight airport (heavy) rescue and firefighting vehicles are to be delivered to military firefighters. All of them are modern vehicles that meet the requirements of the ordering party and the future user. Let us recall that the Military Fire Protection units are responsible for fire protection in units subordinate to the Minister of National Defence, carrying out a wide range of tasks, both typical for the State Fire Service and special obligations resulting from the functioning of the Polish Armed Forces.

title: Is Poland ready for the end of the war in Ukraine?
description: There are currently four possible scenarios for the final outcome of the war between Russia and Ukraine: a long war, a frozen conflict, a Ukrainian victory, and a Ukrainian defeat. Regardless of which of them comes true, far-reaching and traumatic social, sociological, economic, and political consequences will be inevitable. Every war affects the emotions of society, everyday life, public opinion, interpersonal relations, the socio-economic situation, the labor market, and civic activity. Ukraine will have to face these challenges after the end of hostilities in order to maintain the unity of the country, strengthen institutions, and rebuild the economy. These problems may prove more difficult to overcome than the war itself, and their consequences will be felt not only in Ukraine but also in neighboring countries, especially Poland.

title: New livery of SG Turbolets. The planes are already in Poland [NEWS INFOSECURITY24]
description: The purchase of two Turbolet reconnaissance aircraft, carried out by the Border Guard, was not easy from the start. The first tender had to be cancelled because no one was willing to carry out the deliveries. After some time, the formation launched another procedure, during which one offer was submitted from the consortium of AERO CLUB and JB INVESTMENTS. Importantly, their offer was within the amount that the Border Guard intended to pay for the two aircraft - the offer amounted to PLN 119,999,784.00 - while the budget was exactly PLN 120 million. **The contract was finally signed on May 24**.

title: Civil protection signed by the president
description: Work on the act on the protection of the population and defense is coming to an end in great strides. After the document passed through parliament at an express pace, **President Andrzej Duda put his signature under it**.

title: Investigators will examine the management of the Prison Service
description: The Regional Prosecutor's Office in Poznań announced the establishment of an investigative team in a press release published on Wednesday. "National Prosecutor Dariusz Korneluk, by Order of December 10, 2024, established an investigative team in the Regional Prosecutor's Office in Poznań to examine the legality, justification and cost-effectiveness of actions taken in **the years 2015-2023 in connection with the management of the Prison Service**" - we read.

title: Black powder guns "under the microscope" of the Ministry of Interior and Administration. Are changes in regulations getting closer?
description: The fact that the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Administration had already taken the first steps towards changes in the possession of black powder weapons was reported in mid-September. At that time – by decision of the deputy head of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Administration Czesław Mroczek – **an expert working team** began its work. It included representatives of the ministry as well as police officers from, among others, the Police Headquarters, the Voivodeship and Warsaw Police Headquarters and the Central Forensic Laboratory of the Police.

title: A manual on civil protection in every home. "We will be ready with this in April"
description: On Tuesday, a press conference was held at the headquarters of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Administration with the participation of the Minister of Internal Affairs and Administration, Coordinator of Special Services Tomasz Siemoniak and Deputy Prime Minister, Minister of National Defence Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz.

title: Explosions ordered by Russia. Sabotage carried out by two teenagers
description: The SBU reported that on December 8 and 9, two 15-year-olds, acting on the instructions of the Russian special services, detonated explosive devices near police stations in the Sloboda and Kholodnohirsky districts of Kharkiv.

title: The Ministry of Interior and Administration reveals its cards regarding population protection training
description: The Act on Population Protection and Civil Defense is nearing the end of its legislative work. The document is waiting for the signature of President Andrzej Duda. As soon as this happens - for the act to become binding law - it will be published in the Journal of Laws. As it turns out, however, the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Administration does not intend to wait and is already preparing implementing acts for the document. On the Government Legislation Center website, a **draft regulation on training programs in the field of population protection and civil defense and requirements for entities conducting training** has been published.

title: The Uniformed Officer's Library - Our Book Suggestions
description: Winter evenings don't have to be boring! With the BookBeat app you can fill your time with fascinating books. We have prepared a list of TOP 7 titles that every uniformed officer should know.

title: Services, however, without operational work code. "Work has been postponed"
description: On Monday, a press conference of the ministry's management was held in the building of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Administration, during which Tomasz Siemoniak **summed up the actions taken in the first year of the government and informed about the plans for 2025**. Among the topics was the draft of the operational work code announced by the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Administration.

title: Operational control "in a new way". "The conclusions will have to be much broader than before"
description: "A very important decision by Prime Minister Donald Tusk, raising the level of protection of civil rights and freedoms. Prosecutors and judges will now have full knowledge of the tools and scope of operational control conducted by special services," wrote Tomasz Siemoniak, head of the Ministry of Interior and Administration, coordinator of special services, on platform X.

title: Does the police need a new law? Chief Superintendent Boroń: I think it is necessary today
description: **Dominik Mikołajczyk: The NSZZ Police Officers' Union has announced the start of a protest. Do you think the expectations of officers are excessive? I mean, among other things, a 15% pay rise in 2025?**

title: The penal code needs to be changed
description: **[Cybercriminals and scammers](https://cyberdefence24.pl/armia-i-sluzby/oszustwo-na-pracownika-banku-wyludzili-3-mln-zlotych) are looking for new and new ways to trick us**. To do this, they use various techniques and modern technologies, seeing this as a chance for success in their actions. Examples include **[spoofing](https://cyberdefence24.pl/cyberbezpieczenstwo/czym-jest-spoofing-i-gdzie-zglosic-ataki)** or **fraud based on [deepfakes](https://cyberdefence24.pl/technologie/cybermagazyn-deepfake-ekspertka-radzi-jak-nie-dac-sie-oszukac)**.

title: The Border Guard has been enriched with two new hovercrafts
description: On December 11, at the Kashubian Border Guard Division base in Stara Pasłęka on the Vistula Lagoon, a christening ceremony and first flag-raising ceremony took place for two SG-413 and SG-414 Griffon 2000 TD hovercraft. They are intended for operations in the aforementioned water area, through which the Polish border with the Russian Federation runs.

title: Warnings instead of tickets, demonstration and "health prevention". This is how police officers will protest
description: The protest announced a week ago by the NSZZ Policemen has already been joined by firefighters from the NSZZ "Solidarność", and uniformed officers from the NSZZ Officers of the Border Guard have expressed their readiness to start the action. **The protest therefore has a chance of gaining a size comparable to the action from 2018, which - as one can assume - both sides would prefer to avoid.**

title: The fifth wave of organized crime is coming
description: Dr. Phil Williams' report was published in November. The author notes at the outset that the evolution of organized crime should be considered in relation to David Rapoport's work "The four waves of modern terrorism." He showed how terrorism evolved in the context of significant political, economic, and technological changes at the local and global levels. Although his theory has been questioned and modified many times, it remains convincing.

title: Santa's Joy Patrol
description: Soldiers made the little hero's dream come true

title: Military Police Communique
description: The circumstances of the incident in Mielnik, during which a soldier opened fire on a civilian car, are under investigation. The soldier has been charged with attempted murder, criminal threats …

title: Christmas wishes from the Commander-in-Chief of the Military Gendarmerie
description: On the occasion of Christmas, I would like to extend my warmest wishes of health and prosperity to all soldiers, former soldiers and employees of the Military Police. May this be a time spent …

title: Christmas VTC with gendarmes serving in Polish military contingents
description: Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Military Gendarmerie, Lt. Col. Edyta Korolczuk, conveyed Christmas wishes on behalf of the Commander-in-Chief of the Military Gendarmerie, Col. Tomasz Kajzer, to the gendarmes serving in …

title: Christmas Eve meeting of the gendarmes
description: A Christmas Eve meeting was held at the Military Gendarmerie Headquarters, during which the Commander-in-Chief of the Military Gendarmerie, Col. Tomasz Kajzer, extended Christmas and New Year wishes to soldiers, former …

title: 1st Seminar on Computer Forensics of the Military Police
description: On December 9–13, 2024, in the town of Karwice, with the organizational support of the Military Gendarmerie Branch in Szczecin, the 1st Gendarmerie Computer Forensics Seminar was organized …

title: The Military Police's effective fight against drug addiction
description: On December 10, 2024, in Krakow, as a result of coordinated actions of the Military Police and the Central Police Investigation Bureau initiated by soldiers of the Military Police Branch in Krakow, …

title: "Security, Europe!" – ceremonial opening of the Polish presidency of the EU Council
description: "Security, Europe!" - the slogan of the Polish presidency resounded today with particular solemnity in the building of the Grand Theatre - National Opera, where the opening ceremony of the Polish presidency of the EU Council took place. The floor was taken during the ceremony by Prime Minister Donald Tusk and the President of the European Council Antonio Costa, with whom the head of government had previously met in the Chancellery of the Prime Minister. The signposts that will help Poland lead Europe towards a stable future are the 7 pillars of security.

title: Prime Minister: 2025 will be a year of positive breakthrough
description: During the last meeting of the Council of Ministers in 2024, Donald Tusk summed up the past year, pointing out the challenges it brought, and announced key changes in the upcoming 2025. He emphasized the importance of security, economic development, and Poland's leadership in Europe. The Prime Minister assured that the next year will be a time of positive breakthrough and building success that will be felt by all citizens.

title: Christmas wishes from the Prime Minister before the Council of Ministers meeting
description: Prime Minister Donald Tusk conveyed wishes of peace and a sense of security to all Polish families on behalf of the entire government. He also addressed wishes to all those who are on duty or working during Christmas Eve. He asked that during this special time, everyday worries, including politics, be put aside.

title: Poland will lead Europe in difficult times – the Polish presidency is about to start
description: Poland is ready to lead Europe towards security and economic competitiveness – Prime Minister Donald Tusk assured in Brussels just before the beginning of the Polish presidency of the EU Council. The takeover of the presidency comes after Hungary and according to the Prime Minister it is a symbol of change and great hope of the entire EU for a democratic and secure future of the continent. Donald Tusk also referred to the Hungarian decision to grant asylum to Marcin Romanowski.

title: Prime Minister at the European Council Summit: Security, Migration and Support for Ukraine
description: It was a serious conversation about politics, very sincere – this is how Prime Minister Donald Tusk summed up the talks that took place during today's meeting of the European Council in Brussels. The meeting was chaired by the new head of the European Council, António Costa, and was an opportunity to discuss the key challenges facing the European Union. Among the most important topics were the situation in Ukraine, migration policy and Europe's global engagement.

title: Government declares fight against illegal migration
description: In the face of hybrid warfare, decisive action is necessary. Regaining control over our borders will be possible thanks to solutions adopted today by the Council of Ministers. These include the possibility of temporarily limiting the right to apply for asylum and tightening the visa system. In order to ensure public safety, the government has today entered more companies on the list of entities subject to state protection. A resolution has also been adopted to counteract the negative effects of the constitutional crisis.

title: Prime Minister Donald Tusk visits Lviv: "Our commitment to Ukraine is also the defense of Poland and Europe"
description: Prime Minister Donald Tusk met with President Volodymyr Zelensky during his visit to Lviv and emphasized Poland's full support for the fighting Ukraine. He announced the transfer of another, 45th package of military support, as well as Poland's commitment to Ukraine's integration with the European Union and NATO during the Polish presidency of the EU Council in 2025. The Prime Minister also visited the historic tenement house of Ludwik Heller, which is being rebuilt after Russian air raids, and which symbolizes the common heritage and solidarity of both nations.

title: Prime Minister during Christmas meeting with soldiers: You are heroes every day!
description: "The service of Polish soldiers ensures security for Poland and all citizens," said Prime Minister Donald Tusk during a Christmas meeting at the 15th Gołdap Anti-Aircraft Regiment. The meeting was also attended by Deputy Prime Minister, Minister of National Defense Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz and Deputy Minister Cezary Tomczyk. It was an opportunity to express gratitude for the service performed and to express holiday wishes. The issue of security is a priority for the government.

title: A just peace for Ukraine – this is a common goal of Poland and France
description: Ensuring security in Europe, support for Ukraine and the future of transatlantic relations – these are the main topics of the meeting between Prime Minister Donald Tusk and French President Emmanuel Macron in Warsaw. The leaders of Poland and France also announced joint work to accelerate the new treaty of Polish-French friendship. They also admitted that our countries are “like one team”.

title: Tax relief for employers employing OT and AR soldiers
description: At the beginning of 2025, regulations regarding tax relief for employers employing Territorial Defense or Active Reserve soldiers came into force. This is another point of the Act of October 1, 2024, which introduces positive changes in the matter of employing non-professional soldiers.

title: Christmas wishes from the WOT Commander
description: Christmas wishes from the WOT Commander

title: Wrocław's Christmas Eve of Operation PHENIX
description: On December 18, 2024, a Christmas Eve meeting was held at the Centennial Hall in Wrocław for soldiers of the Polish Army and officers and representatives of the services involved in Operation FENIKS. This event was a summary of the efforts made so far, an opportunity to thank, and an opportunity to appreciate the commitment of all those providing help and support in the areas affected by the flood.

title: New Year's wishes from the General Commander of the Armed Forces
description: On the occasion of the upcoming New Year, I wish all soldiers and employees that the coming year will bring many successes in service, work and personal life. May 2025 …

title: 100,000 hours in the air with CASA C-295M
description: Polish transport aviation has achieved an exceptional success – CASA C-295M aircraft have exceeded the 100,000 flight hours mark! This is the result of 21 years of service, which combines …

title: Christmas wishes from the General Commander of the Armed Forces
description: On the occasion of Christmas, I wish all soldiers and employees of the Ministry of National Defense that the time spent with their loved ones be filled with love and mutual …

title: Christmas meeting of DG RSZ
description: On December 17, the traditional Christmas Eve meeting of the General Command of the Armed Forces took place at the 1st Transport Aviation Base, which gathered the command staff, soldiers and command employees.

title: Annual severance pay of DG RSZ
description: The annual briefing with the commanders of subordinate units at the Land Forces Training Center in Dęba was conducted by the General Commander of the Armed Forces, Lieutenant General Marek Sokołowski.

title: Military oath
description: "I, a soldier of the Polish Army, swear to serve faithfully the Republic of Poland, to defend its independence and borders. To guard the Constitution, to protect the honor of a Polish soldier, to defend the military banner. For the cause of my Homeland, in need of blood...

title: Minister Radosław Sikorski attends Ambassadors’ Conference of French Republic
description: Today, Minister Radosław Sikorski took part in the Ambassadors’ Conference of the French Republic, held in Paris. As part of the Conference, he met with Jean-Noël Barrot, Minister of Europe and Foreign Affairs of the French Republic.

title: A letter to the Editor of The Washington Times
description:
Dear Sir,
The Washington Times has published Clifford D. May’s letter addressed to Radoslaw Sikorski, the Foreign Minister of Poland. This letter involves me, as it is based supposedly on my statements and pseudo-facts. As this may harm good Polish – Israeli and Polish – American relations, I feel obliged to set the record straight.

title: MFA statement on response to Hungarian government’s asylum to wanted Marcin Romanowski
description: We consider Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s government’s decision to grant political asylum to Marcin Romanowski, who is wanted under a European Arrest Warrant, a hostile act towards the Republic of Poland and one which is contrary to the elementary principles applicable to EU member states.

title: Joint statement from the Tallinn Mechanism
description: Donors accumulate 200 million euros for Ukraine’s resilience in cyberspace.

title: Minister Radosław Sikorski visits Albania
description: Poland’s top diplomat visited Tirana today, meeting with the President of the Republic of Albania, Bajram Begaj, Prime Minister Edi Rama, and Minister for Europe and Foreign Affairs Igli Hasani.

title: Minister Radosław Sikorski visits London
description: On 19 December, Minister Radosław Sikorski met in London with UK Foreign Secretary David Lindon Lammy.

title: Minister Radosław Sikorski attends Foreign Affairs Council in Brussels
description: The meeting of 16 December focused on Russia’s aggression against Ukraine and on the situation in Georgia and the Middle East.

title: Poland’s Presidency of the Council of the EU in 2025: Ministry of Foreign Affairs’ priorities and activities
description: The Presidency’s work carried out with the involvement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs will focus on three areas: maximising support for Ukraine, maintaining current policies towards Russia and Belarus, and strengthening the security and resilience of the EU and its partners. The MFA is responsible for the substantive servicing of 945 meetings, including sessions of 38 working groups and committees at the Council of the European Union in Brussels and meetings in Poland.

title: Poland and Canada will soon sign a cooperation agreement for 2025-2026
description: - Our intention is to conclude a comprehensive plan of joint activities in the military and defence sphere for the forthcoming years. To delineate precisely the scope of collaboration between Canada and Poland in the domain of security. (…) I believe that the plan for 2025-2026, which we will adopt imminently, will represent a significant advancement in integration, our collective strength, and our shared responsibility for security - stated Deputy Prime Minister W. Kosiniak-Kamysz following a meeting with Canada's Minister of Defence.

title: Support from PKW UNIFIL soldiers
description: UNIFIL PMC soldiers not only ensure security in the "blue line" area in southern Lebanon, but also help the local community affected by the consequences of the conflict.

title: Joint patrol operations
description: In the last decade of December of the past year, joint Polish-Latvian patrols took place, within the framework of which soldiers from Latvia cooperated closely with soldiers of the Polish Military Contingent KFOR.

title: Visit to PKW UNIFIL
description: On December 27-29, 2024, the Polish Military Contingent in Lebanon hosted the Deputy Chief of Staff for Operations - head of the division - Brig. Gen. Jarosław Chojnacki.

title: Soldiers from the 16th rotation of PKW Latvia visit a Polish school
description: On December 27, soldiers from the 16th rotation of the Polish Military Contingent in Latvia visited the Polish school in Rezekne as part of a humanitarian campaign aimed at supporting …

title: Christmas donation in Debel
description: During Christmas, military Santa Clauses from PKW UNIFIL visited the State Primary School in the city of Debel with gifts.

title: Christmas Eve for Polish soldiers in Latvia
description: On December 24, Polish soldiers stationed in Latvia had a unique opportunity to feel the magic of Christmas away from their families. The Christmas Eve supper, which took place …

title: Simplified rules for granting the allowance for long-term military service
description: As of January 1, the rules for granting a bonus for long-term military service will be simplified. The bonus will be calculated after two years of military service at 2% of the basic salary due, and then increased by 1% each year.

title: Contract for a new ship for the Navy signed
description: "We are signing a contract for a rescue ship. According to the contract, the cutting of sheet metal should take place 12 months after signing the contract. We expect the keel to be laid 2 months later. However, the launch is planned for 2027," said Deputy Prime Minister Władysław Kosiniak - Kamysz in Gdynia after signing a contract for the acquisition of a rescue ship for the Polish Navy under the "Ratownik" program. Deputy Minister Paweł Bejda also took part in the ceremony, which took place at the Naval Academy.

title: Deputy Prime Minister W. Kosiniak-Kamysz: Victory did not come by itself. Victory was born over decades and generations.
description: Until the next meeting at this monument, until the 107th anniversary of the outbreak of the Greater Poland Uprising, one of the units in the Polish Army will bear the name of the victorious Greater Poland Uprising. We must do more to increase the awareness of the victorious patriotism - informed Deputy Prime Minister Władysław Kosiniak - Kamysz during the celebrations of the 106th anniversary of the Greater Poland Uprising.

title: Christmas wishes
Air shield for missile launchers
description: On December 24 this year, at the Armament Agency, in the presence of the Secretary of State at the Ministry of National Defense, Paweł Bejda, an agreement was signed for the acquisition of unmanned aerial systems for the protection of divisional fire modules of the Homar-K launcher.

title: Draft act amending the act on the symbols of the Armed Forces of the Republic of Poland adopted by the Council of Ministers
description: The Council of Ministers has adopted a draft act amending the Act on the symbols of the Armed Forces of the Republic of Poland, submitted by the Minister of National Defence.

title: Christmas meeting with soldiers serving in POLLOGHUB
description: - You are doing a wonderful job. You are performing an exceptional service. Please accept my best wishes - for you, for your families, for those you will meet, and also for those who will be waiting for you because you have to stay away from home. I wish you health, prosperity, peace and quiet, goodness and beauty in the coming year. May it bring you as much joy and satisfaction as possible, and strengthen our national community. You serve Poland well, you serve the Homeland well - said Deputy Prime Minister Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz during a Christmas meeting with POLLOGHUB soldiers in Rzeszów.

title: 17 billion zlotys for the purchase of equipment for the Polish Army in the Polish arms industry
description: Over PLN 17 billion is the sum of the contracts signed today with the Polish arms industry for the supply of equipment for the Polish Army.

title: Observation satellites will strengthen the image reconnaissance capabilities of the Polish Army
description: - Security and economy meet in the Ministry of National Defense. We invest in the Polish army, buying from Polish entrepreneurs, implementing the 50/50 assumption. We deliver increasingly modern equipment. Today, however, we are going a step further - we are entering the space of the future, outer space. We have decided to build drone forces, a medical component, and also to develop operational capabilities in outer space - in the field of observation and tactical operations. The agreement signed today regarding four satellites in the Mikroglob program is an extraordinary achievement of the Polish Armed Forces. It expands our capabilities, increases operability and provides imaging capabilities necessary for tactical and operational operations - said Deputy Prime Minister Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz after signing the agreement for observation satellites for the Polish Army.

title: Christmas Eve meeting with soldiers of PKW Romania
description: - This is always an extraordinary moment - you can visit our heroes, our soldiers who serve outside the borders of the homeland. They serve in Polish military contingents. (...) I am very happy about this visit in the pre-Christmas time. We will have another opportunity to exchange wishes, so at this solemn roll call I want to talk about the strategy, the most important challenges for Poland, for NATO, for our allies and for Romania, because these are common challenges for people who share the same values ​​- freedom, justice, good and beauty. These values ​​are described in our Constitution, as well as in the most important legal acts of the Romanian state - said Deputy Prime Minister W. Kosiniak-Kamysz during his visit to the National Electoral Commission in Romania.

title: We remember those who died on missions abroad
description: - This is an incredibly moving moment. A December evening that pierces our hearts, our minds, our souls. The heroes of this evening are those who gave their lives for their homeland – 123 people since the 1950s, who died in missions and operations outside Poland. 123 people whom we remember, whom we name, whom we honor and pay tribute to. And their families – those who come here every year, those who stand before this monument every year with a pensive face, with tears in their eyes and with a heart that will never find solace after the loss of loved ones. Never. I know and realize that there are no words that could encompass the pain of losing a husband, father or son. These are soldiers and civilian employees of the Polish Army. Behind each of these names on this wall there is a story – a story of life, devotion to the homeland and often tragic death. Thank you for being here together - said Deputy Prime Minister W. Kosiniak-Kamysz.

title: Christmas Eve meeting with soldiers
description: - There is something that unites Poles: Christmas, the white and red flag, our national emotions, colors, the anthem. And there is something else sacred that unites Poles - love for the Polish Army. (...) Wishing you, your loved ones, all military families - because they serve together with you, a soldier never serves alone, his entire family serves - I wish you peace and quiet, a good and blessed Christmas. I also wish that you and all of us will be able to fulfill the obligations that the citizens of the Republic of Poland impose on us: this great love and trust in the Polish Army. All the best for Christmas and the New Year. May God bless our beloved homeland - said Deputy Prime Minister W. Kosiniak-Kamysz during the Christmas Eve meeting.

title: New Grot, Vis and under-barrel grenade launchers for Polish Army soldiers
description: - We are investing once again in Polish companies and equipping Polish soldiers. (…) After purchasing drones, after launching the Patriot system in initial readiness in the Wisła program yesterday, after purchasing tankers (…) and purchasing 80 Rosomaks in the L version, the time has come for something that is essential for every soldier and with which he must be equipped. Carbines, pistols, grenade launchers suspended from Grot carbines - these are the purchases we are making today - said Deputy Prime Minister Władysław Kosiniak - Kamysz after signing a contract for the supply of weapons for soldiers of the Polish Army.

title: Awards for soldiers of the Polish Army
description: - I appreciate the engineering, chemical, medical forces and all the operational forces who devoted their time and strength, often in difficult conditions and with great emotions, to carry out the assigned tasks. Everyone is needed in the army - both the commander and the executors of the tasks. Without you, the best specialists, the implementation of these activities would not be possible - said Deputy Prime Minister W. Kosiniak-Kamysz during a meeting with the soldiers of Operation Feniks.

title: A noble cause! CWZS soldiers support the Charity Calendar
description: Charity Calendar of Stars by Senior Private Specialist Angelika Wątor in cooperation with the soldiers-athletes from CWZS is now available! This unique project, carried out for the Judyta Foundation, …

title: Support from PKW UNIFIL soldiers
description: UNIFIL PMC soldiers not only ensure security in the "blue line" area in southern Lebanon, but also help the local community affected by the consequences of the conflict.

title: Remembering the fallen and those who died outside the country's borders
description: "A Polish soldier fights for the freedom of all nations, but dies only for Poland" – Lieutenant General Stanisław Maczek

title: Joint boxing training under the watchful eye of champions

description: NATO must react dynamically and anticipate the actions of its opponents. Russia is not only flexing its muscles, but also threatening Europe with aggression. However, it must feel that NATO is like an iron fist and that it will end very badly for it - said the President in an interview for the Swiss newspaper "Neue Zürcher Zeitung".

title: Meeting with NATO Secretary General
description: President Andrzej Duda, at the invitation of NATO Secretary General Marek Rutte, took part in a working meeting of a group of leaders of the Alliance, President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky and EU representatives, devoted to coordinating an urgent increase in military and economic support for Ukraine.

title: The head of the National Security Bureau at the ceremony of the 54th anniversary of December '70
description: On Tuesday at six o'clock in Gdynia, in front of the Monument to the Victims of December 1970, ceremonies were held to mark the 54th anniversary of Black Thursday – the massacre of shipyard workers at the Gdynia Stocznia SKM station on 17 December 1970. The head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, who represented President Andrzej Duda on site, read a letter from the head of state addressed to the organisers and participants of the celebrations.

title: Vistula. Meeting of the Presidents of the Visegrad Group Countries
description: The leaders of the Visegrad Group countries discussed today in Wisła – at the invitation of President Andrzej Duda – the prevention of crisis situations, especially in the context of floods, as well as the situation in Ukraine and ways to end the war going on there.

title: Minister Jacek Siewiera: Ukraine should be included in NATO
description: The possibility of the UA joining NATO is a multi-year process and requires the unity of allies. Today, it is not visible here. Although from the Polish perspective, it is necessary for the UA to be in the Alliance - emphasized Minister Jacek Siewiera, who was a guest on the morning show "Bez Uników" on Program 3 of Polish Radio. As he added, what we can achieve in 2025 is a form of ceasefire in Ukraine - Russia will not withdraw, and retaking territories with the weapons that the Ukrainians have is not possible.
