title: The army does not want Borsuk? It was supposed to power the Polish arms industry, but it is still uncertain
description: In the shower of executive agreements that the military has concluded in the last weeks of 2024, one is missing. The big absentee is the new Borsuk combat vehicle. Its fate is being closely monitored, so the failure to sign the agreement raises many assumptions. Mostly bad ones.

title: German company increases stake in company that will produce artillery shells
description: German arms company Rheinmetall is taking over a 51 percent stake in Rheinmetall Defence Lietuva, which will build a new ammunition factory under a partnership agreement with the government.

title: Seven Pillars of Security: The Polish Presidency Faces an Important Challenge
description: Our ambition was to open the first cluster of accession talks with Ukraine during the Polish presidency, says Magdalena Sobkowiak-Czarnecka, Undersecretary of State in the Chancellery of the Prime Minister (European Union Division), in a conversation about the priorities of Polish and European security.

title: The prosecutor's office is opening an investigation into Antoni Macierewicz. It concerns one decision
description: The prosecutor's office has opened an investigation into the former head of the Ministry of National Defense, Antoni Macierewicz. It concerns the decision not to join Poland's initiative on aerial tankers.

title: Big concerns about the fate of new American fighters. What about the F-35?
description: Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy, who are to co-head the Department of Government Efficiency, are calling for more investment in unmanned aerial systems, which could lead to changes in aviation weapons programs. At the same time, questions about the fate of the F-35 are being raised.

title: Police helicopters to undergo modernization. This is an important system
description: The Black Hawk helicopters belonging to the police will undergo modernization. The contract, worth over PLN 10 million, includes the installation of an important system: rotor de-icing. The police currently has five machines of this type in stock. Negotiations with the manufacturer ended on December 17, and the contract itself was signed a day later.

title: Ukrainian Patriots will gain heavy armor
description: As part of Rinat Akhmetov's Steel Front defense initiative, the Metinvest Group, which is owned by him, has manufactured and assembled armor protection for the control module of the MIM-104 Patriot system, which protects the Ukrainian sky from Russian enemy attacks. The first armors have already been installed by Metinvest engineers on the active air defense system.

title: The head of the Ministry of National Defense for WNP.PL. In one week we spent more on armaments than the entire European Union
description: Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Defence, talks to WNP.PL about the government's and the Ministry of National Defence's actions regarding state security in 2025, the most important challenges facing the Ministry of Defence and the list of problems and financial shortages.

title: Putin has depleted the country's financial reserves. Russia faces a difficult year
description: The shift of the economy to war mode initially gave Russia a boost to growth, but now the country faces stagnation. Financial and personnel resources have been exhausted, Russian analysts note.

title: More and more questions about contracts with Korea. "There has never been such chaos"
description: The political crisis in South Korea is ongoing. The country with which we are tied by huge contracts for the purchase of weapons had three heads of state in December. And it does not look like the situation will end happily anytime soon. What next for Polish contracts and what does the future hold for Korea itself?

title: Market analysis regarding the rearmament of the ORP Ślązak corvette
description: On December 30, 2024, the Armaments Agency announced its intention to conduct Initial Market Consultations (IMC) regarding the retrofitting of the ORP "Ślązak" (241) patrol corvette, which remains in the inventory of the Polish Navy, with armament systems and additional equipment providing the capabilities to: engage surface and air targets with missile weapons, use and combat Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs), conduct operations in the field of radar reconnaissance (WRE) and offer logistics and training packages for the above-mentioned scope of retrofitting. The condition set by the Armaments Agency is to perform the work in a shipyard located in the territory of the Republic of Poland.

title: Rescue ship for the Navy ordered
description: On 27 December this year, at the Naval Academy in Gdynia, in the presence of Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Defence Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz, Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera and Deputy Minister at the Ministry of National Defence Paweł Bejda, a contract worth over PLN 1 billion gross was signed for the acquisition of a rescue ship for the Polish Navy under the programme codenamed Ratownik together with a logistical support package. This will be a support unit, which, thanks to its specialist equipment, will be intended in particular to provide rescue support for the operational activities of submarines. The parties to the contract are the Armaments Agency and the Consortium consisting of: Polska Grupa Zbrojeniowa S.A., PGZ Stocznia Wojenna Sp. z o.o. and OBR Centrum Techniki Morskiej S.A.

title: Artyleria pod parasolem Force Protection
description: For the purpose of conducting reconnaissance and air cover of the area of ​​operations, the Armament Agency purchased a system package called Force Protection from WB Electronics on 24 December. Communication means and artillery calculators were also purchased under the contract.

title: More Crabs for the Polish Army
description: On 23 December this year, an executive agreement was signed between the Armament Agency and Huta Stalowa Wola S.A. for the delivery of another four Regina divisional fire modules (DMO), including 96 Krab 155 mm self-propelled gun-howitzers (AHS). Half of the ordered Krabs are to be delivered in a modernized version, equipped with, among others, an automated magazine for projectiles and propellant charges and an automatic loader. Deliveries are planned for 2027-2029, and the total value of the agreement amounts to approx. PLN 9 billion gross.

title: K9 self-propelled gun-howitzers will receive Polish accompanying vehicles
description: On 23 December this year, an agreement was signed between the Armament Agency and the consortium consisting of Polska Grupa Zbrojeniowa S.A. (leader), Huta Stalowa Wola S.A. and Rosomak S.A. for the acquisition of over 250 accompanying vehicles for 155 mm self-propelled gun-howitzers (AHS) K9 Thunder. The order value amounts to nearly PLN 8 billion gross. The detailed scope of the agreement includes the delivery of accompanying equipment for nine AHS K9 divisional fire modules (DMO), supplied by the Polish defence industry, in 2027-2028.

title: Russian satellite program MikroGlob
description: On 20 December this year, the Armament Agency and Creotech S.A. signed an agreement for the delivery of the Earth Observation Satellite System under the MikroGlob program. According to the agreement, the Polish Armed Forces will acquire four micro-satellites based on the HyperSat platform developed by Creotech, equipped with optical instruments enabling the acquisition and transmission of Earth image data to the ground segment in the range of waves corresponding to the near-infrared and visible light bands. The value of the order amounts to approx. PLN 556.7 million gross, and the launch of the satellites and their achievement of low heliosynchronous orbit (SSO) is planned by 2027.

title: Radmor and Thorium Space Agreement
description: The WB Group Space Technology Center (operating within Radmor) and Thorium Space have signed a cooperation agreement. The agreement, announced on December 18, concerns the construction and development of various satellite platforms, their sensors, software, cryptographic and communication systems. This is another step by the Polish industry towards achieving technological sovereignty in the space industry.

title: Grottos and more – December contract of FB “Łucznik”
description: On December 19 this year, the Armaments Agency signed a multi-year contract with Fabryka Broni "Łucznik" - Radom (PGZ Group) for the supply of 5.56 mm MSBS Grot assault rifles, 40 mm under-barrel grenade launchers and 9 mm VIS 100 pistols.

title: Keel-laying ceremony for the sixth Project 258 minehunter
description: On 16 December this year, the Remontowa Shipbuilding S.A. shipyard in Gdańsk hosted the keel-laying ceremony for the sixth in a series of modern minehunters of the 258 project, the Kormoran II type. The ship, which will be named Czajka and have the side number 606, will be the last of three intended for the Świnoujście 12th Minesweeper Squadron of the 8th Coastal Defense Flotilla.

title: The last delivery from South Korea this year
description: On December 17, a ship from South Korea was unloaded in the port of Gdynia, which delivered: 7 K2GF tanks, 16 K9A1 self-propelled gun-howitzers (AHS) and 6 Homar-K multiple rocket launcher (WWR) modules. These are the last deliveries of this type of military equipment from South Korea this year. As a result, the Polish Army has so far received a total of: 84 K2GF tanks (46.7% of the first implementation contract), 136 AHS K9A1 (64.1% of the first implementation contract) and 72 Homar-K WWR (33.0% of the first implementation contract). In the case of WWR launchers, it was possible to accelerate deliveries and today's is the second of those initially planned for 2025.

title: The first "Longs" will be delivered to the army
description: On 17 December this year, the Armaments Agency representing the State Treasury signed an agreement with a consortium consisting of Huta Stalowa Wola S.A. and Rosomak S.A. for the acquisition of 80 wheeled armoured personnel carriers Rosomak-L with an unmanned turret ZSSW-30.

title: Modernization of C-295M CASA aircraft
description: On 13 December this year, an agreement for the modernisation and unification of C-295M CASA transport aircraft for the Polish Army was signed between the Armament Agency and the Spanish company Airbus Defence & Space, in the presence of Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Defence Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz. The modernisation planned for 2025-2033 will apply to all 16 C-295M aircraft owned by Poland and used by the 8th Air Transport Base in Balice. The value of the contract is EUR 102.7 million net (approx. PLN 540 million gross).

title: MQ-9B Sky Guardian UAV for the Polish Army
description: On December 12, 2020, the Armament Agency and General Atomics Aeronautical Systems Inc. concluded an agreement for the delivery of an unmanned aerial system (UAV) of the MALE (Medium-Altitude Long-Endurance) class, i.e. capable of performing flights at medium altitudes and over long distances, the MQ-9B Sky Guardian, which includes several unmanned aerial platforms. The value of the agreement for the delivery and comprehensive operation support service is approximately USD 310 million net (approximately PLN 1.525 billion gross). The delivery is to be completed by the first quarter of 2027.

NBP bought nearly 90 tons of gold in a year and is chasing the ECB
description: December was the first month since February when the National Bank of Poland did not increase its gold reserves. Despite this, in the whole of 2024, Polish bullion reserves increased by a quarter.

title: New Year's crowds in gyms and fitness clubs. There have never been so many Multisport cards
description: Benefit System reported that at the end of the year it had a record number of active Multisport cards registered. Poles are eager to take advantage of the physical activities offered as part of the benefit, but the popularity of cards is growing even more on foreign markets.

title: Eurozone inflation accelerates. Core inflation still refuses to fall
description: December brought an acceleration in HICP inflation in the euro zone. This indicator moved away from the 2-percent target of the European Central Bank.

title: The government has decided. It has allocated 60 billion złoty for the construction of a nuclear power plant.
description: The government has adopted a draft act under which the Polish Nuclear Power Plants company will receive PLN 60.2 billion in support of investments in a nuclear power plant in the years 2025-2030 - the Chancellery of the Prime Minister informed after the government meeting.

title: The best monthly deposits. 7 percent per year in two banks
description: 7 percent per annum - this is the rate you can count on if you want to use a short-term deposit. The given interest rates apply to two deposits. The common denominator of these proposals is not only the same interest rate, but also the requirement to have the status of a new customer.

title: Who will succeed Minister Wieczorek? Kulasek and Zioło-Pużuk on the shortlist
description: This week, New Left politicians are to make a decision on the candidate for the new Minister of Science; Karolina Zioło-Pużuk and Marcin Kulasek remain on the list - PAP has learned unofficially from sources close to the party. MP Dorota Olko's candidacy is also to be considered.

title: A fish worth a fortune, but it's not goldfish. Tuna sold in Japan for $1.3 million
description: A bluefin tuna fetched 207 million yen (about $1.3 million) during the first auction in 2025 at the Tokyo fish market, the second highest amount in history, CNN reported. The 276-kilogram fish was caught off the coast of Aomori Prefecture, in the northern part of the Japanese island of Honshu.

title: Things are going to happen. Bankier's Stars predict the best asset of January 2025
description: 2025 is a time of great expectations and potential changes on financial markets. Renowned financiers, whose forecasts were collected by Bankier.pl, select both safe and riskier assets for their portfolios. Here are the details of the forecasts for January, but also for the entire current year.

title: The share of renewable energy in transport is to increase. The government has set a target for 2030
description: The draft amendment to the Biofuels Act adopted by the government on Tuesday provides for an increase in the share of energy from renewable sources, including that from biofuels in transport, to 14.9 percent in 2030.

title: Gawkowski: By the end of January, checking drivers' licenses will be automated
description: In the coming days, and certainly by the end of January, the process of checking data on driving licenses by entrepreneurs will be automated - announced on Tuesday Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Digitization Krzysztof Gawkowski.

title: It was supposed to have damaged a cable at the bottom of the Gulf of Finland. The anchor of the Eagle S was recovered
description: The anchor of the tanker Eagle S, suspected of damaging undersea cables in the Baltic Sea, has been located at the bottom of the Gulf of Finland and brought to the surface, Finnish radio Yle reported on Tuesday. Investigators are to begin examining it the same day.

title: Road pirates in the crosshairs. The "Stop road bandits" project is ready
description: The Ministry of Justice's "Stop Road Bandits" project is ready, the ministry announced on Tuesday. It emphasized that the tragic accident from a few days ago, caused by a driver who was banned from driving, is yet another proof that changes to road traffic regulations are necessary.

title: Far-right comes to power. Herbert Kickl will become Austria's new chancellor
description: The leader of the right-wing populist Freedom Party of Austria (FPOe) Herbert Kickl announced in a statement to the media on Tuesday that he has undertaken the mission of forming a new government. Kickl received the mission on Monday from Austrian President Alexander Van der Bellen.

title: The government will chip in to buy an electric bike. Up to PLN 9,000 is up for grabs
description: The Ministry of Climate and Environment plans to launch a subsidy program for the purchase of electric bikes in the first half of 2025 and is currently looking for domestic sources of financing for this purpose, following the refusal of the European Investment Bank to obtain funds from the Modernization Fund - the ministry said in response to a parliamentary question.

title: Changes in loans? Senate to consider the act on entities servicing loans
description: The Senate convenes on Wednesday; the chamber will deal with, among other things, the act on entities servicing loans and credit purchasers, which aims to reduce the risk of accumulation of non-performing loans, and an amendment to the Aviation Law regulating drone flights in Poland.

title: Ukrainian F-16s vs 6 Russian cruise missiles and all shot down
description: A Ukrainian F-16 fighter pilot shot down six Russian cruise missiles during a single combat sortie, which happened for the first time in history, the head of the press service of the Ukrainian Air Force, Colonel Yuri Ihnat, reported on Tuesday.

title: McDonald’s faces legal battle as chain faces lawsuit from 700 former employees
description: More than 700 McDonald's restaurant workers in the UK have joined a class action harassment lawsuit against the US group, a year and a half after a BBC investigation exposed the practices.

title: The unemployment rate has fallen, but it still lags behind the Czechs. In November, it stood at 3.0 percent.
description: The unemployment rate, after seasonal adjustment, according to Eurostat's methodology, amounted to 3.0 percent in Poland in November 2024, compared to 3.1 percent in October - Eurostat reported. This is the second lowest result in the European Union.

title: Italy's government signs billion-dollar deal with Musk's company? Political storm continues
description: The Italian government has denied media reports that it has reached a €1.5 billion agreement with Elon Musk's company to provide secure telecommunications services. The center-left opposition is demanding that Giorgio Meloni's cabinet present information in parliament on its relationship with Musk's SpaceX.

title: Travel to the UK. Changes for 48 countries, including Poland
description: Citizens of 48 countries, including the US, Canada and Australia, who travel to the UK, must obtain an Electronic Travel Authorisation (ETA) before arriving in the country from Wednesday. The cost of this document is £10. From 2 April, this requirement will also apply to Polish citizens.

title: Poles are transferring phone numbers like crazy. This operator has lost the most customers
description: In the fourth quarter of 2024, 435.9 thousand mobile numbers were transferred in Poland, which is over 65 thousand more than in the third quarter of 2024 - UKE reported in a press release. In the whole of 2024, approx. 1.51 million mobile numbers were transferred, which is approx. 48 thousand more than in 2023.

title: Housing prices have outpaced salaries, but it has gotten worse
description: Although the average gross salary in the corporate sector has grown by 50-60 percent over the last five years, the average amounts paid for 50-meter apartments in the largest Polish cities have skyrocketed over that time from over 70 to even 140 percent - according to data from Bankier.pl. Buyers can take comfort in the fact that things were worse in the meantime.

title: Mortgage winter continues. Poles await property price drops and government support
description: The value of mortgage loan inquiries in December fell by 45.4 percent year-on-year - BIK reported in a statement. The number of mortgage loan applications fell by 43.8 percent.

title: Jean-Marie Le Pen has died. The founder of the National Front was 96 years old
description: Jean-Marie Le Pen, the founder of the far-right National Front, died on Tuesday at the age of 96, the AFP agency reported on Tuesday, citing the politician's family. Le Pen was a symbol of the far-right in France. He ran for president five times - in 1974, 1988, 1995, 2002 and 2007.

title: Trump, ETFs, and $100k - 2024 Belonged to Bitcoin. What's in Store for It in 2025?
description: 121 percent - exactly such a return could be obtained in 2024 by buying bitcoin on January 1 and selling it on December 31. The huge success of ETFs for the first cryptocurrency, the interest of institutions and the election victory of Donald Trump, made digital assets have one of the best periods in history. Can 2025 be even better?

title: All Porsche's Problems: Up to 8,000 Employees to Be Laid Off
description: Traditional automotive industry is facing an uphill battle. Porsche is losing its market in China and is planning a restructuring that could see up to 8,000 employees put on the street. Another problem is the lower-than-expected interest in electric cars.

title: Rolex is even more expensive. However, the prices of luxury watches do not scare away wealthy buyers
description: Although Rolex watches have long been among the most expensive in the world, now you'll have to pay even more for them. All because of the rising price of gold. However, this does not discourage wealthy buyers.

title: Popular SaaS stock crashes as Text reports disappointing sales data
description: Text's shares experienced a double-digit decline after the start of Tuesday's session on the Warsaw Stock Exchange. The reason for the price drop is the report on estimated sales results for the last quarter.

title: She Added Poison to Christmas Cake. She Wanted to Get Rid of Her Mother-in-Law. Three People Are Dead
description: Six people were taken to hospital in the Brazilian city of Torres with symptoms of severe food poisoning. Three of them died. Arsenic was found in their bodies. A 42-year-old woman who probably added the poison to the cake was arrested. The woman had a long-standing conflict with her mother-in-law.

title: Changes to accident insurance premiums in 2025. Check if it applies to your company?
description: From January 1, 2025, a new Polish Classification of Activities (PKD 2025) is in force in Poland, which has a significant impact on the method of determining the amount of the accident insurance contribution. Entrepreneurs, both those who started their business before 2025 and those who do so after that date, will have to adapt to the new rules.

title: PLN 60 billion for the construction of the first nuclear power plant. The government has made a decision
description: The government has approved a draft law providing for the transfer of PLN 60.2 billion in public support for the Polish Nuclear Power Plants company. These funds are to be allocated to the construction of the first nuclear power plant in Poland. Financing will cover the years 2025-2030.

title: This is how much money you can withdraw from an ATM at one time [LIMITS]
description: Although online banking has revolutionized the way we manage our finances, cash still has its place in our lives. ATMs, as the easiest way to access cash, have their limitations. Why can't we withdraw any amount? What are the withdrawal limits and are they the same across all banks? Here are the details.

title: Fatal hit-and-run of 14-year-old boy. Government announces urgent changes to regulations
description: By the end of January 2025, the process of checking drivers' licenses by entrepreneurs is to be fully automated, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Digitization Krzysztof Gawkowski announced on Tuesday.

title: They will check every driver automatically. New law in January 2025
description: This will be a new whip for drivers. In January, a system will be launched that will allow employers to automatically check employees' driving licenses every day at 6:00. The Ministry of Digital Affairs announces 100% effectiveness of checks.

title: How much does a sanatorium cost? In 2025, this is how much you will pay for a stay on the National Health Fund
description: A trip to a sanatorium is an opportunity to improve your health and rest. The stay can be financed from the National Health Fund, ZUS, KRUS or your own funds. If we want to go to a sanatorium under the National Health Fund social insurance, we have to cover part of the costs. How much do you have to pay to a sanatorium in 2025?

title: PLN 2,520 per month for selected individuals. New benefit from ZUS. Who is eligible?
description: A significant change to the financial support system has been introduced since 1 January 2025. As part of the new pension supplement, people who meet certain conditions will be able to receive additional assistance in the amount of PLN 2,520 per month. The changes are intended to improve the quality of life of those who need support the most.

title: The Polish Olympic Committee has a new sponsor. The sports minister won't like it
description: Sports Minister Sławomir Nitras has turned off the money tap. The Polish Olympic Committee has stopped being subsidized from public money. State Treasury companies have also turned away from the committee. However, the Polish Olympic Committee will not be "starved" so easily. It has just signed a contract with a new sponsor.

title: The end of an era. The donkey that inspired the character from "Shrek" has died at the age of 30.
description: Perry, the 30-year-old donkey who served as the model for the character Donkey in the movie "Shrek," was put down after his health deteriorated rapidly. The animal lived in a pasture in Palo Alto for three decades, where he became a local attraction and part of the community. While his role in creating animation brought him fame, Perry was first and foremost a beloved member of his herd and a favorite of the locals.

title: Urszula Dudziak arouses envy with her form. She survived the death of her beloved, suffered from cancer, and now enjoys love
description: Urszula Dudziak celebrated her 80th birthday last year. She is an excellent, world-renowned jazz vocalist, composer, lyricist and writer. The artist does not give up when fate throws obstacles in her way. "Optimism can be learned just like a foreign language. It is a matter of choice. You cannot take the easy way out and give up," she said in an interview for dziennik.pl.

title: Marcin Romanowski to be temporarily arrested? It is known when the court will deal with the case
description: On February 13, 2025, the District Court in Warsaw will consider the appeal against the three-month pretrial detention of PiS MP Marcin Romanowski. The motion in this case was filed by the politician's defense attorney, attorney Bartosz Lewandowski.

title: Up to PLN 4,200 more to your pension in 2025. Who will benefit?
description: After a long period of high growth, pensions and annuities will be indexed in single digits this year. Additional funds for seniors will be provided by thirteenth and fourteenth pensions, for which the government will allocate over PLN 31 billion. Here are the details.

title: "600 plus" for dentistry from January. What does the new dental financing from the National Health Fund include in 2025?
description: The year 2025 brings significant changes in the availability of dental services under the National Health Fund (NFZ). Thanks to the new regulation of the Minister of Health, which entered into force on January 3, 2025, patients will be able to use a wider range of dental services financed from public funds. What changes await patients, what does the new benefit package include?

title: Reports of a new romance in show business are back. It's about Julia Wieniawa
description: Julia Wieniawa and Maciej Zakościelny vehemently denied that there was anything more than friendship between them. Now photos have appeared online that will only heat up the gossip. The couple spent an evening together, and moments of tenderness were captured in the photos.

title: TVP mocks Danuta Holecka. She was reminded of her words from years ago
description: Danuta Holecka is currently a presenter on TV Republika. The station is conducting a campaign against the WOŚP foundation. Years ago, the presenter worked on TVP and during one of the interviews thanked Jurek Owsiak for the equipment that helped her son. TVP decided to recall her words in the program "19.30".

title: McDonald's Sued by Over 700 Employees. "Racism and Homophobia"
description: More than 700 McDonald's restaurant workers in the UK have joined a class action harassment lawsuit against the US group, a year and a half after a BBC investigation exposed the practices.

title: Over 2500 PLN of new allowance. And every month. Who can apply?
description: In January 2025, ZUS recorded an increase in the number of applications for retirement benefits. In addition to the traditional widow's pension, a new supplement to the social pension was introduced, which generated additional interest among beneficiaries of the pension system. Who is entitled to this benefit and how much can you count on? Here are the details.

title: Ryoyu Kobayashi will not come to the World Cup in Zakopane
description: Ryoyu Kobayashi will not appear at the World Cup competition in Zakopane. The Olympic champion from Beijing in ski jumping is far from top form. Therefore, instead of competing at Wielka Krokiew, he decided to stay in Japan and train at the facility in Sapporo.

title: [Quiz] These PRL cartoons were a hit. Check how well you remember childhood classics. Only the champion will get 100%!
description: The Polish People's Republic was a period that abounded in iconic animated cartoons that accompanied children for many years. Do you know who was the creator of "Bolek i Lolek" or what characters appeared in "Reksiu"? Test your knowledge of cartoons from the Polish People's Republic and see how much you remember from these unforgettable productions!

title: ZUS settles payers for 2024. Check if you have an overpayment
description: The Social Insurance Institution has announced the commencement of the process of transferring information on the status of settlements on payers' accounts for 2024. This year, over 3.3 million payers will receive relevant data on their profiles in the PUE/eZUS system.

title: These are the most congested cities in Poland. Warsaw like Rome
description: Seven Polish cities have been included in the ranking of the world's most congested metropolises. Where do drivers waste the most time? Warsaw's big advancement has meant that in the infamous ranking, the capital has been placed almost on a par with Rome, Melbourne and Brussels. How do other cities compare?

title: Skoda has gone wild. The new coupe-style SUV will be a hit and it looks like it
description: The new Skoda Enyaq in Velvet red and on 21-inch rims looks at the world through Matrix LED headlights. Under the Modern Solid bodywork, a 285 HP engine works. It will be available as a classic SUV or an elegant coupe with rear-wheel drive or 4x4. The attention to detail in the cabin goes beyond the standards of popular brands. Here are the first details…

title: Jean-Marie Le Pen, a leading right-winger and nationalist in French politics, has died
description: Right-wing French politician Jean-Marie Le Pen, founder of the National Front and father of Marine Le Pen, leader of the National Rally, has died at the age of 96.

title: Surprising What Was Discovered in Korean Uniforms. Ukrainians Reveal
description: The Ukrainian Armed Forces on Tuesday (07.01) reported the defeat of a group of North Korean soldiers in the Kursk region in Russia. During the search of the fallen servicemen, the Ukrainians found equipment, as well as documents. Among them was a special letter to the North Korean authorities.

title: Golden Globes 2025. Mature stars shined on the red carpet: Anderson without makeup, Hayek in a dress with a neckline [PHOTO]
description: The 82nd Golden Globe Awards ceremony is behind us. There was no shortage of stars in stunning creations on the red carpet. Mature actresses drew attention, looking dazzling at the gala. Pamela Anderson remained faithful to her natural image without makeup, Salma Hayek chose a sequined dress with a deep neckline, and Angelina Jolie looked phenomenal as usual. See the creations of mature stars from the Golden Globes!

title: Piesiewicz on the dispute with Nitras. "I am not its initiator"
description: The conflict, or rather war, between the Minister of Sport and the President of the Polish Olympic Committee is in full swing. Radosław Piesiewicz blames Sławomir Nitras for the situation. "I am not the one who initiated this dispute" - the head of the Polish Olympic Committee defends himself.

title: Italy's government in turmoil: Meloni must explain himself for "selling the country"
description: The Italian government has denied media reports that it has reached a €1.5 billion deal with Elon Musk's company to provide secure telecommunications services. The center-left opposition is demanding that Giorgio Meloni's cabinet present information to parliament on its relationship with Musk's SpaceX.

title: If you fail to file your 2024 PIT on time, you risk a hefty fine or even imprisonment.
description: The deadline for settling the annual income tax for 2024 is approaching. We would like to remind you that filing a PIT return is the obligation of every taxpayer. Here are the key dates to remember when filling out the declaration.

title: Australian Open. Chwalińska and Majchrzak are getting closer to qualifying for the main draw
description: Kamil Majchrzak defeated Argentine Marco Trungelliti 3:6, 7:6 (7-4), 6:3 in the 1st round of qualifying for the Grand Slam tennis tournament Australian Open in Melbourne. Maja Chwalińska also advanced after defeating Czech Dominika Salkova 7:6 (7-3), 5:7, 7:6 (12-10).

title: Lech Wałęsa explains "denunciations". "Accident at work"
description: Lech Wałęsa, former president of Poland, has released a recording in which he explains the controversial topic of his alleged denunciations from the 1970s. According to Wałęsa, the documents that were allegedly proof of cooperation with the security services were fabricated by the security services. In the Facebook material, Wałęsa emphasizes that his actions were the result of manipulation, and the so-called "denunciations" were merely an "accident at work", an unintended consequence of the services' actions.

title: Putin scares, Habeck appeals, Scholz brakes. Germany in defensive stalemate
Zendaya Engaged! When Is The Wedding With The Hollywood Star? [PHOTO]
description: Zendaya is in a relationship with Tom Holland. Proof emerged at Saturday's Golden Globes that the couple is engaged. It had been suspected for some time. An engagement ring is shining on the star's finger.

title: A surprising discovery: It lowered the IQ of Europeans
description: The widespread use of lead in the Roman Empire lowered the IQ level throughout Europe by 2-3 points during about 200 years of the Empire's domination, reported the Guardian newspaper, citing recently published research by scientists from the Desert Research Institute in the US.

title: Korean company invests in Poland. When will serial production start?
description: The Korean company POSCO International is investing in Poland and is already building its first factory. The new plant will occupy an area of ​​21,000 m2. The first orders were placed by the Hyundai Motor Group, which owns the Hyundai and Kia brands.

title: 230 thousand Poles will receive a letter from the army. Check if you are on the list
description: Military qualifications in Poland will begin in February 2025. 230,000 young Poles will have to appear before mandatory medical boards. The summons will also include women. Those who resist and decide to avoid the boards will face severe penalties.

title: Maciej Stuhr on his father's accident. "I was glad that..."
description: Maciej Stuhr recalled his father's accident in his latest interview. He confessed what he felt when it turned out that Jerzy Stuhr had lost his driving license. "I was glad he had lost it," says the actor.

title: The word of the year 2024 has been chosen. Surprise?
description: By decision of the chapter, "coalition" was chosen as the word of the year 2024. In turn, "artificial intelligence" won the vote of internet users. The competition is organized by the University of Warsaw for the fourteenth time.

title: Fatal hit-and-run of a 14-year-old in Wola. Prosecutor's office issues decision
description: The driver who was detained in connection with the fatal hit-and-run of a 14-year-old on a pedestrian crossing in Warsaw has been arrested, the District Prosecutor's Office in Warsaw announced.

title: Anita Włodarczyk will be able to receive a pension from August. See how much it will be
description: Anita Włodarczyk will turn 40 on August 8 this year. This means that the athlete will be entitled to an Olympic pension. See how much this benefit will be.

title: Thousands of seniors won't get money. Who will lose out on the additional benefit this year?
description: This year, the fourteenth pension may not reach the full amount of thousands of seniors. The lack of indexation of the income limit means that those retirees who exceed the threshold of PLN 2,900 gross per month must reckon with a reduction in the benefit, and retirees with higher incomes will completely lose the right to the supplement.

title: Additional 620.36 PLN. And more from March. Who is this supplement for?
description: People receiving a family pension can currently count on an additional PLN 620 per month. The supplement for a complete orphan, regardless of age, is available to people who have lost both parents and are continuing their education. The amount of this benefit will increase from March 2025. Here are the details.

title: Paweł Wawrzecki has made an important decision. It also concerns his sick daughter
description: Paweł Wawrzecki has a wife who lives in the USA. The popular actor divides his time between Poland and the United States. Now he has made an important decision that also concerns his sick daughter.

title: Megahit TV series returns. New season premiere date revealed
description: A new teaser for the second season of the hit series "The Last of Us" has appeared online. We also learned the approximate premiere date of the hit starring Bella Ramsey and Pedro Pascal. When will the new season of the adaptation of one of the most iconic video games in history hit the Max streaming platform?

title: Iga Świątek's rival broke up with a famous rapper
description: Naomi Osaka is no longer in a relationship with American rapper Cordae. The famous tennis player announced her breakup with the father of her daughter on social media.

title: Sikorski surprised with words about Russia. "It is weaker than many think"
description: Radosław Sikorski was the guest of honor at the Conference of French Ambassadors in Paris. - At a time when Poland is taking over the presidency of the Council of the European Union, Europe seems to be losing momentum, innovation and competitive advantage - said the head of Polish diplomacy. He also emphasized that "Russia is much weaker than many Europeans think".

title: Maciej Dowbor on his marriage. "I am a bigger egoist"
description: Maciej Dowbor talked about his marriage in a new interview. The journalist's wife is Joanna Koroniewska. The couple is famous for posting funny videos online. The presenter of "Dzień dobry TVN" revealed to Magdalena Mołek that his marriage "is not always perfect". He says about his wife that she is "the perfect woman".

title: Radio and TV fees in 2025. Who does not have to pay?
description: Despite the plans to reform the financing of public media, in 2025 the RTV license fee will remain at its current level - PLN 8.70 for radio and PLN 27.30 for television. According to "Głos Pomorza", until new regulations are introduced, these fees will still be mandatory, although many people can apply for an exemption. Who?

title: Stain on the tablecloth? We have a solution for that. Learn effective ways to remove stains
description: Stains on the tablecloth are something that cannot be avoided. Stains from coffee, tea, fatty foods or fruit can be difficult to remove, especially if the tablecloth was not washed immediately. How to effectively remove all stains from the tablecloth? Learn effective methods.

title: Are you 60 years old and have 15 years of service? Are you entitled to this pension?
description: The amount of your pension depends not only on reaching retirement age, but above all on the length of the contribution period. If you are 60 and have only worked 15 years, the amount of your pension may be much lower. How much is it? Here are the details.

title: Poland wants to save Ukraine. Can we afford to send increasingly expensive electricity?
description: Poland intends to save Ukraine if it starts to run out of electricity. The Minister of the Environment, Paulina Hennig-Kloska, has not ruled out an almost immediate increase in electricity supplies to our eastern neighbor, if the need arises. Is our country ready for this and will there be enough electricity in Poland to save our neighbor?

title: The Myth of the Unhappy Employee Debunked: Why Do We Think People Don't Like Working?
description: Most people feel satisfied with their work. Interestingly, however, they believe that others are dissatisfied in this area. The media promotes the myth of the unhappy employee, but it is untrue. At least in the US - we read on the Psychology Today website.

title: Another Country Is Fed Up with Platform X and Elon Musk: "They Can't Interfere in Countries' Internal Affairs"
description: Social media platforms like Elon Musk's X should be "completely neutral" and must not interfere in the internal affairs of countries, Spanish government spokeswoman Pilar Alegria said on Tuesday.

title: Do you like a glass of red wine? Doctors have some bad news for you
description: Consuming a glass of wine a day is generally considered a heart-healthy choice. However, a new study shows that drinking even the smallest amounts of alcohol may be associated with an increased risk of cancer

title: Putin has pulled an ace out of his sleeve. The fearsome general is supposed to clean up the front
description: The Russians are putting on a good face and while on the one hand they are trying to ignore the Ukrainian attack on the Kursk region, they are quietly making decisions indicating that they do have problems there. They sent a special forces man to the scene, who became famous for his actions in Chechnya and Kosovo. Even terrorists could not defeat him.

title: More than 700 people sue McDonald's for employee harassment
description: More than 700 McDonald's restaurant workers in the UK have joined a class action harassment lawsuit against the US group, a year and a half after a BBC investigation exposed the practices.

title: New UK Congestion Charge. How much does it cost? Who does it apply to?
description: Starting tomorrow, tourists from the United States and Canada who cross the border into Great Britain in visa-free travel will be required to have a new document entitling them to enter the country. And this regardless of the final destination of the trip. What is Electronic Travel Authorization? How to buy it? How much does it cost? When will Poles have to buy an ETA?

title: Jean-Marie Le Pen has died. The founder of the National Front was 96 years old
description: Jean-Marie Le Pen, the founder of the far-right National Front, died on Tuesday at the age of 96, the AFP news agency reported on Tuesday, citing the politician's family. Le Pen was a symbol of the far-right in France. He ran for president five times - in 1974, 1988, 1995, 2002 and 2007.

title: In a few years, the energy of stars will be harnessed. The first power plant based on nuclear fusion will be built there
description: If all goes according to plan, the world's first nuclear fusion power plant will be built in Virginia. Commonwealth Fusion Systems says the plant is expected to be online and generating electricity in the early 2030s.

title: Trump Wants to Take Over Greenland! He's Sending His Son There
description: Newly elected US President Donald Trump is not giving up on his plans for Greenland. He has announced that he will send a delegation there, led by his son Donald Trump Jr., to "make Greenland great again".

title: Interest rates in Poland. Surprising forecast from Goldman Sachs
description: The scale of interest rate cuts in Poland will be greater than market valuations suggest - estimates Goldman Sachs bank. According to analysts from this bank, interest rates will fall by 150 bp this year to 4.25 percent. The current level of rates is 5.75 percent.

title: Sobolewski: Minimum wage hikes deprive the middle class of prosperity
description: Szymon Glonek from Forsal.pl talked to Kamil Sobolewski, chief economist of Employers of Poland, about economic forecasts for 2023, their implementation in 2024 and expectations for 2025. During the conversation, the issues of consumption dynamics, investments, inflation and monetary policy were discussed.

title: Vodka will pay for war. Russians have new regulations
description: Russians have another problem, this time caused by Vladimir Putin himself. On his initiative, alcohol prices have skyrocketed since the new year, reaching levels never seen before in history. As commentators assess, this is an indirectly cunning way to increase financing for further war.

title: Expansion of Ukrainian companies in Poland. Are we a base on the way to conquer the European Union?
description: The Russian invasion of 2022 forced many Ukrainians to flee their country. Some of them turned their life crisis into a business success and are successfully developing their companies in Central Europe. And there are many indications that Ukrainian businessmen are planning further expansion to the West.

title: Germany to increase defense spending to 3.5 percent of GDP? Scholz: It's immature
description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz described the proposal of Economy Minister Robert Habeck to increase defense spending to 3.5 percent of GDP as "immature". Who will pay for the increase in the defense budget from almost 80 to 140 billion euros? The citizens? - asked the head of the German government in an interview with the weekly "Stern".

title: Brutal Neo-Nazis Rise to Power in Wartime Russia, Terrorizing Russian Streets
description: Neo-Nazis in Russia have grown in strength and already have hundreds of thousands of supporters. This group no longer fears government repression, so it terrorizes Russian streets. Videos showing spectacular violence are a hit on the web, and official media support the neo-Nazi xenophobic narrative - we read in Jacobin.

title: Poland has the second lowest unemployment in the EU. New data available
description: 3 percent - that was the seasonally adjusted unemployment rate in Poland in November - Eurostat reported. A month earlier, this indicator was 3.1 percent. For comparison, in the eurozone, unemployment in November was 6.3 percent.

title: Companies are fighting for employees. These industries will now hire
description: Companies from the transport and logistics and automotive industries are announcing an increase in employment in the coming months - according to a report by ManpowerGroup. Four out of ten companies are planning new recruitments in the first quarter of this year.

title: "Have you lost your mind?" NATO official is furious with banks
description: Western rating agencies, banks and pension funds are acting "foolishly" by disregarding arms investments, senior NATO representative Adm. Rob Bauer told the Financial Times. Increasing defense spending is a necessity in the face of the growing threat of conflict, he emphasized.

title: Crazy disparity on Wall Street. Profits of 7 largest companies increased by 18%, other 493 by... 0.1%
description: The US stock exchange has two years of impressive growth behind it. The S&P 500 index gained over 20% in 2023 and 2024. However, it has a problem of huge concentration - the entire Wall Street is pulling a few companies on its shoulders. The profits of the 7 largest companies increased by 18% in the third quarter, the remaining 493 by... 0.1%.

title: What's next for butter prices? Strong assurance from the agriculture minister
description: A product that has recently attracted the public's attention has been the rising price of butter. On Tuesday, the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development, Czesław Siekierski, assured that butter prices will fall. In his opinion, this is already visible in the agreements that are concluded in advance. The Minister recalled that the Ministry of Agriculture opposes the EU-Mercosur agreement and assured that Deputy Minister of Agriculture Michał Kołodziejczak will not resign.

title: Thick atmosphere in the Far East? Japan wants to buy over 1,000 missiles from the US
description: The Americans have agreed to a potential sale of AIM-120 AMRAAM air-to-air missiles to Japan. The authorities of the cherry blossom country have expressed a desire to buy as many as 1,200 of these missiles. This is not the first such request in recent years. What can this weapon do? What air force does Japan have?

title: Shares of Chinese giant collapsed. Reason? It became a "military company"
description: China's Tencent has been included by the US Department of Defense on the list of "Chinese military companies". The shares of the technology giant immediately dived - writes CNBC.

title: Russia has a big problem. They won with this weapon. Now it can change
description: It is difficult to point out a miracle weapon that will single-handedly change the course of war. However, there are some that are of key importance today. During the Ukrainian conflict, we can mention the M142 HIMARS launchers on the Ukrainian side and FAB guided bombs with UMPK modules on the Russian side. However, there are many indications that the Russians now have a serious problem with them.

title: BRICS is growing stronger as the world's fourth largest country by population joins the bloc
description: Indonesia has been admitted as a full member of the BRICS bloc of developing nations, Brazil, which holds the presidency until 2025, announced on Monday.

title: Trump Wants Canada to Join the US, But Canadians Have a Completely Different Opinion [POLL]
description: Many people in Canada want it to become the 51st state of the USA, and Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced his resignation because he knew that Washington would not tolerate trade deficits and subsidies - assessed Donald Trump, commenting on Trudeau's decision. He added that the USA and Canada would create a great country together.

title: The biggest tax hits and misses. Ruthless analyses by renowned experts. Optimism mixed with pessimism
description: As experts on the subject argue, the past year brought few tax changes for companies. On the other hand, the postponement of the implementation date of the National e-Invoice System (KSeF), which was to be in force from mid-2024, is primarily received positively. The advantages also include a lower VAT rate in the beauty industry, cash PIT for the smallest companies and the minimum CIT tax. The latter is also on the list of disadvantages. Next to it, you can see, among others, the property tax or the act increasing the excise tax rate on tobacco products.

title: Trump's son to visit Greenland. Media: It's humiliation for Danish government
description: The son of US President-elect Donald Trump, businessman Donald Trump Junior, will visit Greenland on Tuesday and meet with local politicians who support the island's independence, Greenlandic and Danish media reported on Monday.

title: Warsaw worse than Berlin. Here is the ranking of the most congested cities in the world
description: City traffic jams are a nightmare for all drivers around the world. However, drivers in Istanbul, New York and Chicago suffer the most from this - according to a report prepared by Inrix. Inrix's list of the most congested cities in the world also includes seven Polish cities. Check how they fared.

title: Canadian PM resigns. 'The situation has been building for several years'
description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced Monday that he will step down as party leader and thus cease to be prime minister. However, he will serve in his role until his successor is elected.

title: Will Europe be flooded with cheap food from South America? Another group of companies fears the EU-Mercosur agreement
description: Meat producers in Spain and Europe fear unfair competition if the European Union's agreement with Mercosur, an economic organization of South American countries, comes into force, the Spanish daily "ABC" wrote on Monday.

title: Ukrainian Naval Drones Attack Russian Air Defenses! Poland Should Learn from the Revolution in Naval Warfare
description: Ukrainian Armed Forces have destroyed another Russian Pantsir-S1 anti-aircraft system, this time using an FPV drone launched from an unmanned combat boat. The attack carried out in the Kherson region demonstrates the growing effectiveness of Ukrainian naval drones. The event confirms that even countries without a traditional navy can effectively conduct combat operations at sea.

title: Volkswagen wants to invest in China. 20,000 fast-charging stations to be built
description: The largest German car manufacturer, which is in a difficult situation, does not give up and takes a new initiative in China, the world's largest car market. Volkswagen and Xpeng have announced plans to expand their partnership. They will jointly build a network of super-fast charging stations for electric vehicles in the Middle Kingdom.

title: Will Austria Become Like Hungary? Expert: Chancellor Candidate Inspired by Orbán
description: After entrusting the mission of forming a government to the leader of the pro-Russian FPOe party, Herbert Kickl, "there is a significant risk of a course correction in Austria's foreign policy," Jakub Bielamowicz from the Institute for New Europe assessed in an interview with PAP. He also recalled that Kickl is inspired by Viktor Orban.

title: They made a fool of the owners of gas and oil furnaces with money. Is this a scandal that could end in a court war?
description: Those who bought gas and oil furnaces were fooled. Why? Because until the end of last year, they could have withdrawn the money invested in the purchase, installation and connection of such boilers from the tribute due to the tax office. Now it turns out that at the beginning of 2025, such boilers disappeared from the list of expenses covered by tax relief. Will the owners of gas and oil furnaces go to court? The point is that an error was made in the regulations.

title: They are giving 600 plus for a dentist from the new year. A big change in dental treatment "on the National Health Fund" What to do to get this money?
description: Those who can't afford it have ruin in their mouths, those who have money spend a fortune in a private office, where the prices are jaw-dropping. This is what dental treatment looks like in our country. And few people know that paying a health insurance contribution means that we don't always have to pay for everything. This year there has been a big change in the basket of dental benefits under the National Health Fund. You can get 600 plus for a dentist.

title: A revolution in the use of photovoltaics. Free electricity from the sun in a new way. Important changes have come into force for owners of solar panels
description: They have become a real hit in Poland. For several years now, there has been a boom in the installation of home installations for the production of electricity. The problem is that investing in free electricity from the sun is becoming more and more expensive. Will the amendment to the Renewable Energy Sources Act, which came into force on December 27, change this? The new regulations bring prosumers back to a settlement system based on the average monthly price of electricity.

title: They brought a giant machine from the end of the world. This is how they will dig the longest tunnel in Poland through the mountains [PHOTOS]
description: It is almost five meters in diameter, weighs six hundred tons and requires thirty trucks to transport it. This giant is a Chinese machine that will carve the longest tunnel in Poland under the mountains, near Limanowa. Construction will start soon, because the machine has already arrived in Poland from the port in Shanghai.

title: Is this how you make a profitable bank deposit from Employee Capital Plans? There is a simple way to outsmart the system
description: Will future retirees no longer live in poverty? The Employee Capital Plans system is a safeguard in old age. This long-term savings program, which is made up of employers, the state and employees themselves, was launched over four years ago. Now it turns out that some have treated it as a simple way to make money. PPK have become a short-term... bank deposit, but with a profit that is many times greater.

title: This has never happened before! Polish company takes over German giant. This is a deal worth billions
description: The whole series of sad news about our companies being taken over by foreign corporations makes me want to cry. Now, finally, there is some optimism. A Polish company is buying a German giant. The transaction concerns the tourism industry that generates billions of euros in profits every year.

title: Mysterious Polish businessman at the top of stock market billionaires. You won't believe what he built his gigantic success on
description: He challenged the largest foreign chains. He successfully competes with the Portuguese Bieronki of the Jeronimo Martins group. He already has more stores than the German Lidl. He made a real fortune in trade, which brought him to the top of the list of the wealthiest Poles. Now he is at the top of the list of stock market billionaires. Although the largest Polish media write about the state of the account of the owner of the Dino chain, Tomasz Biernacki, he himself remains a mystery. No one knows what he looks like. He avoids the media like the plague and does not give interviews. Journalists have no access to him.

title: They will ban the installation of gas stoves. It has already been decided. They have already indicated the date
description: Social campaigns, government subsidies from the "Clean Air" program, the Polish Smog Alert, which strikes alarmist tones, for several years we have had a popular uprising in Poland regarding the replacement of old stoves with gas boilers. Now it turns out that the EU wants to introduce a ban on installing them in homes.

title: The tax office will get to our December salaries. Some will have their salaries cut
description: "A man won't let a living man go..." the words of this old cabaret song fit the tax office like a glove. The tax office has no mercy. It can even look under the Christmas tree. It turns out that some people will have to pay tax on a gift received from their employer. The December paycheck may be lower than expected.

title: Public holidays in 2025. Here's when the long weekends will be. We'll show you how to plan your vacation wisely.
description: In 2025, we will work two days less than in 2024. This is because it is one day shorter, and after two we will get Christmas Eve off. The total number of hours worked in full-time employment will be 1992. This is 16 hours less than in 2024.

title: Catastrophe! Everyone goes to them. Doctors of this specialty "for the fund" do not want to treat anymore, in private practices they raise prices. It is expensive, it will be even more expensive
description: The deadlines are so distant that there is no chance of quick treatment, and the clinics are worse equipped, this is what free dental care "for the fund" looks like. Those who cannot afford it have ruin in their mouths, those who have money pay a lot to a private dentist. It is expensive, and it will get even more expensive. The increase in prices at dentists may exceed 10 percent year on year.

title: Donations targeted by tax authorities: This one mistake could end in financial disaster
description: Can a tax-free gift given by parents to children end up in trouble with the tax office? It turns out that yes. Because the tax office seizes on every pretext to question the relief. It has no mercy for formal errors.

title: Changes are coming to the Polish labor market in 2025. And it's not good news
description: Slower wage growth, accelerated automation and artificial intelligence, visible wage brackets and a persistent staff shortage – these are the key trends that employers and employees will face in 2025. The year that is ending has brought a lot of changes and uncertainty, which has left its mark on the labor market. Personnel Service has taken a closer look at the main phenomena to assess which of them will dominate the next year and which are only temporary.

title: "Realistic expectations regarding territory". Kiev will not be pleased with Emmanuel Macron's words
description: French President Emmanuel Macron said he sees no quick or easy solution to the conflict in Ukraine. In his opinion, Kiev should therefore have "realistic" expectations regarding the territory.

title: The first Polish nuclear power plant is getting closer. The government has decided
description: The provision of PLN 60.2 billion in public support in the years 2025-2030 for the Polish Nuclear Power Plants (PEJ) for the construction of the first nuclear power plant is provided for in the draft act adopted by the government on Tuesday - the Chancellery of the Prime Minister announced.

title: Will health education be mandatory? Nowacka: We are considering various scenarios
description: I believe that the subject of health education should be mandatory, but we are considering various scenarios - informed the Minister of Education Barbara Nowacka on Tuesday. She added that "various discussions are ongoing, but there is no decision yet".

title: ZUS will contact the insured. It is about the status of settlements on their accounts for 2024.
Polish energy mix. Renewable energy production grew, but at a slower pace
description: According to PSE, the priority for 2025 will be to replace old coal-fired units with new sources independent of the weather. Some experts believe that the emphasis should be on energy efficiency, and the market is sending contradictory signals with subsequent decisions to freeze electricity prices.

title: How much will teachers earn in 2025? Here are the new amounts after increases [GROSS + NET]
description: Teachers in 2025 can count on pay rises with compensation from January. Will this be enough to meet the rising costs of living? The pedagogical community is talking about indexation rather than a real increase. See how much teachers' salaries will increase - we provide gross and net amounts and the date of possible payment of higher salaries with compensation.

title: They want to buy debts and "fight" for interest and commissions charged by banks. Courts against the activities of pseudo-law firms
description: Social media portals are flooded with ads from companies offering debtors to buy back their right to interest and commissions wrongly charged by the bank. According to the courts, the terms of such sales are grossly unfair to borrowers.

title: ZUS: Applications for the cancellation of contributions for flood victims can be submitted
description: Applications for the cancellation of contributions for people affected by the September flood can be submitted from January 6. ZUS reminds that this aid covers people running a business, public benefit organizations and farmers operating in areas affected by the natural disaster.

title: More and more foreigners on the Polish labor market. Here are the latest data
description: According to data from the Central Statistical Office (GUS), foreigners accounted for 6.8 percent of all employed persons at the end of July 2024. In the same period last year, the number of employed foreigners amounted to 1,041.6 thousand, of which 405.4 thousand carried out contracts of mandate or similar forms of employment.

title: All the Sins of the Deposit System: 8 Problems Entrepreneurs Will Face
description: A step towards ecological change may turn out to be a problem for entrepreneurs. The deposit system will come into force on October 1, 2025, and is intended to reduce the negative impact of packaging on the environment. What will be the biggest problems? We answer

title: The Constitutional Tribunal will not examine the principles of including data in the register of paedophiles
description: The proceedings initiated before the Constitutional Tribunal, in which one of the courts questioned the constitutionality of certain provisions of the act allowing the inclusion of data of sex offenders in a public register (reference number P 1/20), have been discontinued.

title: Civil partnerships as shady business. Will new regulations create new pathologies?
description: Civil partnerships can be used to circumvent restrictions on the purchase of real estate by foreigners or to avoid the obligation to submit statements, believes the Ministry of Justice. What else can the proposed regulations be abused for?

title: Klicki: Small steps will not fix operational control. Will we avoid a repeat of Pegasus?
description: - It is crucial that the government does not bow to the pressure of services and individuals who use the arguments of security, war in Ukraine, Russian spies, etc., and does not acknowledge that the problem of the flawed system that allowed practices such as those revealed in the Pegasus scandal has already been solved - says Wojciech Klicki from the Panoptykon Foundation.

title: After the decision of the National Electoral Commission, PiS is waiting for a transfer from Domański's "accountant"
description: Experts in an interview with DGP admit directly: the Minister of Finance must pay the money owed from the subsidy to PiS. At this stage of the matter, there is no room for appeals, dilemmas or delays. What will Andrzej Domański do?

title: Biden smoothly hands over power to Trump
description: Donald Trump triumphantly returns to Washington. His inauguration will be a reminder of the dramatic events of four years ago

title: Widow's pension excludes senior relief. What can be done? We ask an expert
description: A widow's pension is a combination of the right to a survivor's pension after a deceased spouse and the right to one's own benefit (retirement or disability pension). Meanwhile, the mere receipt of a survivor's pension excludes relief for seniors.

title: Critical drugs weigh tanks. Poland wonders how to weaken drug monopolies?
description: The most important challenges for the Polish EU presidency include the revision of the pharmaceutical law package and work on the act on critical drugs. There are several solutions on the table that could encourage pharmaceutical companies to move production to Europe.

title: Important change in the "Active Parent" program. Who will benefit from it?
description: Financial assistance for people raising children aged 1-3 will not be included in income when applying for benefits from the social assistance system. This is an important change to the "Active Parent" program. Who will it apply to?

title: The same name means that the distributor is responsible for product defects. Important CJEU judgment on Ford
description: The domestic supplier of a product is liable for its defects if its name is the same as the name of a foreign manufacturer of the same product - this is what the Court of Justice of the EU reached in a recent judgment. The case concerned the situation of a Ford driver.

title: The Thing Is: The End of the Justin Trudeau Era. Was It a Beautiful Liberal Dream or a Naive Utopia?
description: Justin Trudeau, a symbol of liberalism for the last decade, is stepping down as Prime Minister of Canada. It is the end of an era, and perhaps even the collapse of a broader vision of the liberal world. Michał Płociński and Jędrzej Bielecki analyze the reasons for this resignation, its symbolic meaning, and the future of Canada against the backdrop of changes in global politics.

title: Russia-Ukraine War. Day 1049
description: On February 24, 2022, Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine. French media reported desertions of Ukrainians trained in France for the Anna Kyivska Brigade.

title: EBOR i Enterprise Investors inwestują w eTravel
description: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development together with Enterprise Investor Fund IX are investing in eTravel, a Polish business travel organizer. The transaction is still pending approval from the Office of Consumer Protection and Competition.

title: Chefs Across Europe Are Ditching Salmon From Menus, But Here Comes a Successor
description: Chefs in many European countries are increasingly abandoning the use of salmon in their dishes. Some are turning to other fish, which they believe are a better solution in the kitchen.

title: PKOl has a new sponsor. Radosław Piesiewicz promises that this is just the beginning
description: The KRAM company has become a new sponsor of the Polish Olympic Committee (PKOl). President Radosław Piesiewicz assures that the budget is still higher than during his predecessor's term.

title: Commission appointed by Israeli government: We must be ready for war with Turkey
description: The Israeli government-appointed Defense Budget Review and Balance of Power Commission, headed by Yakov Nagel, former head of the National Security Council, recommends that Israel prepare for a potential war with Turkey.

title: Andrzej Domański's key decision on money for PiS is a matter of hours
description: The new political season has started. On Wednesday, Sejm Speaker Szymon Hołownia is to announce his decision regarding the date of the presidential elections. There is an ongoing debate in the coalition and the opposition about what the Minister of Finance Andrzej Domański will do. Of course, it concerns the PiS finances. The decision may be a matter of hours.

title: Australian Open: Novak Djokovic Heals Trauma and Escapes Transience
description: Novak Djokovic has returned to Melbourne, from where he was deported three years ago, and he still remembers it. The Australian Open is one of his last chances at a Grand Slam victory.

title: Famous French Fashion House Sold: “We Took Advantage of the Opportunity”
description: The beginning of the year brought surprising news for many – the fashion house whose creations became one of the synonyms of the 80s has changed owners. This is a chance for a new beginning for the brand, which is identified with 80s fashion.

title: Jean-Marie Le Pen denies żyje. Zemsta na Charlesie de Gaulle’u
description: Jean-Marie Le Pen, the founder of the National Front, paved the way to power for the entire European far right. And he questioned the vision of France left by the founder of the Fifth Republic.

title: Is this the tomb of Suleiman the Magnificent?
description: Hungarian archaeologists are convinced that in the city of Szigetvár they have discovered the alleged tomb of the Turkish sultan Suleiman the Magnificent, during whose reign the Ottoman Empire reached the peak of its power.

title: Who Were Mobile Customers Moving To In 2024? This Operator Broke the Bank
description: Last year, Poles transferred 1.51 million numbers between mobile networks. That's almost 50,000 more than in 2023. Only one large telecom had a positive result.

title: Could the advisory council request data on the application of the Fiscal Penal Code by the tax office? The Supreme Administrative Court ruled
description: The fact that a professional body, e.g. tax advisors, has certain public powers does not automatically entitle it to request so-called processed information. It must specifically demonstrate why this is important for the public interest.

title: Shahla Kazimova: There was already a lot of distrust towards Russia in Azerbaijan
description: After the tragedy of the Azerbaijani Airlines plane, the slogan "Putin, apologize!" appeared. In Azerbaijan, no one writes about the disaster anymore, but about the crime - says Dr. Shahla Kazimova, head of the Center for Azerbaijani Studies at the University of Warsaw, in the podcast "Globalny Chrząszcz".

title: Donald Trump's Inauguration: When Will He Take Office as US President?
description: America is counting down the days until President-elect Donald Trump takes office as president. The official election results have already been accepted by Congress. How much time is left until the ceremonial inauguration?

title: Local authorities do not complain about the lack of problems
description: Many of last year's solutions, whether good or bad, force authorities to take on new challenges.

title: Local governments will pay less for electricity without freezing
description: The government is ending the freeze on energy prices for local governments. Market prices are falling, as confirmed by the largest cities in Poland, which are already paying less than the frozen rate. However, there are still cities where they pay more.

title: Prof. Andrzej Zoll: The Minister of Finance should not pay PiS money
description: I know that opinions are divided on this matter. I have no doubts that the payment should not have taken place. The resolution of the National Electoral Commission of August 2024, in which the Commission rejected the financial report of the PiS electoral committee, is in force - says Prof. Andrzej Zoll, former president of the Constitutional Tribunal.

title: Tesla recalls nearly 700k cars. Software issues
description: Tesla has launched a recall of over 694,000 vehicles due to a software issue that affects the functionality of the tire pressure monitoring system. This affects Tesla Model 3, Model Y, and Cybertruck models.

title: Aleksandra Dulkiewicz: We expect a large number of bicycle tourists in Gdańsk
description: Gdańsk residents have repeatedly proven that they like to use bikes. Traffic is growing year by year, but the dynamics and scope of these changes depend on the pace and complexity of the city's operations, says Aleksandra Dulkiewicz, mayor of Gdańsk.

title: Presidential Palace: Will social media dominate the 2025 presidential campaign?
description: In the first episode of the "Pałac Prezydencki" podcast this year, Michał Kolanko talks to Michał Fedorowicz, head of the European analytical collective Res Futura. Not only about the presidential campaign, but also about its context and social moods in Poland at the turn of 2024 and 2025.

title: He hit an 18-year-old woman on a crosswalk. He was banned from driving.
description: On Monday evening in Grodzisk Mazowiecki, an 18-year-old woman was hit. The perpetrator of the accident turned out to be a man who had an active driving ban.

title: Szymon Hołownia assessed Marcin Romanowski's behavior. He called the PiS MP a coward
description: - Marcin Romanowski is not in exile. He deserted, he is a coward because he is afraid to take responsibility for his actions - said the Speaker of the Sejm Szymon Hołownia in an interview with RMF FM.

title: Karol Nawrocki asked about the words of Prof. Antoni Dudek. He speaks about a "compliment"
description: During a press conference, Karol Nawrocki responded to a journalist's question about the statements made by Prof. Antoni Dudek about the president of the Institute of National Remembrance, the presidential candidate supported by PiS.

title: What about the money from the budget for PiS? Grzegorz Schetyna announces a decision
description: PiS is trying to introduce legal dualism, this will be its policy that we will be observing throughout the election campaign - said KO senator Grzegorz Schetyna in an interview with RMF FM.

title: Amber Gold: Justice Slow After Biggest Financial Scandal
description: The prosecutor's office cleared the president of Finroyal, among others, of Amber Gold money laundering. The settlement of other guilty parties indicated by the investigative committee has stalled.

title: "Hot Potato", or Who Will Be Responsible for the Illegal Detention of Marcin Romanowski
description: Will a special department prosecuting prosecutors take over the case of Marcin Romanowski's detention at a time when he was protected by international immunity? Warsaw investigators have requested this.

title: Attorney Radosław Baszuk: I did not want to grow old in a country that decides for me
description: We cannot turn a blind eye to negative signals. I see the greatest crisis in terms of human rights at the border. It is there that the situation raises the greatest concerns about respect for basic human rights - says attorney Radosław Baszuk, who specializes in criminal cases, among other things.

title: Epiphany. The presidential couple published a message
description: - May this solemn bow unite us into a community not only on the day of the Epiphany, but also every day throughout 2025 - said President Andrzej Duda, who, together with his wife, Agata Kornhauser-Duda, delivered wishes on the occasion of the Epiphany.

title: 14-year-old fatally hit on a pedestrian crossing in Wola. Investigators want to arrest the suspected driver
description: The Warsaw prosecutor's office will file a motion to the court for temporary arrest of Andrzej K., a man suspected of fatally hitting a 14-year-old boy on a pedestrian crossing in Wola.

title: How much does it cost to maintain chaplains in the military?
description: Maintaining the facilities of the Military Ordinariate of the Polish Army costs the state budget over PLN 20 million – according to the answer given to the parliamentary question of the controversial MP by Deputy Minister of Defence Paweł Bejda.

title: Bydgoszcz: Serious fire in a hall. More than 30 fire brigades on site
description: On Sunday, a fire broke out in a hall located in the Bydgoszcz Industrial Park. Several dozen fire brigades are on site.

title: Krzysztof Bosak's strong words to KO MP Robert Kropiwnicki. He talks about "politically prostituted legal authorities"
description: You have brought down the authority of lawyers to such an extent that they will soon laugh at you – said Deputy Marshal Krzysztof Bosak (Confederation), addressing Civic Coalition MP Robert Kropiwnicki during a discussion on the National Electoral Commission's decision regarding PiS on Polsat News.

title: 14-year-old boy fatally hit. Driver arrested
description: Police have detained a 43-year-old man suspected of fatally hitting a 14-year-old boy in Warsaw's Wola district. The perpetrator fled the scene and the teenager died in hospital from his injuries.

title: A Thousand Years of Bolesław the Brave's Coronation. What Will Happen in Gniezno?
description: There are plans to hold a session of the National Assembly in Gniezno, as well as to organize the 12th Congress of Gniezno – in this way we will commemorate the millennium of the coronation of Bolesław the Brave and his successor Mieszko II.

title: Poll: Would another coalition politician be a better prime minister than Donald Tusk?
description: "In your opinion, would another politician from the current coalition be a better prime minister than Donald Tusk?" - this is the question we asked the participants of the SW Research survey for rp.pl.
