description: Gawkowski: Russia's war with Poland is ongoing in cyberspace today

title: The head of the National Security Bureau began a 4-day visit to the Baltic countries
description: The head of the National Security Bureau, Minister Jacek Siewiera, began a 4-day visit to the Nordic and Baltic countries today - Sweden, Finland, Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania. The talks are related to the urgent need to strengthen international cooperation in the Baltic region, which is key to NATO and EU security. Especially in the context of the intensification of Russia's hostile actions in the Baltic Sea.

title: The head of the National Security Bureau began a 4-day visit to the Baltic countries
description: The head of the National Security Bureau, Minister Jacek Siewiera, began a 4-day visit to the Nordic and Baltic countries today - Sweden, Finland, Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania. The talks are related to the urgent need to strengthen international cooperation in the Baltic region, which is key to NATO and EU security. Especially in the context of the intensification of Russia's hostile actions in the Baltic Sea.

title: Russia Lost Europe? Disinformation Will Not Ensure Return to Gas Markets
description: The end of transit of blue fuel from Russia through Ukraine is changing Europe's "gas geography". According to Prof. Andreas C. Goldthau from the University of Erfurt, the times of Europe's dependence on Gazprom will not return and the media campaign reviving the myth of cheap Russian fuel will not help.

title: The Sejm will try to save the presidential elections. Deputies will deal with the so-called incidental act
description: During the three-day session starting on Wednesday, the Sejm will consider, among other things, the draft of the so-called incidental act concerning the determination of the validity of presidential elections, and the sanctions act. Deputies will also familiarize themselves with the program of the Polish presidency of the EU Council and vote on the Senate's amendments to the budget act.

title: The Marshal takes away Romanowski's allowance. The MP is left with only a lump sum
description: PiS MP Romanowski will not receive a parliamentary allowance, which results from the act; he is not entitled to a salary. He will continue to receive a lump sum for maintaining his parliamentary office until the Sejm passes an amendment to the act on the exercise of the mandate of a deputy and senator - said Sejm Marshal Szymon Hołownia.

title: US imposes sanctions on Orban's cabinet chief. "He is a symbol of impunity"
description: The US administration announced on Tuesday the imposition of sanctions for corruption on Antal Rogan, the head of the cabinet of Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban. The State Department said the case of the prime minister's close associate was an example of "the takeover of the state by oligarchs and undemocratic actors".

title: Transnistria freezes without gas from Russia. Thousands of homes without heating
description: More than 51,000 households in Transnistria, a separatist region of Moldova, are without gas, and 1,500 high-rise buildings have no heating, authorities in Chisinau reported. According to Prime Minister Dorin Recean, the Russian authorities are trying to influence the results of this year's parliamentary elections in Moldova by cutting off gas supplies.

title: There is little time left. Payment of the fee to the BDO database only until the end of February
description: By the end of February this year, business owners entered in the so-called waste database (BDO), who, among other things, introduce batteries, accumulators, tires into circulation, as well as packaging manufacturers, must pay an annual fee. If the entrepreneur fails to do so, he will be removed from the BDO register.

title: A glimmer of hope for US patients: Medical debts won't count towards creditworthiness
description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) announced Tuesday that financial institutions will not be able to take into account past-due debts incurred in connection with medical treatment when assessing the creditworthiness of loan applicants. Banks had opposed the regulation.

title: Poland is ahead of agriculture. Only Romania is ahead of us
description: Poland ranks second in the European Union in terms of the number of farms, second only to Romania, according to the latest Eurostat agricultural census. The data also shows that Poland stands out in terms of the share of land owned directly by farmers.

title: Romanowski will not lose all benefits from the Sejm. Hołownia says what next
description: New information in the case of Marcin Romanowski. He will not lose all his benefits from the Sejm. - PiS MP Romanowski will not receive a parliamentary allowance; he is not entitled to a salary. He will continue to receive a lump sum for maintaining his parliamentary office - said Sejm Marshal Szymon Hołownia.

title: New way of checking drivers. Changes in January 2025
description: A new whip for drivers. A system will be launched in January that will allow employers to automatically check employees' driving licenses at 6:00 every day. The Ministry of Digital Affairs announces 100% effectiveness of checks.

title: Anna Lewandowska honored. She will receive the Medal of St. Brother Albert
description: Anna Lewandowska will be awarded the Medal of St. Brother Albert. The distinction goes to people who dedicate themselves to activities for people with disabilities. The medals will be presented during the 25th Albertiana Festival.

title: He went to the mountains with his child during a hurricane. TOPR sounds the alarm
description: A man with an eight-year-old child went to the mountains during a hurricane. The tourists got stuck on Pośrednia Turnia in the Tatras. Help was needed. - They were both very hypothermic and couldn't get down even with the help of a rescuer. It was necessary to set up a heated tent - informed the TOPR duty rescuer.

title: Fixed Assets and Health Insurance Contributions: Saving Money Isn't That Easy
description: The claim that a developer can classify an apartment as a fixed asset, sell it the next day and make a profit on health insurance contributions, has as much to do with the truth as the claim that you can issue empty invoices. Yes, you can, but with a huge risk of being accused of abuse of law.

title: Some entrepreneurs must pay this fee by the end of February. From 2025, the rates will be higher
description: By the end of February this year, business owners entered in the so-called waste database (BDO), who, among other things, introduce batteries, accumulators, tires into circulation, as well as packaging manufacturers, must pay an annual fee. If the entrepreneur fails to do so, he will be removed from the BDO register.

title: The Washington Post Is Laying Off Staff as It Prepares for Trump's Second Term
description: The Washington Post reported that it plans to lay off 4 percent of its workforce. That means about 100 people will lose their jobs in various business units.

title: Employment contracts will not be mandatory for foreigners. There is a new version of the project
description: The government is easing planned changes to the employment of foreigners. It has abandoned the rule that foreigners should be employed under employment contracts.

title: The zloty has lost its strength. The dollar has not given it a chance
description: The Polish currency successfully started the day with strengthening, but eventually had to acknowledge the superiority of the dollar.

title: Estera Flieger: Marcin Wolski in Nawrocki's Staff. Is This How You Become President of All Poles?
description: What modern cultural programming initiative will Marcin Wolski, a new member of Karol Nawrocki's team, propose? One thing is certain: it's a great New Year's Eve nativity scene.

title: "Road Killing", Driving License for 17-Year-Olds and Limits for New Drivers. There is a Project
description: Work on tightening regulations and improving safety on Polish roads has entered the next stage. The project establishing the crime of so-called road murder is commented on by Minister Adam Bodnar and Deputy Minister Arkadiusz Myrcha.

title: Caritas Director in Kherson injured in Russian drone attack!
description: "We were driving behind one of our parishioners and I noticed a drone in the sky. The road was very slippery because of the frost, we couldn't stop or turn around..."

title: In the US they see what Tusk is doing! "Spare yourself the attacking..."
description: The online version of the American conservative biweekly opinion magazine National Revier has published a text that Prime Minister Donald Tusk should read with great care.

title: Zuckerberg announces groundbreaking changes to his portals!
description: "We're replacing fact checkers with community notes, simplifying our policies and focusing on reducing errors."

title: Bribe for a visa? The Ministry of Foreign Affairs sees no problem
description: In an article published on Sunday by the WP portal, it is stated that despite the revelations about the visa scandal from the PiS era, the practice is still ongoing.

title: Wasted opportunity and lack of vision. The president was supposed to support this?
description: The president outlined a plan that Poland should adopt for the presidency over a year ago. He emphasized that this was a special time and that it should be used well. He indicated that two summits should be organized: EU-United States and EU-Ukraine.

title: Arciszewska-Mielewczyk: Domański will face compensation
description: According to her, the ruling coalition is full of fear of Dr. Karol Nawrocki in the context of the presidential elections and this is why Tusk and Domański do not agree to pay PiS the funds it is entitled to.

title: Tomorrow's weather - Wednesday 08.01. Mixed precipitation and strong wind
description: Both at night and during the day there will be snow with rain and snow alone. It will be gusty. On the thermometers on Wednesday we will see from 2 to 5 degrees Celsius.

title: He came up behind a 91-year-old woman, pushed her and robbed her. She screamed: catch the thief. A witness reacted
description: An attack on a senior citizen took place in Targówek. The attacker knocked the woman down, grabbed her purse and started to run away. A witness reacted to the situation and caught the 44-year-old.

title: This resolution "simply cannot be implemented"
description: In my opinion, the money to Law and Justice, based on the resolution of the National Electoral Commission with the content that was adopted, cannot be paid out today - said on TVN24 doctor habilitated Mikołaj Małecki from the Jagiellonian University. He added that the resolution with the content that the National Electoral Commission adopted on December 30, "simply cannot be implemented".

title: He hit a 13-year-old girl on a pedestrian crossing and drove away. Footage
description: At a pedestrian crossing in the center of Milicz (Lower Silesia), the driver of a passenger car hit a 13-year-old girl and drove away. The police are looking for him and are publishing a recording of the accident.

title: Police: He crashed his car into a pole, leaving a passenger injured
description: The police have detained the driver, who is suspected of causing a serious accident and failing to provide help to an injured passenger. The incident occurred a few days ago in Warsaw's Targówek district. The 30-year-old has been temporarily arrested.

title: What about Romanowski's salary? Hołownia explains
description: Marcin Romanowski will not receive a parliamentary allowance. The act clearly states that the allowance is money related to the performance of the mandate of the deputy in the country - said the Speaker of the Sejm Szymon Hołownia after the session of the Presidium of the Sejm. He added that the PiS MP is also not entitled to a salary, because he waived it. - There remains a third component of the money that the MP receives, i.e. a lump sum for maintaining the parliamentary office - he noted. As Hołownia explained, the MP will receive this money, but "until the Sejm passes an amendment to the act on the performance of the mandate of the deputy and senator". This has already been referred to the committee.

title: "Intervention": They went from apartments to "kolkhoz". Because the railway is building a tunnel
description: More problems for Łódź residents caused by the construction of the cross-city tunnel. Those who lost their apartments as a result of the collapse of the tenement house were offered 2-3 thousand złoty in compensation. Others returned to such ruined premises that they are afraid to stay there, and still others still have to wander around hotels. Intervention Material.

title: Trump threatens Denmark, wants changes in NATO and on the map. A series of announcements were made
description: Donald Trump announced that as US president he will consider imposing tariffs on Denmark, Reuters reported. In his statement, he mentioned Greenland, which - in his opinion - could belong to the United States. What's more, the future leader does not rule out the use of force against Copenhagen and Panama. He also spoke about changes that should take place in NATO and an artificial border between the US and Canada.

title: Vladimir Putin has ordered a mission in Kursk Oblast. He has chosen a trusted general
description: Vladimir Putin wants to repel Ukrainian attacks in the Russian Kursk region. He decided that his trusted general, Deputy Minister of Defense - Yunus-Bekka Yevkurov - should be sent to the front. The military man was tasked with organizing defense in the sensitive region.

title: Fogiel: Minister Domański will face consequences in the future if he breaks the law
description: "In his conscience, Minister Andrzej Domański should decide whether he is afraid of Donald Tusk and will break the law on his political orders, or whether he is more afraid of the consequences that he will face in the future if he breaks the law" - said Radosław Fogiel, PiS MP, vice-chairman of the Sejm's Foreign Affairs Committee, in the Afternoon Interview on RMF FM.

title: Marcin Romanowski will not receive a parliamentary allowance or salary
description: Marcin Romanowski will no longer receive a parliamentary allowance or salary from the Chancellery of the Sejm. However, he will - at least for now, as admitted by the Speaker of the Sejm Szymon Hołownia - receive money to maintain his parliamentary office.

title: Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya will visit Poland. She will meet with Duda, among others
description: The leader of the Belarusian opposition Sviatlana Cichanouskaya will visit Poland. On Wednesday, she will meet with the Minister for EU Affairs Adam Szłapka and members of parliament. Talks with President Andrzej Duda and Foreign Minister Radosław Sikorski are scheduled for Thursday.

title: Nawrocki responds to criticism from Prof. Dudek
description: Karol Nawrocki said on Tuesday that he is a safe, gentle, effective and very determined man in carrying out his tasks, "especially tasks towards Poland and Poles". The presidential candidate supported by PiS responded to the words of criticism that fell on him from the historian, prof. Antoni Dudka. The scientist recently stated that Nawrocki is one of the "most dangerous people to have appeared in public space".

description: The Wrocław Lidl experienced a real siege today. After the long weekend, residents rushed to the store en masse. As our reader reports, the most common shortages were eggs, water, and toilet paper.

title: Andrzej K. arrested. His behavior in court draws attention
description: Andrzej K., suspected of causing a fatal accident and fleeing the scene, was arrested for three months. His behavior in court drew attention - he showed no remorse at all.

title: Trump's Son in Greenland: Musk's Short Post
description: The son of elected US President Donald Trump, businessman Donald Trump Jr., flew to Nuuk, the capital of Greenland, on Tuesday on his father's plane. The media reported that he plans to meet with local politicians supporting the island's independence. His visit was also commented on by Elon Musk.

title: Chełm at war with the government. There is a lawsuit
description: The Ministry of Health has completed the work of the team that planned to establish the Medical Documentation Digitization Center in Chełm. The decision was made on December 30. It may seem like a coincidence, but the next day the city of Chełm filed a lawsuit against the Ministry of Culture and National Heritage regarding the withdrawal from co-running the Museum of Remembrance of the Victims of the Volhynian Massacre.

title: Hit on Orban's key man. US decision
description: On Tuesday, the US administration announced the imposition of sanctions on Antal Rogan, who serves as the head of the cabinet of Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban. According to information provided by the State Department, the situation concerning the prime minister's close associate is described as an example of how oligarchs and undemocratic entities have an influence on taking control of the state.

title: Trump Didn't Deny It. They Asked Him About Using Troops Against Other Countries
description: President-elect Donald Trump has not ruled out military intervention in the Panama Canal and Greenland. He said he wants both areas to be under U.S. control.

title: She was traveling with a sheep. She was asked to leave the train
description: Social media has been flooded with stories of a ram named Rysiek traveling by train. This time, however, the animal was not allowed on the Warsaw-Berlin route. PKP regulations clearly define the rules for transporting animals.

title: "He had no pulse." Shocking account of 14-year-old hit-and-run
description: First there was a loud bang, then a macabre sight met the woman's eyes. A witness tells about the fatal run-over of a 14-year-old boy in Warsaw's Wola district. The perpetrator of the accident was taken to jail.

title: Girl hit in front of school. LPR action, we know what happened to the driver
description: At approximately 2:40 p.m. on Staszica Street in Międzyborów (Grodzisk district), a child was hit in front of a school. Information about the driver was provided.

title: CEO of naTemat Group leaves the company
description: Paulina Plenkiewicz, the current CEO of naTemat Group, is leaving the company. Plenkiewicz was associated with the company for 12 years, and for 4 years held the position of president.

title: This is how life is in Putin's Russia. Problems like in the 19th century, without food and medicine
description: It's not about asphalt, but about the "road of life".

title: The Sejm will not pay Romanowski. "A deputy abroad? No allowance"
description: The Speaker of the Sejm, Szymon Hołownia, announced that Marcin Romanowski will not receive a parliamentary allowance, which results from the act. - However, he will still receive a lump sum for maintaining the parliamentary office until the Sejm passes an amendment to the act on the performance of the mandate of a deputy and senator - said Hołownia.

title: The Sejm will not pay Romanowski. "A deputy abroad? No allowance"
description: The Speaker of the Sejm draws consequences.

title: The star of "Sexmission" is dead. Barbara Marcheluk was 85 years old
description: The world of theatre and cinema is in mourning after the loss of an outstanding actress, Mirosława Marcheluk. Information about her death was provided by the Filmpolski portal, and the sad news was confirmed by Katarzyna Bieńkiewicz from the New Theatre in Łódź, as well as Krzysztof Szuster, president of the Association of Polish Stage Artists. 85-year-old Marcheluk, valued for her stage creations, was associated with many theatres, including the Theatre of the Opole Region and the New Theatre in Łódź.

title: PiS kept money for a rainy day? "Where are the three billion?"
description: Law and Justice files a notice of a possible crime committed by the Minister of Finance. The party is demanding funds from subsidies that were withheld after the August ruling of the National Electoral Commission. Dariusz Joński argues in the Fakt LIVE program that "the gentlemen from PiS have already paid themselves this money during the elections". He also admits that he does not believe there are no funds in the party's account. - Where are these three billion? - asks the KO MEP.

title: He went to the top with his child. He couldn't get down.
description: Hurricane winds and thick fog meant that a man with an 8-year-old child could not descend from the peak they had climbed. TOPR had to organize a rescue expedition to Pośrednia Turnia. The conditions were so difficult that a makeshift camp had to be created.

title: Elon Musk to Shake Up Football? Dad Talks It Out
description: Liverpool are probably heading for another English championship, but the club has become a hot topic for a completely different reason. British media are reporting that the richest man in the world, Elon Musk, is interested in buying the club. The businessman's plans were revealed by... his father, Errol, in an interview with "Times Radio".

title: He kidnapped a child from the train station. There is a verdict in the high-profile case of the kidnapping of a 5-year-old
description: On December 11, 2023, a 5-year-old boy was kidnapped from the PKP railway station in Kamień Pomorski. The police then raised the alarm. Cameras recorded the man who took the child. When the 61-year-old perpetrator was arrested, the victim was naked. The boy was lying in bed in the kidnapper's apartment. This shocking case ended in a Szczecin court on Tuesday (January 7). Not only the kidnapper was sentenced. The mother of the then 5-year-old boy was also convicted.

title: The star of "Letters to Santa" on film unemployment. "The truth is that..."
description: In Polish cinemas you can still watch another part of the Christmas saga "Letters to Santa", where Wojciech Malajkat shines on the screens again. The actor has been playing the role of the shy Wojciech Kamiński for a decade. The star, reluctant to talk about his private life, claims that he is currently unemployed in the film industry.

title: Tomasz Świątek breaks his silence. "What happened happened"
description: Regaining the position of the leader of the WTA ranking in 2025 will not be a priority for Iga. She did not lose it because she lost matches - says Tomasz Świątek, Iga Świątek's father, in an interview with i.pl.

title: Trump Does Not Rule Out Military Use. Danish PM Responds
description: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen responded to Donald Trump's words about Greenland.

title: "Imagine (without drugs and filing)". Kurski responds to Nitras
description: Former TVP president Jacek Kurski responded in harsh words to the provocation of the Minister of Sport Sławomir Nitras. It was about a photo with Karol Nawrocki.

title: Greenland, Channel, Canada, NATO: Trump speaks again
description: During the briefing, Donald Trump spoke about Greenland, the Panama Canal, the "American Gulf", and NATO.

title: She went to the store and didn't come back. Police are looking for 24-year-old Karolina
description: Police in Czechowice-Dziedzice (Silesian Province) are looking for 24-year-old Karolina. The young woman left her home last Friday and has not returned since.

title: "They hit me in the head, poured boiling water on me". Police are looking for the perpetrators of the attack on the entrepreneur
description: The Podkarpackie police are looking for the perpetrators of the December attack on the home of one of the entrepreneurs running a company in Łańcut. The man was allegedly tortured by the attackers. What is known about the case and what have the officers done so far to solve the case?

title: General Knowledge Quiz for Omnibuses. Answer 11 True/False Questions!
description: Do you consider yourself an erudite? This general knowledge quiz will quickly check if you really are one! Answer 11 short true/false questions. Warning: some are really tricky, so be careful. Good luck!

title: They brutally killed two Ukrainian women who fled the war. They wanted their child. "I made a big mistake"
description: A married couple confessed to murdering two women from Ukraine. The reason was the desire to recognize the child of one of them as their own.

title: He went to the mountains with an 8-year-old, then called for help. TOPR involved over 20 people
description: The rescue operation in the High Tatras has ended happily. TOPR had to help a man who went into the mountains with an 8-year-old child. What happened during the operation?

title: They "played" at being gynecologists. New information about the scandal in the Wrocław emergency room
description: The District Prosecutor's Office in Wrocław confirmed that a notification had been received in connection with two paramedics who were supposed to perform gynecological examinations of some patients. What is known about the case?

title: He hit a 13-year-old girl and fled. Terrifying footage. Police looking for witnesses
description: A serious accident involving a 13-year-old girl occurred in Milicz in Lower Silesia. The girl was hit on a pedestrian crossing, and the driver fled. What else is known about the case?

title: Slovakia's Prime Minister Returns to Country: "I Won't Talk About My Travels"
description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico has returned to the country and posted a recording on social media on Tuesday in which he announced that he would not inform the public about his travels. He added that he would notify MPs about the December talks in Moscow.

title: Trump raises the stakes: NATO should spend 5 percent of GDP on defense
description: President-elect Donald Trump said Tuesday that NATO countries should spend 5 percent of their GDP on defense. He also expressed hope for an end to the war in Ukraine within six months; he said Joe Biden's open-door policy for Ukraine was a reason for Russian aggression.

title: Trump to Attack Greenland and the Panama Canal? "We May Have to"
description: President-elect Donald Trump said Tuesday that he could not rule out the use of force to achieve his goals of control over Greenland and the Panama Canal. He ruled out the use of force against Canada, but announced the use of economic pressure and the renaming of the Gulf of Mexico as the American Gulf.

title: Porn sites will have to verify age. Ministry of Digital Affairs presents the project
description: Service providers offering, for example, pornographic content will be required to verify the age of recipients - assumes the draft law on the protection of minors from accessing harmful content on the Internet published on Tuesday in the government's legislative work list. There will be penalties for failure to comply with the obligation.

title: Oil giant sues California: 'We're being slandered' amid recycling dispute
description: ExxonMobil, one of the world's largest oil companies, is suing the state of California. The reason? The company believes it is being slandered by the government, which is negatively affecting its relationships with customers.

title: Antoni Macierewicz and alleged diplomatic treason. We explain what may threaten Poland
description: Experts differ in their assessment of whether a country whose representative may have committed diplomatic treason will lose in the eyes of its foreign partners. It may show that it is settling accounts on its own, but it may also be removed from backstage negotiations.

title: Television Theatre: The fatal rush to follow trends
description: In the past year, the management of the TV Theatre changed (Michał Kotański and Wojciech Majcherek), and viewers decided that they liked watching performances they already knew the most.

title: The company delivers 35 packages per second
description: The InPost Group is rapidly expanding its network of parcel machines, the popularity of which is helping the company gain market share.

title: Information about the debts of 15 million people will disappear
description: Financial institutions will not be able to take into account overdue debts of Americans arising in connection with medical treatment. Records of medical debts, amounting to $49 billion, will disappear from the credit information of 15 million people. Banks opposed this regulation.

title: "We give this matter a huge importance". Czarzasty: I'm fed up with it
description: We give this case a huge rank, but in reality this is a person who will potentially go to prison, potentially stole, potentially is a bandit - said Włodzimierz Czarzasty in "Fakty po Faktach" on TVN24. He referred in this way to the events surrounding PiS MP Marcin Romanowski. The Deputy Speaker of the Sejm and co-chairman of the New Left said that he "simply had enough" of dealing with this topic.

title: A security guard at a train station used a stun gun on a drunk woman. An indictment has been filed with the court.
description: Two months ago, two security guards from the Central Station intervened against a drunk young woman sitting in a restaurant on the mezzanine. One of them grabbed the 19-year-old and shocked her several times with a stun gun. The case went to court.

title: Donald Trump on Greenland and the Panama Canal. He Does Not Rule Out the Use of Force
description: President-elect Donald Trump stated that he cannot guarantee the exclusion of military or economic actions as a means of attempting to take control of the Panama Canal and the territory of Greenland. - I do not intend to commit to that - he replied to a reporter's question.

title: A three-year-old girl spilled a pot of soup on herself and was taken to hospital
description: In Białogard (West Pomerania), a three-year-old girl spilled a pot of hot soup on herself. An Air Ambulance helicopter took her to hospital. She has second-degree burns.

title: Almost 160 kilometers per hour in Germany. Injured
description: Strong winds hit northern and western Germany on Monday evening. At least three people were injured. The difficult weather conditions caused disruptions to road, rail and ferry transport.

title: "Stop road bandits". The project is ready, there will be higher penalties for drivers
description: - People who break the court ban (driving - ed.) will be severely punished and will feel the changes we propose the most. The draft of the new law has already been prepared - said Deputy Minister of Justice Arkadiusz Myrcha. He emphasized that the tragic accident from a few days ago, caused by a driver who was banned from driving, is yet another proof that changes to road traffic regulations are necessary.

title: A crazy escape. He was driving against traffic at high speed
description: He did not stop for a checkpoint, and while escaping, he was driving against traffic and tried to cause a collision with a police car. He was drunk, he will be held accountable, among other things, for assaulting police officers.

title: Venezuelan opposition leader: My son-in-law was kidnapped
description: Edmundo Gonzalez, the leader of the Venezuelan opposition, said that his son-in-law had been kidnapped by masked men and that the search for him was ongoing.

title: What to do with the Christmas tree after the holidays?
description: The Municipal Cleaning Company is responsible for collecting Christmas trees that have been left in homes after Christmas. The tree can be taken to the Selective Collection Point for Municipal Waste. In turn, those in pots are accepted by the Municipal Forests.

title: More energy from biofuels. New targets adopted by the government
description: The share of energy from renewable sources, including biofuels in transport, is to be less than 15 percent by 2030 - according to the draft law on biofuels adopted by the government on Tuesday.

title: Where is the truth about depression therapy? "Many myths have grown up"
description: Some people disregard depression, saying that it is fashionable to be sad today. Others believe that it is best to get down to work, and the melancholy will pass. And although neither approach helps those who suffer, there may be a small grain of truth in them. Where is the truth about the therapy of this mental disorder?

title: Exercises alleviate depression and anxiety. What is worth knowing about sports therapy?
description: The popular statement of the sixteenth-century royal physician, "Movement will replace almost any medicine, but no medicine will replace movement," is gaining popularity in modern psychiatry. Physical activity can be beneficial in the treatment of emotional problems in a teenager. How to use sports on prescription?

title: Marta is 34 years old and high-functioning. Few people know that without medication she wouldn't get out of bed
description: Untreated depression ends in disorganization of life, social self-exclusion. It often ends in addiction, because people start to seek help in alcohol, drugs, compulsive behaviors. Sometimes it ends in death.

title: Strength training has a rejuvenating effect. "Intense muscle contractions are key"
description: In light of the latest research, the gym can be not only a place to shape your figure, but also a laboratory of longevity. Scientists from the University of Bonn reveal that strength training can activate cellular mechanisms that are essential for maintaining the health of our organs and tissues.

title: Three cups of tea a day. That's how much you need to drink to stay young
description: Can You Slow Down the Aging Process with Tea? Scientists believe so.

title: Denmark responds to Trump's threats. Prime Minister appeals to media
description: - I can't imagine that it will come to that - said Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen, referring to Donald Trump's words. The US president-elect stated that he could not rule out the use of force to take control of Greenland.

title: Marcin Romanowski's finances hit. Hołownia's clear announcement
description: - Marcin Romanowski will not receive a parliamentary allowance, which results from the law. He is not entitled to a salary - said Sejm Speaker Szymon Hołownia. The former deputy minister of justice from PiS, who is currently in Hungary, can still count on a lump sum to maintain his parliamentary office. This may change if the Sejm passes and the president signs changes to the law.

title: Polish drivers' mishap in the Czech Republic. Cars battered
description: Driving in higher areas is not the easiest. Especially if the roads are covered in snow and we do not have special chains on our wheels. Drivers from Poland have recently learned about the unpleasant consequences of their lack, and their road accidents have taken the Czech internet by storm.

title: Poland is second in Europe. Only the Czech Republic is better
description: Poles can be happy. According to the latest Eurostat data, the unemployment rate in our country was 3.0 percent in November 2024, compared to 3.1 percent in October. This is the second lowest result in the European Union. The Czech Republic came first.

title: Maciej Konieczny is a guest of Rozmowa at 7:00 on Radio RMF24
description: The guest of Rozmowa at 7:00 on Radio RMF24 will be MP, vice-chairman of the Razem Party Parliamentary Group Maciej Konieczny. We will talk about the upcoming presidential elections and the candidate of the Razem party.

title: Strike, debts and holidays in Thailand. What's happening at Pogoń Szczecin?
description: ​The president is on vacation, the players are on strike because they are not getting paid, the club is not commenting, and there is a lot of turmoil around Pogoń Szczecin. The team has financial problems, although it is not entirely clear how big they are. The club is sparing in reporting on its situation, which only adds to the tense atmosphere around the port team.

title: Adam Małysz: Piotr Żyła is completely out of control
description: The President of the Polish Ski Association, Adam Małysz, assessed the performance of the Polish Ski Association at the Four Hills Tournament. Well-deserved, good words were received by the eighth competitor in the general classification of this event, Paweł Wąsek. And how does Małysz evaluate our three veterans: Piotr Żyła, Dawid Kubacki and Kamil Stoch, who trains in Poland?

title: How many drivers are missing in Poland? We know the latest calculations
description: According to the latest report of the Employers' Association "Transport and Logistics Poland", there is currently a shortage of around 120,000 professional drivers. The document will be officially presented on Wednesday, but the most important conclusions from the publication have already been reached by RMF FM reporter Michał Dobrołowicz.

title: It will be very slippery at night. Almost all of Poland in alerts
description: It will be very slippery at night. Almost all of Poland in alerts

title: Trump to Buy Greenland? Denmark Responds Strongly
description: - Greenland is not for sale - stated Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen firmly. This is a response to suggestions from Donald Trump, who said he would like the island to become property of the United States.

title: Father and son stuck in Tatras. 21 rescuers fought for their lives
description: Due to hurricane winds and thick fog, a man and an eight-year-old boy were stuck on Pośrednia Turnia in the Tatras. Hypothermic, they could not get down, even with the help of a rescuer. It was necessary to set up a heated tent.

title: He Wants to Change Maps. Trump Threatens Not Just About Greenland
description: Donald Trump surprised many times with his declarations during Tuesday's conference. Even before his inauguration as president, he did not rule out military intervention against Greenland, which he sees as part of the US. He also spoke about the Gulf of Mexico, which he wants to change to the American name.

title: Collision between a tanker and a bus. The bus overturned. The LPR helicopter is in action
description: After 3 p.m. in the town of Nowe Draganie in Płock County, a road accident occurred. There are initial findings.

title: More than 150 journalists: the text in "Press" is a lampoon and a gross abuse. The editorial office complains about hate
description: An open letter in which an article in the monthly "Press" about Magdalena Kicińska was assessed as a "lampoon", "violent revenge, and in human terms - plain meanness", was signed by over 150 journalists and publicists. The editor-in-chief and owner of the magazine, Andrzej Skworz, whose improper behavior towards his subordinates was revealed over two years ago, does not agree with such an assessment, and many critics accuse them of having been "clearly manipulated into untruths". Skworz and the author of the text, Mariusz Kowalczyk, emphasize that they have been the target of hate.

title: Vectra with a promotion for free internet for a year
description: The Vectra cable network has prepared a promotional offer with fast fiber-optic internet up to 1.2 Gb/s for up to 12 months for free. The company states that thanks to this option, you can save over PLN 1,600 in your household budget per year.

title: Friendly guy Janek in the new NASK campaign
description: The NASK research institute has launched a campaign under the slogan “Be visible online”, the aim of which is to promote the .pl domain.

title: This is how the Confederation is fighting against the KO and PiS candidates. It does not like the symbol of remembrance of the ghetto uprising
description: A face mask, a ribbon in the colors of Ukraine and a daffodil pinned to the clothes of the KO and PiS candidates for president of Poland - this is what the Confederation criticizes, commenting: "No, thank you."

title: Prof. Zoll: Domański has no right to pay PiS money
description: "Question of the Day."

title: Slovakian Prime Minister Returns to Country. He Will Report on His Visit to Moscow
description: He announced a change in foreign policy.

title: Couple Kills Two Ukrainian Women. It Was About a Child
description: The trial has begun.

title: “I went out onto the balcony, lit a cigarette and cried.” Tokarczuk in conversation with Dua Lipa
description: A half-hour interview about literature and animal cruelty.

title: Orban's man under sanctions. "Symbol of oligarchy in Hungary"
description: The US imposed a penalty on Orban's cabinet chief.

title: Surprising Reports on Putin's Health: These Two Details Were Supposed to Give Him Away
description: Speculations about the health of Russian President Vladimir Putin have not died down. More information has emerged about suspicious symptoms in the politician. On Tuesday, January 7, Putin appeared in public as part of the nationwide charity campaign "New Year's Wish Tree". Journalists immediately picked up on two symptoms that could indicate the dictator's poor health - a mysterious bruise on his hand and very red eyes. Putin's health is considered one of his most closely guarded secrets.

title: The "Trump Effect" on Facebook and Instagram. Zuckerberg Announces Major Changes
description: Donald Trump has not yet officially begun his presidential term, but the entire world is already positioning itself towards the vision of his rule, which some call the "Trump effect". This applies to both countries and organizations that encompass the entire planet with their influence. One such organization is certainly Meta, whose CEO Mark Zuckerberg has just announced major changes.

title: Transfer record of the 1st League. Young talent sold overseas
description: There has never been such a big transfer from the 1st League. Wiktor Bogacz, a striker from Miedź Legnica, will swap the Ekstraklasa for the MLS. The "Weszło" portal reported that the 20-year-old will move to New York Red Bull for 2 million euros.

title: The national team star has moved to Ekstraklasa. He is to fight to stay in the league
description: Radomiak Radom is arming itself for the fight to stay in the Ekstraklasa. On Tuesday, Paulius Golubickas, who last played for Žalgiris Vilnius, joined the club. The Lithuanian representative has signed a 2.5-year contract with the Radom club.

title: Trump's Dangerous Declaration Isn't All He Sent His Son on an Important Mission
description: Donald Trump continues to surprise. After declaring that Canada, Greenland, and the Panama Canal should belong to the United States, he has now admitted that he cannot rule out the need to use military means to achieve this goal. The president-elect's superpower ambitions sound threatening to the world. Meanwhile, Trump's son is visiting Greenland. It seems that this is part of the president-elect's strategy.

title: Patient describes symptoms of HMPV infection. "The worst I've ever felt"
description: Portugal confirmed Tuesday that it has been infected with the respiratory virus HMPV. Earlier, an increase in cases was reported in China. Meanwhile, foreign media are publishing accounts of patients who have been infected with the virus. Diane Davison, a 60-year-old lawyer from Maryland, spoke about her difficult experiences with the disease.

title: Will there be another baby in "The Farmer Wants a Wife"? Dominika reacts to pregnancy rumors
description: In the 11th season of the program "The Farmer Wants a Wife", viewers witnessed the birth of a feeling between Rafał, a pepper grower, and Dominika, who is involved in marketing. Although the distance between their homes exceeds 400 kilometers, the couple wants to live together. That is why one of the Internet users asked Dominika a very indiscreet question about a child. Will there be another baby in "The Farmer"?

title: Fico returned to the country and published a recording. "The so-called media and opposition stirred up the scandal"
description: Robert Fico spoke for the first time since returning to the country. The Slovak Prime Minister posted the recording on social media.

title: What is the religion of the US congressmen? The list is given
description: Information was provided about the percentage of politicians declaring themselves Christians in the US Senate and House of Representatives.

title: "For fuck's sake, there is no consent for this." Czarzasty against Hołownia's idea
description: I am speaking out unequivocally against the idea of ​​Marshal Hołownia regarding the recognition or non-recognition of the presidential elections – said Włodzimierz Czarzasty.

title: Jubilee Year 2025. Caritas leads a campaign for debt forgiveness
description: The Jubilee Year is underway. Over half a million believers have already crossed the Holy Door in the Vatican Basilica.

title: Germany: Masked man shoots two people, manhunt launched
description: A manhunt for the perpetrator of an attack on the headquarters of a company in the city of Bad Friedrichshall began in Germany on Tuesday evening. What is known about the incident?

title: For Trump, 2 percent for defense is not enough. The president-elect has made it clear what he expects from Europe
description: Future US President Donald Trump has once again clearly indicated that NATO member states should increase defense spending. What scale does the politician have in mind?

title: An unusual dictation quiz in reverse for the masters. 9/13 is the minimum
description: We have an unusual dictation quiz for you, backwards. You have to indicate the incorrect entry. It seems simple, but only 20 percent of you answer the 11th question. Only a smartass will get a full set. Are you one? We keep our fingers crossed

title: Canadian PM responds to Trump's words. Trudeau says clearly: There is no chance
description: Justin Trudeau posted a post on social media in response to Donald Trump's recent words. The president-elect joked that "Canada loves the idea of ​​being the 51st state in America."

title: 8-year-old girl hit in front of school. LPR helicopter in action
description: In Międzyborow in Mazovia, a car hit a child right in front of a school building. The eight-year-old suffered a leg injury and was transported to hospital by LPR helicopter. What else is known about the accident?

title: South Korea Plane Crash: Government Confirms Earlier Reports
description: The circumstances of the Jeju Air plane crash that crashed at Muan Airport in South Korea in late December are under investigation. Authorities briefed the media on Tuesday on their latest findings.

title: The CJEU is to examine the criteria for the independence of judges. This is what the government wants
description: The government has presented a new position to the CJEU concerning the status of judges, the Ministry of Justice announced. The government wants the CJEU to comment on the criteria for examining the independence of judges and the possibility of national courts bypassing provisions that limit the effectiveness of EU law.

title: Will Greenland Become Part of the US? Trump Does Not Rule Out the Use of Force
description: Donald Trump Jr., the son of former US President Donald Trump, landed in Nuuk, the capital of Greenland, on Tuesday, drawing much interest from the local community. His visit, although presented as private, has sparked political commentary and speculation.

title: Shooting in Bad Friedrichshall, Baden-Württemberg. Two men dead
description: Two men were fatally wounded in gunfire in the town of Bad Friedrichshall in Baden-Württemberg, southern Germany.

title: Monitor Polski from January 7, 2025 (items 5 - 10)
Journal of Laws of January 7, 2025 (items 12 - 16)
Indonesia has joined BRICS. And there are more willing
description: Since the new year, the BRICS group has welcomed a new member - the world's largest Muslim community (227 million people) - Indonesia. The country joins Brazil, Russia, India, China and such economic titans as Egypt, Iran, the United Arab Emirates and Ethiopia, who were accepted last year.

title: ZUS does not recognize the right to mining pensions of some employees. The problem is the definition
description: The Social Insurance Institution does not recognize the right to mining pensions for some employees of mining companies - informed the president of ZE PAK, Piotr Woźny, during Tuesday's meeting of the subcommittee for just transformation. Representatives of ZUS and the Ministry of Labor indicated that the problem is the definition of "mining work".

title: Dozens of beaches have been closed, tourists are complaining about vomiting and diarrhea
description: Nearly 40 beaches in the state of Sao Paulo, in southeastern Brazil, have been closed by the sanitary and epidemiological services due to water contamination with viruses. According to local media, hospitals are overflowing with sick tourists.

title: He hit a woman on a pedestrian crossing and fled. A month later he reported to the police station with a lawyer
description: The driver who hit a woman on a pedestrian crossing in Ołtarzew near Warsaw a month ago is in police custody. He reported to the police station with a lawyer present. He admitted to the charges brought against him.

title: The European Commission is taking a closer look at Elon Musk's actions
description: The European Commission will look into whether the richest man on Earth and owner of the X platform is interfering in the German Bundestag elections scheduled for February. On Thursday, Elon Musk is scheduled to talk live with the leader of the far-right, anti-EU and anti-immigration Alternative for Germany.

title: "Soldiers would run around in tracksuits." Deputy Minister of National Defense reveals
description: Out of 41 notifications submitted in the case of the Smolensk subcommittee, 21 investigations have already been initiated, of which a dozen or so concern Antoni Macierewicz himself - Cezary Tomczyk, Deputy Minister of National Defense, reported in "Kropka nad i" on TVN24. He also informed that he will soon present new information regarding Macierewicz's actions as head of the Ministry of National Defense. He said that during the time when this politician headed the ministry, uniforms were not purchased for soldiers.

title: Poles don't cancel more than a million doctor visits a year. There's an idea on how to change that
description: Over a million doctor's visits are not canceled by patients every year. What's more, some people sign up for several different visits at the same time, in several different places. The e-registration system, which is already operating on a pilot basis in 150 facilities, is intended to catch such situations and make it easier for us to cancel a visit if we know we will not make it.

title: Glass on the roads. Warnings in many places
description: At night and on Wednesday morning, it will be slippery on the roads of almost all of Poland. After rain, sleet and wet snow, a layer of ice may form on the roads. Warnings from the Institute of Meteorology and Water Management are in force.

title: The shields are bravely digging tunnels. The traffic control tower is taking shape
description: Work on the construction of three new stations of the second metro line is moving forward. The shield Anna is helping in this, having created 1,800 meters of tunnel for the underground railway, and its sister Krystyna - 1,200 meters. A tower is emerging at the technical and holding station, from which it will be possible to control train traffic.

title: She only went to the store. Karolina Wróbel disappeared without a trace
description: Karolina Wróbel from Czechowice-Dziedzice left home on Friday to do some shopping and disappeared. She did not contact her loved ones, who are appealing for help in the search. The police are also conducting their own operation, publishing a description of the 24-year-old. Among others, two young sons are waiting for her return.

title: Two bodies found in plane. They were in landing gear bay
description: Two people were found dead on board a plane flying from New York to Florida. The bodies were discovered in the landing gear compartment during a routine inspection. It is not known how or why they got there. An investigation has been launched to clarify the circumstances of the incident.

title: New visa scandal? MFA spokesman: There is no evidence
description: The MFA spokesman commented on media reports that corruption in the Philippines is still ongoing with Polish visas in the background. According to Paweł Wroński, there is no evidence of Polish officials participating in such activities. He added that Warsaw is trying to introduce basic order and regain control over the visa system after a long period of chaos.

title: Driver missed the turn. Surprising view on expressway S19
description: The 33-year-old wanted to take a break from his journey and go to the Service Area. However, the turn did not go smoothly - the driver hit the barriers and his car hung on them. The man was taken to hospital with injuries.

title: Two victims of shooting in Germany. Manhunt for attacker underway
description: ​Two people were killed and one is in critical condition after a masked person started shooting at a company headquarters in Bad Friedrichshall in Baden-Württemberg in southwestern Germany on Tuesday evening. A manhunt for the attacker is underway, the police spokesman said.

title: ​Trump did not rule out using force to occupy Greenland and the Panama Canal
description: President-elect Donald Trump said at a press conference on Tuesday that he could not rule out the use of force to seize control of Greenland and the Panama Canal. He also revealed that he would not use force against Canada, but economic pressure, and would rename the Gulf of Mexico to the American Gulf.

title: Prime Minister Fico found himself. He doesn't want to reveal where he was
description: The Prime Minister of Slovakia has not been seen in public for a long time, but that should change soon. Robert Fico has returned to the country, which he announced in a recording posted on social media. The politician, however, made it clear that he would not inform the public about his travels.

title: The sickness season is in full swing. All the beds in the hospital are occupied
description: The sickness season is in full swing. All the beds in the hospital are occupied.

title: To open the year to Poland. Cichanouskaya: we have a common future
description: To open the year to Poland. Cichanouskaya: we have a common future

title: Robbery at the Marki station. Suspects caught. We know who they are
description: It is already known who will be held responsible for the robbery with the use of a dangerous tool at an LPG gas station. The incident took place just before Christmas in Marki, and the suspects are already in the hands of the police.

title: Changes in the Sejm. "The End of an Era"
description: The Chancellery of the Sejm and the Media Service Office are introducing changes to the work of Sejm journalists and members of parliament. From Wednesday, the place designated for press conferences of members of parliament will change, which means that observers of political life at Wiejska will see a new background. The place has also changed for generations of journalists, the "journalists' tables", i.e. the work zone of Sejm correspondents.

title: Kyiv reacts to US move. Trump envoy's visit postponed
description: Advisor to the President of Ukraine, Mykhailo Podolyak, assessed that the postponement of the visit of Donald Trump's special envoy, General Keith Kellogg, to Kiev is a positive signal that indicates the United States is looking for tools to influence Russia.

title: Discussion on money for PiS. "It shouldn't be paid out"
description: The discussion on subsidies for Law and Justice is still ongoing. Prof. Andrzej Zoll assessed that the Minister of Finance has no right to pay PiS money.

title: Trump has made demands on NATO. Poland is closest to fulfilling them
description: Donald Trump, who was elected president, suggested Tuesday that NATO countries should spend 5 percent of their GDP on defense. Trump also expressed optimism that the conflict in Ukraine could be over within six months. He said that Joe Biden's policy, including an open NATO approach to Ukraine, was the cause of Russian aggression.

title: NATO ships to sail to protect key facilities

Ultimately, it is planned to use the Turkish BATU power unit, which will consist of a V12 diesel engine with 1,500 hp and a transmission with six forward and two reverse gears. title: FWSZ revenue and expenditure performance at the end of June 2024
description: This year, the Armed Forces Support Fund (FWSZ) operated by the Bank Gospodarstwa Krajowego had accumulated savings of PLN 7.785 billion at the beginning of the year, and the revenues planned for 2024 amounted to PLN 48.092 billion, including PLN 34.109 billion from debt mechanisms. By June 30 this year, the revenue plan was implemented at the level of 19.6% and just 3.6%, respectively. FWSZ expenditures in 2024 were planned at PLN 52.590 billion, of which PLN 45.875 billion were for the purposes specified in the "Armed Forces Development Program" (PRSZ). By June 30 this year, the expenditure plan was implemented at the level of 24.5% and 22.2%, respectively, allocating only PLN 10.197 billion for the technical modernization of the Polish Army. Total debt of FWSZ at the end of June this year reached the level of PLN 28.737 billion.

title: Draft budget for Poland's defence in 2025
description: On September 30 this year, the Sejm of the Republic of Poland received the draft budget act for 2025 prepared by the Council of Ministers. It planned state budget revenues in the amount of PLN 632.8 billion, a state budget expenditure limit of PLN 921.6 billion and a state budget deficit of no more than PLN 288.8 billion (7.3% of GDP). The total amount planned for defense next year from the state budget and the Armed Forces Support Fund (FWSZ) is PLN 186.5 billion, which is to constitute 4.7% of Poland's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) planned in 2025 (in the amount of PLN 3,973.1 billion) and 18.7% of the total expenditure of the state budget and FWSZ. This means an increase in the defense spending plan next year compared to the plan for 2024 by PLN 28.6 billion, i.e. 18.1%.

title: Korean deliveries update
