title: South Korea with Nuclear Weapons? US Faces Key Decision [COMMENTARY]
description: [Back in August 2024, we wrote about the fact that the authorities of the Republic of Korea unequivocally spoke negatively about the ideas approving the acquisition of nuclear weapons by Seoul](https://defence24.pl/polityka-obronna/korea-poludniowa-pozyska-bron-jadrowa). It was then that the then Defense Minister of this country Shin Won-sik publicly stated that deciding to take such a step would result in very serious consequences for South Korea, such as a financial crisis and a significant deterioration in relations with one of its most important allies, the United States.

title: Healthy eating in all conditions [INTERVIEW]
description: **Mateusz Multarzyński, Defence24.pl: I would like to start our conversation by asking about the beginnings of FIT-LAND and the candy bar business, as well as entering the military market with these products.**

title: Polish Minister of Defence: New Loan from the USA for Poland
description: Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Defense Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz announced that Poland will receive another loan from the USA to support the transformation of the Polish Armed Forces. What amount is involved?

title: Bejda: We Must Keep Up the Tempo. Borsuk IFV Procurement By Year's End [INTERVIEW]
description: In an interview with Defence24.pl, Paweł Bejda, Secretary of State at the Ministry of National Defence (MON), emphasizes that the modernization process must be carried out dynamically due to threats in Poland’s surrounding environment. “The operational requirements of the Polish Armed Forces require a radical increase in competencies and production capacities on the part of the domestic defense industry,” he underscores. In the interview, he also discusses plans concerning the Borsuk and K2PL programs, ammunition production and standardization, and financing modernization.

title: The War for the Sahel [REPORT]
description: The Sahel is Africa’s Achilles heel today. As the region grapples with numerous crises—ranging from the alarming intensification of jihadist insurgencies, ongoing political instability fueled by coups, illegal migration, to increasing environmental degradation—the need for comprehensive international engagement has never been more urgent.

title: Homar-K System Test Launches in Ustka
description: The General Command of the Armed Forces reported the historic first-ever rocket firing with the Homar-K system at the Ustka firing range.

title: East Front News #23: France's Military Shift in Africa, South Korea Secures Arms Deliveries to Poland
description: East Front News is a weekly newsletter summarizing the past week’s most important events concerning security and the situation in the Central and Eastern Europe region. It includes original opinions and comments, along with key news items significant from a Polish perspective. If you would like to receive this newsletter, please sign up by clicking**  <button class="btn btn-primary btn-sm" type="button"> HERE </button>**.

title: French forces practice rapid air deployment to Estonia
description: As part of the exercise Pikne, approximately 200 soldiers from the French Armed Forces« 3rd Marine Infantry Parachute Regiment arrived at Ämari Air Base today during a rapid deployment drill. The troops, transported by aircraft, relocated to integrate with the NATO multinational battlegroup permanently stationed in Estonia. The joint units are practicing responding to military threats on land, in the air, and at sea.

title: Testing and research of hydropneumatic suspension modules
description: In industry, and especially in the arms sector, precise and reliable testing of components is crucial. In the case of hydropneumatic systems and suspensions, which operate in extreme conditions, simulating real operating conditions is essential. Having the ability to replicate such conditions on the test shop floor allows for precise analysis of component behaviour and ensures their reliability during actual operation in military vehicles.

title: Will the Polish Army Get a New Steel Helmet? The Ministry of Defence Has a Plan
description: Steel helmets will be replaced with composite ones, the Polish Ministry of Defence (MOD) confirms. However, since polymer materials lose their properties over time and helmets require replacement, the ministry is also exploring helmets made from new steel alloys.

title: German-Nordic Air Defence Over Rzeszów
description: The Norwegian authorities have announced plans to send approximately 100 soldiers, air defence systems, and F-35 fighter jets to Poland. „We are standing by our commitments within NATO,” said the head of Norway’s Ministry of Defense.

title: France Retreats from Africa: A Major Shift in Military Strategy
description: Paris is opting to reduce the number of soldiers in additional African countries. Following the significant withdrawal from Operation Barkhane (over 5,000 troops) and subsequent coups in Mali, Burkina Faso, and Niger, the next phase of adjusting its presence is underway. France plans to maintain its missions with a small number of training forces but in a greater number of West African countries. From the current 2,300 soldiers, only 600—or even fewer—will remain after the termination of the defence agreement with Chad.

title: Bejda on K2PL: Haste is not advisable. "The deal is complicated"
description: **The Ministry of Defence and the Armaments Agency are waiting for the conclusion of negotiations between the Polish Armaments Group and Hyundai Rotem on the purchase and production of K2PL. This includes the polonisation of production at Polish industrial facilities.**

title: Funding For the Polish Artillery Purchases in Korea Secured
description: **Bank Gospodarstwa Krajowego has signed agreements for the financing of the second batch of executive contracts from the Republic of Korea for K9A1/K9PL howitzers and Homar-K multi-launcher rocket launchers with ammunition, Deputy Minister of Defence Paweł Bejda announced.**

title: Polish Leopard 2PLs Replace Twardy Tanks in Latvia
description: Polish Operational Command of the Armed Forces has announced that, as part of the rotation of equipment for the Polish Military Contingent in Latvia (PKW Łotwa), Leopard 2PL tanks have replaced the previously used PT-91 Twardy tanks. This change enhances the standardization of the NATO battle group stationed there.

title: Last Rak Mortars Delivered to the 12th Mechanized Brigade
description: Deputy Minister of Defence announced that the 12th Mechanized Brigade has received its full inventory of Rak self-propelled mortars.

title: Poland Procures Missiles for Its “Current and Future Fighters”
description: Deputy Minister of Defence Paweł Bejda announced the signing of a contract for the Polish Air Force to acquire AIM-9X Block II air-to-air missiles.

description: East Front News is a weekly newsletter summarizing the past week’s most important events concerning security and the situation in the Central and Eastern Europe region. It includes original opinions and comments, along with key news items significant from a Polish perspective. title: Submarines and more. Polish MoD Reveals Navy Modernization Schedule
description: **A contract will be signed later this year for a rescue ship in the Ratownik programme, the Deputy Prime Minister and head of the Ministry of Defence, Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz, said during the celebration of the Polish Navy Day.**

title: French instructors in Ukraine
description: France, taking a significant step towards strengthening Ukraine’s defence capabilities, has engaged its military instructors in training Ukrainian soldiers in France, Poland, and potentially within Ukraine itself. This move underscores Paris’s growing commitment to supporting Kyiv amid the prolonged conflict with Russia, while also solidifying France’s position as a key partner in reshaping Europe’s security architecture. While some government ministers support the initiative, a final decision from the president is still pending.

title: Brig. Gen. Mokrzycki: We must recognize the importance of large-scale military operations
description: On the sidelines of the 2nd Territorial Defense Symposium in Krakow, Defence24 editors had the opportunity to talk to the Chief of Staff of the 2nd Polish Corps. Brig. Gen. Jarosław Mokrzycki spoke about the importance of the Territorial Defense Forces in terms of NATO’s eastern flank, but also about the cooperation between the 2nd Polish Corps and the US Army V Corps and the importance the 2nd Polish Corps itself plays in defense planning. There were also references to experiences and lessons learned about observations of events on the frontlines of the war in Ukraine. The head of Defence24’s analysis department, Jacek Raubo, conducted the interview.

title: Türkiye's Defense Spending to Hit Record High (Again)
description: Türkiye’s military investments have been on a steady rise each year, aiming to reduce reliance on foreign arms imports. Vice President Cevdet Yılmaz recently announced that Türkiye plans to allocate a record-high budget for defense and security in 2025. He also confirmed that the government will continue its growth strategy centered on the private sector

title: How do criminal groups infiltrate businesses?
description: In Europol’s December 2024 report, “Leveraging legitimacy: How the EU’s most threatening criminal networks abuse legal business structures,” the authors point out that the use of legal business structures allows organized crime to gain more power and influence, creating a self-perpetuating mechanism that threatens the foundations of society.

description: General Wiesław Kukuła visited Germany on November 28, where he met with his counterpart, General Carsten Breuer.

description: The two-day conference summarizing the first stage of work under the SZPEJ operation, implemented since January 2024, has ended.

title: Eurocorps Joint Committee Conference in Poland
description: The 33rd conference of the Eurocorps Common Committee, which took place on 19 November in Poland, has ended.

title: Russia threatens Europe's cybersecurity - Prime Minister makes strategic decision
description: Prime Minister Donald Tusk met with Estonian Prime Minister Kristen Michal in Warsaw. The talks focused on the security of Poland and Estonia, assistance to Ukraine, and cooperation in the region and within NATO. The politicians paid special attention to the need to ensure cybersecurity in Europe. That is why Donald Tusk decided that TVN and Polsat television stations will be placed on the list of strategic companies that are subject to special protection, e.g. against aggressive takeovers.

title: Polish Defence and Security Equipment Catalogue
description: The Polish defence industry plays a significant role in the country’s economy and global standing. The Polish Defence And Security Equipment Catalogue showcases a range of advanced technologies and innovative solutions developed by Polish companies. These innovations span various sectors, including electronics, cyberspace, armoured vehicles and artillery systems, weapons systems, aerospace & space as well as air and missile defence, which highlights  Poland’s leadership in defence and security. The Catalogue contains 207 products by 61 companies.

title: NATO Summit in Washington
description: President Andrzej Duda has said that no one from the outside can prevent Ukraine from joining NATO as such a decision is taken by alliance members and Ukrainians.

title: Statement by President at Peace Summit for Ukraine in Switzerland
description: President:  Ukraine, as a victim of this aggression, has the full right to defend its sovereignty and independence by any means that are in accordance with the international law. And it is the obligation of the entire international society to spare no efforts in supporting Kyiv in its struggles.

title: Prague. Statement by President at ammunition summit
description: President: The greatest responsibility for supplying ammunition and armaments to Ukraine lies with the West. This is in our common interest.

title: Vancouver. President: We are NATO! We are stronger together!
description: Address by the President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda at the seminar „Transatlantic Security in the Shadow of Russia’s Long War”.

title: Andrzej Duda's meeting with Donald Trump
description: During his visit to New York, Polish President Andrzej Duda met with the 45th President of the United States Donald Trump.

title: New York. President's meetings and talks at UN
description: President Andrzej Duda's talks at the UN headquarters in New York were centred on security issues in the context of the ongoing conflicts: in Ukraine and the Middle East, and sustainable development. The Polish leader and his Spouse are paying a visit to the United States.

title: Letter from the President of the Republic of Poland to the leaders of NATO member states to mark the anniversary of the establishment of the Alliance
description: President: 75 years ago the world's most powerful defense alliance was founded - a symbol of solidarity and the security foundation of the democratic community of the free world.

title: White House. Speech by the President of the Republic of Poland
description: President: Russia's aggression against Ukraine clearly demonstrated that the United States is and should remain the security leader! But other Allies must take more responsibility for the security of the Alliance as a whole.

title: It is necessary to raise the level of defense spending from 2 to 3% of GDP by all members of the Alliance
description: Address by the President of the Republic of Poland marking the 25th anniversary of Poland’s accession to  NATO:  I believe that it is necessary to raise the level of defense spending from 2 to 3 % of GDP by all members of the Alliance.

title: The war in Ukraine shows the necessary changes in the field of European security
description: - Our approach is guided by the principle of continuing those actions that are beneficial and rectifying those that are detrimental. As General Kukuła observed, the lessons of the war in Ukraine are being implemented. It would be erroneous to assume that a one-off solution is being adopted - rather, flexibility is required. The ability to adapt is of paramount importance in order to ensure that the military is able to respond effectively to changing circumstances. (…) After two years and, in a moment, after three years of experience of the war in Ukraine, there must be an analysis and redefinition of the actions we are conducting - stated Deputy Prime Minister W. Kosiniak-Kamysz at the conference "Lessons from the war in Ukraine – equipment and structure of the Polish army and Civil Defence".

title: Defence ministers of Poland, Germany, France, the United Kingdom and Italy on security in the face of war in Ukraine
description: - It is our duty today to state this matter clearly and explicitly. It is imperative that Europe intensifies its efforts to provide assistance to Ukraine, with a particular focus on enhancing its security. Without increased expenditure and awareness of the necessity of such measures within the European public consciousness, the aforementioned measures will prove futile. Without an awareness of the importance of security in the contemporary era. It is our intention to reiterate this message at every opportunity, and it is our commitment as defence ministers to do so. It is of the utmost importance that we fulfil our roles in our countries, as well as in the wider European Union, in our interactions with the United Kingdom and in our friendship with the United States. I would like this to be emphasised, as we have all previously stated in our speeches how important it is for us to maintain relations with the United States, which have been the basis of our civilisation for many years - said Deputy Prime Minister W. Kosiniak-Kamysz following a meeting with defence ministers in Berlin.

title: Poland and Slovakia strengthen security cooperation
description: - We are together in the European Union, together in NATO. We are strong partners, for which I express my sincerest gratitude. I am very pleased to be in Bratislava today, accompanied by Minister of Infrastructure Dariusz Klimczak, who is currently engaged in bilateral discussions. This is not a mere coincidence; it is the result of a strategic decision to cooperate, particularly in the field of arms production. I am particularly impressed by Slovakia's production capacity in the field of ammunition, particularly the 155mm variety, although other types are also noteworthy. The potential for growth is considerable, ranking among the largest in Europe and the world. We wish to collaborate with you in the development of the arms industry, as you represent a strategic partner in this field - stated Deputy Prime Minister Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz following a meeting with Slovak Defence Minister Robert Kaliňák.

title: Lieutenant General Dariusz Parylak is the current commander of the Multinational Corps Northeast
description: - It is a great moment marking the culmination of 25 years of the Multinational Corps Northeast' presence in Szczecin with a change of command. This serves as an exemplar of the Corps' capacity for continuity, stability, and functionality. It is noteworthy that, following a quarter of a century of the Corps' presence in Szczecin, we are witnessing another change of command, which symbolises the continuity of the Corps. Freedom needs strength. It will not be able to defend itself. It is a highly valuable concept, but in the context of daily threats, it requires a unified determination and courage. For 75 years, NATO has constituted the most robust defence alliance in history. It safeguards peace, security and our civilisation - stated Deputy Prime Minister Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz during a visit to the Headquarters of the Multinational Corps Northeast.

title: The ministers of the Northern Group engaged in discussions concerning the situation in Ukraine and the cooperation of defence industries
description: The primary focus of the discussion was the situation in Ukraine and the developments on the frontline. The Minister of Defence of Ukraine provided an account of the situation. Furthermore, we discussed the cooperation between the defence industries of the EU countries, the Northern Group - Deputy Prime Minister Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz said following the meeting of the defence ministers of the Northern Group countries.

title: EU countries develop defense capabilities
description: On 19 November this year, a meeting of the Foreign Affairs Council in defence ministers' format was held in Brussels, which was attended by Deputy Minister Paweł Zalewski.

title: The opening of the Redzikowo base is a milestone in missile defence
description: - The deployment of an American destroyer on Polish soil becomes a reality, representing a significant development in the security history of Poland, the United States and NATO, and marking a notable shift in the geopolitical landscape. It is like a milestone and a cornerstone at the same time. This represents a significant milestone in the fields of missile defence and air defence for all NATO countries, for Europe and for the United States. The installation of the US base in Redzikowo will serve to enhance the security of Europe, the United States, Poland and NATO as a whole. It will contribute to the strengthening of the most powerful alliance in the modern world - Deputy Prime Minister W. Kosiniak - Kamysz stated during the opening of the base in Redzikowo.

title: Meeting between Deputy Prime Minister W. Kosiniak-Kamysz and NATO Secretary General
description: - We discussed, with NATO Secretary General, the most pressing challenges facing NATO, Poland's role within the Alliance, and the nature of our interactions. Poland is a reliable ally, and we are committed to upholding our obligations as set forth in the North Atlantic Treaty. We expect the same level of commitment from our allies. The most pressing security concerns were discussed, and I also delivered a presentation on the provision of assistance to Ukraine. I emphasised that Poland has been providing support to Ukraine since the outset of the conflict, implementing a whole range of possible measures to assist the country. On behalf of the Chief of the General Staff of the Polish Armed Forces, General Dymanowski presented details of the support provided to Ukraine. The Secretary General and his delegation were highly impressed by Poland's actions since the outset of the war in Ukraine – W. Kosiniak – Kamysz said following the meeting with the NATO Secretary General.

title: The head of the National Security Bureau began a 4-day visit to the Baltic countries
description: The head of the National Security Bureau, Minister Jacek Siewiera, began a 4-day visit to the Nordic and Baltic countries today - Sweden, Finland, Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania. The talks are related to the urgent need to strengthen international cooperation in the Baltic region, which is key to NATO and EU security. Especially in the context of the intensification of Russia's hostile actions in the Baltic Sea.

title: Act on financing activities aimed at increasing the capacity for ammunition production signed by the President of the Republic of Poland
description: On December 9, 2024, the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, signed the Act of November 27, 2024 on the financing of activities aimed at increasing the capacity for ammunition production.

title: The head of the National Security Bureau on the coup in Syria: from Poland's point of view, I see many potential threats here
description: "It is worth paying attention to two issues here - the military and political dimensions, because in both - I have the impression - the optimism associated with the belief that this is a great defeat of the Russian Federation is too far-reaching. This form of optimism can be maintained by global powers" - emphasized the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera during Monday's edition of the program "Fakty po faktach" on TVN24. "From the point of view of regional security and Poland's interests, I see many potential threats here" - assessed the minister.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: a Ministry of Arms should be established in Poland
description: We are as a society ready to spend huge amounts of money on armaments if it involves the delivery of new tanks or missiles. However, it is difficult to explain to society the costs associated with storing ammunition or training, noted the head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera on Monday. As he pointed out, he is convinced of the need to establish an armaments ministry in Poland, similar to DAPA in South Korea or SSB in Turkey.

title: BBN chief: Russia is currently unable to conduct operations in many theaters
description: The coup in Syria, the fall of the regime is a message to global powers that the Russian Federation - with its involvement in Ukraine - is not able to conduct operations in many theaters - assessed the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera. During the conference entitled "Lessons from the war in Ukraine - equipment and structure of the Polish army and Civil Defense" he also spoke about the situation in Syria.

title: The head of the National Security Bureau on the consequences of the fall of the Syrian regime for Poland's security
description: "After the phase of dynamic events that have taken place in Syria in recent days, each country must ask itself how this situation translates into its direct security interests," said the Head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, on TOK FM. "And this perspective is much less optimistic than what is described in the global dimension, for the big players," he emphasized.

title: The president in the flood-damaged areas
description: The President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda visited the areas destroyed during the September flood in the Opole province today. He visited Głuchołazy, Nysa and Bodzanów, talked with representatives of the uniformed services, the army and local government authorities. The President thanked everyone involved in helping to remove the effects of the flood and supporting the residents of these areas.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: Mining and the mining industry are and will remain an area of ​​state security
description: Mining and the mining industry are and will remain the security area of ​​this country - said the minister in the Chancellery of the President of the Republic of Poland, head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera to the participants of Tuesday's St. Barbara's Day celebrations of the State Mining Authority (WUG) in Katowice.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Visit of the President of the Republic of Poland to the areas destroyed by the flood
description: On December 4, 2024 (Wednesday), the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, will visit the areas destroyed by floods in the Opole Voivodeship, where he will meet with representatives of the uniformed services, the army and local government authorities.

title: Act signed by the President of the Republic of Poland
description: On November 29, 2024, the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, signed:

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Head of the National Security Bureau at the Mining Authority's St. Barbara's Day
description: On 3rd December this year (Tuesday), at 11:00 the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera will take part in the ceremonial St. Barbara's Day academy of mining supervision, held at the Silesian Museum in Katowice (ul. T. Dobrowolskiego 1, Katowice). During the ceremony, the Minister will present state decorations on behalf of the President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda.

title: Cadet Day celebration
description: The President of the Republic of Poland, Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces Andrzej Duda took part in an assembly on the occasion of Officer Cadet Day and the 194th anniversary of the outbreak of the November Uprising.

title: Gdynia. Navy Day with the participation of the President of the Republic of Poland
description: President Andrzej Duda took part today in the celebrations of the 106th anniversary of the establishment of the Polish Navy. This year, for the first time, the celebrations took place on November 28 - the day of the adoption of the historic date of the establishment of the navy by Marshal Józef Piłsudski in 1918.

title: Jacek Siewiera: The Baltic Sea is the gateway to safety
description: This is a great opportunity to strengthen ties with countries that have a similar perception of the threat from Russia. Good understanding with Baltic and Scandinavian partners gives us a stronger voice in the EU and NATO – said Jacek Siewiera, Head of the National Security Bureau, on Radio ZET, commenting on the proposal to create a joint mission to patrol the waters of the Baltic Sea.

title: Meeting of the President with the Polish staff of the European Union Mission in Armenia
description: On the last day of his visit to Armenia, President Andrzej Duda took part in a patrol in Paruyr Sevak and met with Polish staff of the European Union Mission in the Republic of Armenia (EUMA), established under the common security and defence policy.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: President at the celebration of Officer Cadet Day
description: On November 29, 2024 (Friday) at 5:00 p.m. in the courtyard of Belweder Palace, the President of the Republic of Poland, Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces Andrzej Duda will take part in a roll call on the occasion of Cadet Day and the 194th anniversary of the outbreak of the November Uprising.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: President at the Polish Navy Day
description: On November 28 this year (Thursday) at 11:30 the President of the Republic of Poland, Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces Andrzej Duda will take part in the ceremonial celebration of the Polish Navy Day in Gdynia.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: Our security is based on the maritime economy
description: The head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, conducted reconnaissance in Świnoujście to secure critical infrastructure, the LNG terminal and the Baltic Pipe gas pipeline. Investments in port infrastructure are crucial both for Poland's energy security and for accepting potential allied assistance to secure NATO's eastern flank - he said.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: The head of the National Security Bureau will review the security status of strategic maritime investments
description: On November 21 this year (Thursday) in Świnoujście, the Head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, will familiarize himself with the security status of critical maritime infrastructure and the implementation of strategic investments in the region.

title: Andrzej Duda visits Jordan. Polish-Jordanian military cooperation
description: President Andrzej Duda is visiting the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan. His talks with His Majesty Abdullah II Ibn Al Hussein concern bilateral and military cooperation and security issues in the context of the conflict in the Middle East and Russian aggression against Ukraine.

title: The President of the Republic of Poland signed an amendment to the Act on Fire Protection and the Volunteer Fire Department
description: On November 18, 2024, the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, signed the Act of October 11, 2024 amending the Act on Fire Protection and the Act on Volunteer Fire Brigades.

title: Changes in counteracting the dissemination of terrorist content on the Internet
description: On November 15, 2024, the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, signed:

title: Meeting of the President of the Republic of Poland with the Secretary General of NATO
description: Andrzej Duda talked today with NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte about increasing military production in Europe, the need to extend NATO pipelines to the countries of the eastern flank and the conditions for transferring more Polish fighter jets to Ukraine.

title: Opening of the American Aegis Ashore base in Redzikowo
description: The President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, took part in the opening of the American Aegis Ashore base in Redzikowo (Pomeranian Voivodeship), which is part of the NATO missile defense system.

title: Celebration of National Independence Day
description: Celebrated today, the National Independence Day is one of the most important national holidays for Poles. In 1918, after 123 years of partition – captivity marked by struggle, suffering and effort of many generations of Poles – our country regained its sovereignty.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: November 13, the official opening of the anti-missile base in Redzikowo
description: The head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, announced on Monday that the official opening of the anti-missile base in Redzikowo (Pomeranian Voivodeship) will take place on November 13.

title: Polish aid for Ukraine
description: Poland ranks first (in relation to GDP) among all countries that have been involved in providing aid to Ukraine. Polish support was the first to reach the Ukrainian front in significant quantities. We have transferred the largest amount of heavy weapons. Poland is also among the top countries that have accepted the largest number of refugees in absolute numbers.

title: General nominations on the eve of the National Independence Day
description: On the eve of the National Independence Day, President Andrzej Duda presented generals' nominations to soldiers of the Polish Army, as well as officers of the Police and the State Fire Service, at the Presidential Palace.

title: General promotions in the State Fire Service and Police
description: The President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, awarded the rank of general to three officers of the State Fire Service and three officers of the Police. The presentation of nominations will take place on the eve of the National Independence Day, November 10, 2024, at the Presidential Palace.

title: BBN chief: Trump's victory will impact the world order
description: This is the moment when Poland's role in the European arena will be decided primarily by the activity of our politics, our ability to use this situation; I feel the opportunities that are associated with it - said the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera on Trójka, referring to Donald Trump's victory in the American presidential elections.

title: BBN chief: Warsaw should be active in relations with Washington and use all tools to do so
description: Fear and criticism of the choice made by the Americans by the European elites is counterproductive. Warsaw should be active in its relations with Washington and use all the tools to achieve this. These tools are on the President's side. It would be good if the political parties understood this - said Jacek Siewiera, Head of the National Security Bureau, on TVN24, commenting on Donald Trump's victory in the American presidential election.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: The President of the Republic of Poland will present generals with promotions
description: On the eve of the National Independence Day, November 10, 2024 (Sunday) at 7:00 p.m., a ceremony of presenting general and admiral nominations to officers and officials by the President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda will be held at the Presidential Palace.

title: General promotions in the Polish Armed Forces
description: The President of the Republic of Poland, Commander-in-Chief of the Polish Armed Forces Andrzej Duda, pursuant to Article 134, paragraph 5 of the Constitution of the Republic of Poland, at the request of the Minister of National Defense, appointed 12 officers of the Polish Army to the ranks of general and admiral. The acts of appointment will be presented by the President of the Republic of Poland on November 10, 2024, on the eve of the National Independence Day.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: today, the most important assets that shape the security environment and transatlantic relations between Warsaw and Washington are in the hands of the President
description: "It is worth being aware that today the most important assets of the Republic of Poland, which shape the security environment and transatlantic relations between Warsaw and Washington, are in the hands of President Andrzej Duda. It is worth the government and political parties to properly understand this importance, because our security really depends on it," said Jacek Siewiera, Head of the National Security Bureau, on the RMF FM radio station.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: The lack of systemic changes in the management of state defense is disturbing
description: The President's bill on the actions of state authorities in the event of an external threat to state security is still not being processed. "The state is still not drawing conclusions, despite the fact that the President - the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces, the Prime Minister are traveling to a country ravaged by war. The vacancy of this position - not only due to death, but also lack of communication, contact for various reasons - is not a scenario that fits in our heads," emphasized the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera in "Kropka nad i". As he added, the management and command system has not been corrected, so certain solutions are on the table and it is time to take action.

title: Wywiad Prezydenta RP dla The Sunday Times
description: If the safety of my compatriots is to be ensured by the re-emergence of an "iron curtain", then so be it, an iron curtain will arise, as long as we are on its free side - said President Andrzej Duda in an interview for The Sunday Times.

title: Visit of the President of the Republic of Poland to Korean arms factories
description: On the last day of his visit to the Republic of Korea, President Andrzej Duda visited the Hyundai Rotem and Hanwha Aerospace plants, which execute contracts for equipment for the Polish armed forces.

title: The presidents of Poland and the Republic of Korea discuss military and economic cooperation.
description: On the next day of his visit to the Republic of Korea, the President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda met with the President of the Republic of Korea Yoon Suk-yeol. Thursday's conversation concerned, among other things, economic and military cooperation. President Andrzej Duda expressed hope that "more good news will soon be announced in terms of military cooperation - I am thinking about the cooperation of the arms industries", related to the Polonization of equipment.

title: Seoul: NSB chief talks with South Korea's national security adviser
description: The head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, who is in Seoul, spoke on Wednesday with his South Korean counterpart, Shin Won-Sik, about current events related to the war in Ukraine, including possible support from South Korea for Kiev and Polish-Korean military cooperation. The discussion also included disturbing information about North Korea's cooperation with Russia and the possible presence of North Korean soldiers on the territory of the Russian Federation. Both sides exchanged current knowledge regarding intelligence data.

title: New solutions encouraging the employment of soldiers performing active military service in WOT and AR
description: On October 17, 2024, the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, signed the Act of October 1, 2024, amending certain acts in order to support entrepreneurs employing Territorial Defense Force soldiers or Active Reserve soldiers.

title: Conversation between the President of the Republic of Poland and the Secretary General of NATO
description: The President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, spoke by telephone this evening with the new NATO Secretary General, Mark Rutte.

title: Scholarship diplomas for the beneficiaries of the Grow Up with Us Foundation
description: At the Belweder Palace, the Presidential Couple presented scholarship certificates to children of fallen or wounded soldiers, officers and employees of public services – beneficiaries of the Grow Up with Us Foundation. Thanks to the initiative of the foundation, parents of those who fell, died or were wounded while performing their duties receive regular psychological and educational assistance, financial support and are prepared to enter adult life and the job market.

title: Easier return to service in the Police and Border Guard
description: On October 14, 2024, the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, signed the Act of October 1, 2024, amending certain acts in connection with the establishment of uniformed services units and facilitating the return to service in the Police and Border Guard.

title: The head of the National Security Bureau on the Polish-Belarusian border. Strengthening security is "proof of the continuity of the state's strategic thinking"
description: "For the first time, you can document the engineering reinforcements that are the culmination of the experience of these three years of attempts to bend and force this barrier in many different ways, also carried out in recent months," said Jacek Siewiera, Head of the National Security Bureau, to journalists, who on Friday met with the services and the army on the border with Belarus in Połowce (Podlaskie) and watched the reinforcement of the barrier located there.

title: Head of BBN: Today, the key is very structured work on the structure and architecture of the new army
description: "Today, the key is very orderly work on the structure and architecture of the new army that Poland has started to build, on the achievements that have been accumulated in recent years," said the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera on TV Republika, commenting on the security situation in connection with the war in Ukraine.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Visit of the Head of the National Security Bureau to the eastern border of Poland
description: On Friday, October 11, 2024, the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera will visit the Polish-Belarusian border, where he will familiarize himself with the current security situation. The Minister will meet with representatives of the services responsible for securing the eastern border of Poland and check the status of work on strengthening the border infrastructure on the section with Belarus.

title: Minister Siewiera: Poland is playing a difficult game to obtain the right place in NATO
description: "Unfortunately, due to domestic political tensions, all personnel attempts to strengthen our position in NATO that we have undertaken recently have not been successful. (...) I believe that with the arrival of the new Secretary General, a certain pool of opportunities will open up again and will take into account the key role of the largest country on the eastern flank," said Jacek Siewiera, Head of the National Security Bureau, in an interview with "Gazeta Polska".

title: Inauguration of the academic year at the Military University of Technology
description: I believe that the academic year that is just beginning will result in the preparation of the next generation of officers who, after graduating from the Military University of Technology, will serve in responsible positions in the Polish Armed Forces – said President Andrzej Duda during the ceremonial inauguration of the academic year 2024/2025.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: threats require offensive technologies in the cyber area
description: The head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, said on Wednesday that the threats we will be dealing with require us to begin work on the use of offensive technologies in the cyber area.

title: Head of National Security Bureau: Russia wants to revise the world order
description: – When it comes to nuclear weapons, let’s not copy the Kremlin’s disastrous practices – says Jacek Siewiera, head of the National Security Bureau, in an interview for “Rzeczpospolita”

title: President of the Republic of Poland at the Warsaw Security Forum: bold political decisions are needed to rebuild the defense potential
description: "We should focus on two tasks. First, on how to help Ukraine win the war, and second - how to strengthen our own capabilities to ensure security and stable development of our countries."

title: BBN chief at WSF: Poland, EU and NATO cannot lose sight of the fundamental threat
description: Poland, the EU and NATO, despite the crises, cannot lose sight of the fundamental threat from the East, stressed Jacek Siewiera, the head of the National Security Bureau, during the Warsaw Security Forum on Tuesday. By deciding, among other things, on record spending on defence, we are building potential, but this effort must be long-term, he emphasised.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: The President of the Republic of Poland at the inauguration of the academic year at WAT
description: On Wednesday, October 2, 2024, at 10:00 a.m., the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, will participate in the ceremonial inauguration of the 2024/2025 academic year at the Military University of Technology (WAT Club, ul. gen. Sylwestra Kaliskiego 25a, Warsaw).

title: ZAPOWIEDŹ: Szef BBN na Warsaw Security Forum
description: The head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, will take part in the Warsaw Security Forum conference (DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel, ul. Skalnicowa 21, Warsaw).

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: President of the Republic of Poland at the Warsaw Security Forum
description: On Tuesday, October 1, 2024, at approx. 2:00 p.m., the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, will participate in the Warsaw Security Forum (Hotel DoubleTree by Hilton, ul. Skalnicowa 21, Warsaw).

title: Speech by the President of the Republic of Poland at the UN Security Council
description: "The world cannot afford for the Security Council to be unable to meet its obligations under the Charter. We need an effective, transparent, representative and accountable body," said President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda during a debate at the UN Security Council.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: The President of the Republic of Poland will closely monitor the process of rebuilding flood areas
description: The President unequivocally declares that he will systematically visit the areas destroyed by the flood in order to regularly review the completion of the phase of removing the direct effects of the flood, as well as the reconstruction process – said Jacek Siewiera, Head of the National Security Bureau, in "Fakty po faktach".

title: The head of the National Security Bureau on the fight against a natural disaster in southern Poland
description: The head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, gave the country a "sufficient plus" mark for its actions in the preparatory phase for the flood; "four plus" for saving the lives and property of residents, and "five minus" for removing the direct effects of the flood.

title: President Andrzej Duda in towns destroyed by flood
description: The President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda visited Lądek-Zdrój and Głuchołazy – towns destroyed by floods. Andrzej Duda familiarized himself with the scale of destruction, talked with residents and representatives of local authorities and uniformed services.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Visit of the President of the Republic of Poland to the flood-affected areas
description: Today, on September 20, 2024, the President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda will visit the flood-damaged areas in the Lower Silesian and Opole Voivodeships. The President will meet with representatives of the services involved in rescue operations, the military, and local government authorities.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: The President will visit the flood-affected areas on Friday
description: There is a plan for the President to visit the areas affected by the flood so as not to interfere with the work of the rescue services, so as not to disrupt rescue operations. The plan for such a visit is planned for Lower Silesia on Friday from early morning hours - said the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: Construction of retention reservoirs must be an element of consensus in the national security strategy
description: We need to assess the extent of the damage caused by the flood and assess the costs of building retention reservoirs. And answer the question of what price we are willing to accept and which floods are unacceptable and build these reservoirs. This must be an element of consensus in the national security strategy - said the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera on Radio RMF FM.

title: Local Government Council meeting on the flood situation
description: President Andrzej Duda took part in a meeting of the Council for Territorial Self-Government. The meeting was devoted to the flood situation – possibilities of cooperation and support at the local government level. As the President said, the Head of the National Security Bureau is currently carrying out reconnaissance on his orders in the areas affected by flooding.

title: The President on the flood situation in southwestern Poland
description: The President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, announced that he would immediately go to the flood-affected areas when the period of danger ends, because – as he emphasized – his presence in that area now would distract the attention of rescuers. He also appealed for help for the residents of southwestern Poland.

title: Head of National Security Bureau: First humanitarian transport in the coming hours
description: "In the coming hours, as a result of the actions of the President of the Republic of Poland and the First Lady, the first humanitarian aid will be sent to one of the towns in Lower Silesia: 18 tons of drinking water, food, hygiene products, which are in short supply there," announced today on Polsat News the Head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, who, on the orders of the President of the Republic of Poland - the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces, is staying in the areas affected by the flood damage.

title: Racibórz. The head of the National Security Bureau on strategic investments in response to flood threats
description: On the President's orders, I came here, to Racibórz, to receive a complete set of information related to the condition of the Racibórz Dolny reservoir and the stage of preparations to counteract the wave that we expect in the near future - said Jacek Siewiera, Head of the National Security Bureau, at a briefing.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Press briefing of the Head of the National Security Bureau in Racibórz
description: Today, September 16, 2024 at 4:00 p.m., a briefing by the Head of the National Security Bureau, Minister Jacek Siewiera, will be held at the front dam of the Racibórz Reservoir.

title: The President spoke with the Chief Commander of the State Fire Service
description: President Andrzej Duda spoke today with the Chief Commander of the State Fire Service, Senior Brigadier Mariusz Feltynowski.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: The President is constantly informed about the flood situation
description: President Andrzej Duda is constantly informed about the flood situation, also at night; he receives reports on the course of events, the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera said at a briefing. He informed that the operational service is on duty at the National Security Bureau continuously.

title: Funeral ceremony of the commander of the Border Protection Corps
description: President Andrzej Duda took part in the reburial ceremony of the late Gen. Jan Kazimierz Kruszewski – commander of the Border Protection Corps in the years 1930-1939, whose ashes were brought from France to Poland in early September. This is an element of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the Border Protection Corps celebrated this year. The celebrations were held under the Honorary Patronage of the President of the Republic of Poland.

title: The head of the National Security Bureau on the situation beyond the eastern border: The truce will work to the benefit of the Russian Federation
description: "Ukrainians want lasting, stable peace guaranteed by the international community, not a truce, because it will work to the benefit of the Russian Federation" - said the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera, a guest of "Rozmowy Piaseckiego" on TVN24, about the situation beyond the eastern border.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Participation of the President of the Republic of Poland in the funeral ceremony of the commander of the Border Protection Corps
description: On September 12, 2024 (Thursday) at 11:00 a.m. in the Field Cathedral of the Polish Army, the President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda will participate in the funeral ceremony of the late Brig. Gen. Jan Kazimierz Kruszewski - commander of the Border Protection Corps. The general's ashes were brought to the Homeland in early September 2024. The related ceremonies are part of the celebrations of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the Border Protection Corps.

title: Special awards from the President of the Republic of Poland and the Head of the National Security Bureau at the Kielce defence fair
description: On the last day of the 32nd International Defence Industry Exhibition in Kielce, the deputy head of the National Security Bureau, Lieutenant General Dariusz Łukowski, presented the award of the President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda for the best products aimed at improving the level of security of soldiers of the Polish Armed Forces, as well as the award of the Head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, for innovation and the use of new technologies for security.

title: Head of BBN: information that there was nothing important in the files concerning Rubtsov is insufficient
description: The information that there was nothing important in the files from the Polish investigation into Pavel Rubtsov seems to be far from sufficient, stressed the head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera. He added that the intelligence officer treats such files as a source of "extraordinary knowledge".

title: Polish-Lithuanian Defense Sector Business Forum with the participation of the Presidents of Poland and Lithuania
description: The President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda and the President of the Republic of Lithuania Gitanas Nausėda opened the Polish-Lithuanian Defense Business Forum this morning. In the presence of the Presidents, a ceremony of signing a number of agreements on cooperation in the field of cybersecurity and defense industries also took place.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau at the Karpacz Forum: The EU should invest in proven defense solutions, NATO structures
description: The EU should invest in proven defence solutions and NATO structures, said Jacek Siewiera, head of the National Security Bureau, during the Economic Forum in Karpacz on Wednesday, when asked about building a European army.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau at the Forum in Karpacz: the EU fund for the eastern flank countries is a condition for deepening integration
description: As long as Brussels does not properly diagnose the threat within the 12 countries of the eastern flank and does not create a fund for the purchase of common equipment for them for joint operations, there can be no talk of deeper European integration, because it would be at Poland's expense - assessed the head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera.

title: XXXII International Defense Industry Exhibition in Kielce
description: The President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda visited the XXXII International Defence Industry Exhibition in Kielce. Opening the fair, the Commander of the Polish Armed Forces emphasised that increasing the level of defence expenditure and making the armies of NATO countries really strong will prevent another world war. The President was accompanied by the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera during the fair.

title: Polish Defence and Security Equipment Catalogue
description: On the first day of the XXXII edition of the International Defence Industry Exhibition in Kielce, the Minister of National Defence, Deputy Prime Minister Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz and the Head of the National Security Bureau, Minister Jacek Siewiera, presented the publication "Polish Defence and Security Equipment Catalogue". The catalogue was prepared by the National Security Bureau, in cooperation with the Ministry of National Defence and companies from the domestic defence sector. The aim of the catalogue is to support the promotion of the Polish arms industry on international markets.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: The heads of the Ministry of National Defense and the National Security Bureau will present a catalog of export solutions of the Polish arms industry
description: On Tuesday, September 3, 2024 at 11.15 a.m., at the International Defense Industry Exhibition in Kielce, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Defense Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz and Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera will present a catalog with the export offer of Polish defense companies.

title: Ceremony to commemorate the Heroic Defenders of Westerplatte
description: Westerplatte has become for us Poles a symbol of soldierly courage, determination and readiness to shed blood for our homeland. This special place reminds the whole world every year of the aggression of Nazi Germany, which the Polish state was the first to oppose with force. It also reminds us of the entire tragedy of World War II - the greatest in the history of our homeland, Europe and the world - which began with the attack on Poland - wrote the President of the Republic of Poland in a letter addressed to the participants of the ceremony commemorating the Heroic Defenders of Westerplatte on the 85th anniversary of the outbreak of World War II.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Visit of the President of the Republic of Poland at the defense fair
description: On September 3, 2024 (Tuesday) at 12:00, the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, will visit the XXXII International Defense Industry Exhibition in Kielce.

title: Kyiv. President of the Republic of Poland at the celebrations of the 33rd anniversary of Ukraine's Independence
description: President Andrzej Duda visited Kyiv, where he took part in the celebrations of the 33rd anniversary of Ukraine's Independence. - Your Independence Day is, in a sense, also a celebration of the independence of all of Central Europe. Because without an independent Ukraine, it is difficult to think about an independent and safe Poland, Lithuania or other countries in our region - said the Polish leader during the main celebrations in Sofia Square.

title: French parts for British submarines
description: French parts for British submarines

title: Sharp firing MRC batteries
description: Ostre strzelanie batteries MRC

title: Poland's defence spending in 2022-2025 according to the Ministry of National Defence
description: On December 5 this year, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Defense Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz presented information on Poland's defense spending incurred in 2022-2023 and planned for 2024-2025 in the Sejm of the Republic of Poland. According to the head of the Ministry of National Defense, defense spending planned for 2025 is to be 60% higher than in 2023 and 2.5 times higher than in 2022, reaching 4.7% of Poland's GDP. In turn, the implementation of this year's defense spending in the state budget is currently to amount to 73%, while the implementation of spending from the Armed Forces Support Fund (FWSZ) by the end of this year is to reach 65%-70%. For comparison, the implementation of the FWSZ in 2023 amounted to approx. 50% of the plan.

title: Another $4 billion in US loans for military equipment purchases
description: On December 5, the Ministry of National Defense announced that Poland and the United States have concluded the fourth direct loan agreement under the FMF (Foreign Military Financing) program. The latest agreement concerns a loan in the amount of USD 4 billion (i.e. approx. PLN 16 billion at the current USD exchange rate). The funds obtained will be used to finance, among others, an agreement for the purchase of 96 AH-64E Apache helicopters and the Patriot air defense system (under the Wisła program).

title: An order for several hundred CD-10s fuel dispenser tanks
description: On December 4 this year, an agreement was signed between the Armament Agency and Celtech Sp. z o.o. for the delivery of several hundred to 320 CD-10s fuel dispenser tanks on the Scania P460 B6x6HZ chassis, primarily for the needs of the Armored and Mechanized Forces and the Rocket and Artillery Forces, including 105 units under the option right. The total value of the order for the guaranteed and optional part was set at approximately PLN 1.05 billion gross, and deliveries are to be made in 2026-2028. The tank holds up to 10 m3 of diesel oil, gasoline, or aviation fuels.

title: Launch of contracts for the supply of K9 gun-howitzers and Homar-K rocket launchers
description: On December 2nd this year, during a press conference attended by Deputy Minister Paweł Bejda, responsible for the technical modernization process at the Ministry of National Defense, and the Head of the Armaments Agency, Brigadier General Artur Kuptel, it was announced that on November 27th this year, Bank Gospodarstwa Krajowego concluded a credit agreement worth EUR 4 billion, thanks to which it will be possible to finance in part net two executive agreements, concluded conditionally and providing for the delivery of 155 mm K9 Thunder self-propelled gun-howitzers together with ammunition (contract of December 1st, 2023) and Homar-K multi-rocket launcher modules together with missiles (contract of April 25th, 2024) to the Polish Armed Forces. Providing financing for the above-mentioned agreements allows for the physical launch of their implementation.

title: November deliveries of military equipment for the Polish Army
description: In November this year, the Polish Army received several deliveries of new military equipment. The delivered equipment included: two S-70i Black Hawk helicopters, 15 K2GF tanks, 12 K9A1 self-propelled gun-howitzers, 8 Homar-K multi-rocket launcher (MRL) modules, 2 Homar-A MRLs (HIMARS), 8 M120K Rak self-propelled mortars and 4 artillery command vehicles (AWD). Deliveries of S-70i helicopters completed the implementation of the contract from December 15, 2021, while deliveries of Rak and AWD mortars completed the implementation of the contract from May 22, 2020. At the end of November this year. It was also reported that the M1A1 FEP Abrams tanks previously delivered to Poland were delivered to the 1st Tank Battalion in Żurawica of the 19th Lublin Mechanized Brigade.

title: AIM-9X Sidewinder missiles ordered
description: On November 29, the head of the Armaments Agency, Brig. Gen. Artur Kuptel, signed a Letter of Acceptance with the United States government for the purchase of 232 AIM-9X Sidewinder Block II air-to-air missiles with a delivery date of 2028-2030. In addition to air combat assets, the contract includes additional elements, including spare parts, a logistics and training package. The value of the order is approximately USD 175 million net, or nearly PLN 876 million gross.

title: A new source for the production of explosives in Poland
description: At the headquarters of the Industrial Development Agency on November 26, a letter of intent was signed related to increasing the production capacity of the Nitroerg company. Both entities are to analyze the possibilities and investment scope of the project to create competences for the production of pentrite and hexogen at a plant in Silesia. In principle, the investment is aimed at securing the needs of the civil market for explosives.

title: Progress in the implementation of the Homar-A program
description: In the second half of November this year, talks were held in the United States regarding tank ammunition for M1 Abrams tanks and co-production of GMLRS missiles for Homar-A multiple launchers (MRL) in Poland. They were attended by a delegation from the Armament Agency led by the Deputy Head of this institution, Brig. Gen. Michał Marciniak, while the American side was represented by Patrick Mason, Deputy Secretary of the US Army for Export and Defense Cooperation. On November 22 this year, two M142 HIMARS launchers intended for training purposes, equipped with M68A2 training modules, were delivered to Poland. They are the last delivered element of the first Homar-A missile squadron ordered on February 13, 2019. In accordance with the framework agreement of September 11, 2023, Poland plans to order another 486 MRL Homar-A. We will discuss the current stage of implementation of this program later in the article.

title: Another FlyEye UAV ordered. The Drone Troops Inspectorate will be established.
description: On November 15, another executive agreement was signed between the Armament Agency and WB Electronics S.A. for the delivery of 13 sets of FlyEye mini-class unmanned aerial systems (UAVs) to the Polish Armed Forces this year, along with technical documentation and repair, logistics and training packages. One set includes 4 air platforms. The value of the agreement amounted to approximately PLN 97.5 million gross. The ceremony was attended by Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Defense Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz and Secretary of State at the Ministry of National Defense Paweł Bejda, responsible for the technical modernization process. In his speech, Deputy Prime Minister Kosiniak-Kamysz informed, among other things, that from January 1, 2025, the "Droned Troops Inspectorate" will be established, which will be responsible for the implementation of unmanned systems in all types of the Polish Armed Forces.

title: The crawfish will receive accompanying vehicles
description: On November 8, 2027, the Armaments Agency, a consortium consisting of Polska Grupa Zbrojeniowa S.A. and Huta Stalowa Wola S.A. (leader) signed an agreement to acquire several dozen accompanying vehicles for three divisional modules of WR-40 Langusta multiple rocket launchers in 2027-2028. The order value amounts to PLN 1.320 billion gross.

title: The status of modernization of Leopard 2A4 tanks to the Leopard 2PL version
description: Almost nine years ago, on 28 December 2015, the Armament Inspectorate signed contract no. IU/77/X-89/ZS/NEGZ/USŁ/Z/2015/408 with the consortium of PGZ S.A. and ZM Bumar-Łabędy S.A. for the renovation and modernization of 128 Leopard 2A4 tanks to the Leopard 2PL version in 2018-2020 with an option to modernize 14 more tanks in 2021. The initial value of the contract was PLN 2.415 billion gross (without options). On 20 June 2018, Annex No. 2 to the aforementioned contract was concluded, which activated the option and extended the scope of work, without changing the order implementation period, as a result of which the value of the contract increased to PLN 2.721 billion gross. The current status of this order and how its completion date and value have changed are described later in the article.

title: A new source of financing for Polish ammunition production capabilities
description: On 31 October this year, the Ministry of State Assets submitted to the Standing Committee of the Council of Ministers a draft act on ensuring financing of activities aimed at increasing the production capacity of artillery ammunition in Poland. The document was published by the Government Legislation Centre (RCL) on 5 November this year. The draft provides for transferring funds of approximately PLN 3 billion to the Capital Investment Fund, which will be used to recapitalise companies responsible for the production of ammunition. The funds for this purpose are to come in the amount of PLN 2 billion from the budget of the Ministry of National Defence and in the amount of PLN 1 billion from treasury securities held by the Government Agency for Strategic Reserves.

title: WB Group in the AIDA project. Artificial intelligence in defense against cyberattacks
description: The WB Group is the only Polish company that is part of an international consortium implementing the Artificial Intelligence Deployable Agent project. The aim of AIDA is to develop possible scenarios and safeguards that would prevent cyberattacks on solutions based on artificial intelligence. The WB Group has the largest experience in Poland in the development of military AI systems.

title: Approval for the purchase of GCA-2000 mobile landing assistance systems
description: On November 1, the US Defense Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) announced that the Department of State had granted consent for Poland to purchase L3Harris GCA-2000 (Ground Control Approach) radar landing assistance systems in a mobile version under the Foreign Military Sales (FMS) procedure. The announcement did not provide information on how many systems the Polish request concerns. It is only known that it was valued at a maximum amount of USD 105 million net, or approximately PLN 520 million gross. Previously, a total of 14 GCA-2000 sets in a stationary configuration were acquired for the needs of the Polish Army in the years 2004-2019, which were installed on the premises of individual air bases.

title: Additional bulletproof vests and helmets for the military
description: On October 24 this year, the Armament Agency and Lubawa S.A. concluded an annex worth approximately PLN 160 million gross to the agreement of March 31, 2023, the subject of which is the delivery of approximately 15,000 additional Gryf integrated bulletproof vests for the Polish Armed Forces in 2024-2025. The Armament Agency also announced that on April 7 this year, an annex was concluded to the agreement of March 8, 2023, between the Armament Agency and Maskpol S.A., worth approximately PLN 20 million gross for the delivery of another approximately 10,000 HP-05 composite helmets with deliveries by the end of this year. Both orders are part of the “Szpej” operation announced by the management of the Ministry of National Defense, the aim of which is to purchase modern individual equipment for soldiers.

title: Approval for MLU modernization of Polish F-16s
description: On October 23, the US Defense Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) announced that it had granted the Department of State permission to carry out, under the Foreign Military Sales (FMS) procedure, the MLU (Midlife Upgrade) of 48 Polish F-16 C/D Jastrząb multi-role combat aircraft to version V (Viper). The total cost of modernization (including the purchase of necessary equipment, test and training weapons, and services) was estimated at a maximum of USD 7 billion net (approx. PLN 28.1 billion net), but it should be emphasized that part of the valuation concerns optional elements, all of which will certainly not be ordered in the end. This means that the value of the planned contract for the MLU modernization of Polish F-16s should be significantly lower than the given amount.

title: Overstatement of Poland's defence spending
description: During a press conference held on October 4 this year under the slogan "Polish Army 2024", Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Defense Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz announced that Poland's defense spending "is at a record level", and this statement was illustrated by a slide showing the spending: in 2023 at the level of PLN 137.1 billion (3.9% of GDP), in 2024 PLN 158.8 billion (4.2% of GDP), and in 2025 PLN 186.6 billion (4.7%). Unfortunately, in reality we spend less on defence because the given values ​​referred only to the expenditure plan, and in addition, part of the defence expenditure incurred from the Armed Forces Support Fund (FWSZ) is counted twice, once for the payment of advances and deliveries of military equipment, and the second time for servicing the debt incurred to purchase this military equipment, i.e. for: commissions, interest, debt repayment and operating costs of the FWSZ. In the author's opinion, expenditure on servicing the FWSZ debt should not be included in defence expenditure, but in the part of the state budget related to debt servicing.

title: The sixth Kormoran II class minehunter is under construction
description: On October 15, 2022, the ceremonial commencement of sheet metal cutting for the sixth modern minehunter of the 258-class Kormoran II (construction number 258/6) project took place at the Remontowa Shipbuilding S.A. shipyard in Gdańsk. The ship will be the last of three units ordered under the agreement of June 26, 2022, worth PLN 2.5 billion gross, which are to enter service in 2026-2027 in the 12th Wolin Minesweeper Squadron of the 8th Coastal Defense Flotilla stationed at the Naval Port in Świnoujście. The name ORP Czajka and side number 606 have been planned for the ship. Its contractor is the Consortium consisting of: Stocznia Remontowa Shipbuilding S.A. together with PGZ Stocznia Wojenna Sp. z o.o. and OBR Centrum Techniki Morskiej S.A.

title: CAESAR fired at the Ustka training ground
description: An unusual guest was supposed to appear at the Central Air Force Training Ground in Ustka at the end of September. The French part of the KNDS concern informed about long-range fire tests of the CAESAR wheeled gun-howitzer using 155 mm ammunition – the tasks were carried out at a distance of "over 42 km". KNDS France sees our country as a future partner for joint production of ammunition.

title: Why were FA-50 aircraft purchased?
description: On September 16, 2022, two executive agreements were concluded with the South Korean company Korean Aerospace Industries with a total value of USD 3.005 billion net (approx. PLN 14.6 billion gross) regarding the acquisition of 48 FA-50 Fighting Eagle light combat aircraft for the Air Force, including 12 FA-50GF (Gap Filler) bridging versions and 36 FA-50PL versions adapted to Polish requirements. All ordered FA-50GFs were delivered to Poland between July 9 and November 26, 2023, while FA-50PLs were to be delivered in 2025-2028, according to the agreement. Since this purchase is still controversial, it is worth familiarizing yourself with some additional information on it, provided to the editorial office by the Air Force Inspectorate of the General Command of the Armed Forces.

title: Thermal imaging cameras for Rosomaks
description: The last Polish Rosomaks with Hitfist-30P turrets were delivered almost a decade ago, so the equipment had a chance to wear out, and along the way, vehicles with 30 mm guns delivered to the Polish Armed Forces in large numbers completed a demanding operational mission in Afghanistan. The optoelectronic equipment of Polish wheeled infantry fighting vehicles is old and worn out. On October 3 this year, the 4th Regional Logistics Base announced that it had resolved the tender for the delivery of Asteria thermal imaging cameras intended for this type of vehicle. The process of modernizing the Rosomaks M1/M1M is slowly moving forward.

title: Tender for millions of pieces of ammunition for training
description: The Armament Agency announced on October 1 this year the launch of a multi-range tender for the acquisition of blank ammunition for the Armed Forces. The military plans to acquire blank ammunition for small arms in the following calibers in the years 2025-2028: 5.56 mm, 7.62 mm wz. 43 ("eastern"), 7.62 mm (rifle "eastern"), 9 mm wz. 93 (Parabellum), 12.7 mm and cannon calibers: 23 mm and 73 mm. This is another attempt by the AU to meet the training needs of the Polish Army. The previous one was basically unsuccessful.

title: Polish Army 2024 - Ministry of National Defense press conference
description: On October 4 this year, the management of the Ministry of National Defense organized a press conference under the slogan "Polish Army 2024", during which the Ministry of Defense's achievements to date and some plans for further actions were presented. The conference was attended by Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Defense Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz and all deputy ministers. Each participant discussed a different area of ​​​​activity for which he is responsible in the Ministry of National Defense. Among the many interesting pieces of information, it is worth paying special attention to the presented list of orders for military equipment, which is to be ordered this year.

title: Closer to Polish missiles for Homar-K
description: The issue of manufacturing in Poland corrected missiles for the Homar-K (K239 Chunmoo) launcher is gaining speed. It is not necessary to prove that this is a more crucial subject for capabilities than even manufacturing the missile modules themselves in our country. The Polonization of the 239 mm CGR-080 missiles has clearly accelerated, and even from a direction from which not everyone expected.

title: Nearly PLN 12 billion of American loan for the purchase of Apache helicopters
description: On October 1, 2019, the Ministry of National Defense announced that Poland and the United States had concluded the third direct loan agreement under the FMF (Foreign Military Financing) program. The latest agreement concerns a loan in the amount of USD 3.08 billion (i.e. almost PLN 12 billion at the current USD exchange rate). The funds obtained will be used to finance a contract for the purchase of 96 AH-64E Apache helicopters.

title: Warmate is the weapon of the Korean army
description: On October 2, the WB Group announced the signing of an agreement with the South Korean agency DAPA for the sale of Warmate 3 loitering ammunition to that country. The ceremony took place during the KADEX exhibition held in Gyeryongdae (south of Seoul).

title: Amsta system purchased by a foreign customer
description: The WB Group has signed a contract for the delivery of the Amsta border and critical infrastructure protection system. The advanced Polish solution will go to a foreign user, who will be provided with security in an area of ​​several kilometers. The Amsta system, which uses seismic sensors, can detect violations of the protected zone by people and cars from a long distance, but also low-flying helicopters.

title: Will K9 gun-howitzers kill the Crab?
description: In social media, some analysts are saying that the orders for the delivery of South Korean 155 mm self-propelled gun-howitzers (AHS) K9A1/PL Thunder will “kill” the Polish 155 mm AHS Krab. In this commentary, I will try to explain whether such opinions are justified.

title: Further deliveries of equipment from South Korea
description: On September 11 this year, it was reported that a ship entered the port of Gdynia, on board of which the following were delivered from South Korea for the needs of the Polish Army: 5 K2GF Black Panther tanks, 12 K9A1 Thunder self-propelled gun-howitzers (AHS) and 12 Homar-K (K239 Chunmoo) multiple rocket launcher (MRL) modules. The K2GF tanks will probably go to the tank battalion from Morąg of the 20th Bartoszyce Mechanized Brigade, the K9A1 gun-howitzers to the 1st DAS from Węgorzewo of the 1st Mazury Artillery Brigade (thanks to which the division will already be fully equipped with new guns), while the MRL Homar-K modules will be transferred to Huta Stalowa Wola S.A. for integration with Jelcz P882.57 chassis and the Polish Topaz command system.

title: MSPO 2024: Premiere of the Polish A-KIT integration kit for the IBCS system
description: During this year's MSPO trade fair, the Research and Development Center for Maritime Technology S.A. (CTM) presented for the first time the A-KIT integration kit developed by the company, which allows Polish sensors and effectors to be connected to the American IBCS command system. This is the result of offset agreements concluded as part of Phase I of the Wisła program, as well as a subcontracting agreement of November 29, 2022 signed between CTM and Wojskowe Zakłady Łączności Nr 1 S.A. (WZŁ-1). Based on this contract, WZŁ-1 commissioned CTM to supply A-KIT integration kits in the Bystra radar version, which are to be installed in the MCC mobile communication nodes manufactured by WZŁ-1, which are part of the Polish configuration of the Patriot/IBCS system.

title: MSPO 2024: Premiere of the Sajna radar station
description: During the XXXII International Defence Industry Exhibition held in Kielce, PIT-RADWAR S.A. publicly presented for the first time the prototype of the Multifunctional Fire Control Radar (RWKO) Sajna. It was developed based on development work commissioned in December 2012 and is to be the basic sensor of the short-range ground-based air defence system Kr. Narew. Its role will be to detect, identify and track objects, as well as to initially guide anti-aircraft missiles to them. Initial tests of the radar are currently underway, after which it must still undergo qualification tests, the positive result of which will determine the possibility of concluding a contract for supplies by the Armament Agency.

title: MSPO 2024: Second implementation contract for FlyEye UAV
